Killin it at Dripp's! LA Ktown native traveling south to AZ for vacation with family and who would've thought there would be a dessert gem in this desert! At first glance, the store looks really clean and decorated moderate and appropriate. Alot of cute areas for photo ops(IG Worthy), sit down, relax and study. Being a first timer, the staff there were super friendly when explaining their concept of blending ice cream and treats. Strawberry Shortcake: if Cold Stones was the ice cream mixing giant of the 2000's... Dripps is the ice cream mixing innovators of the future.. seriously. The ice cream was soft and creamy and the flavor profiles of the extra mix ins were delightedly recognizable yet worked well to compliment each other. I really enjoyed all the other extra candy toppings that i got to choose. This treat was just that: A TREAT! Also try the Thunder Buddies! My nephew got it and i loved how well the Reese's blended well with the ice cream! I will definitely be back for more on my next AZ trip, thanks for the awesome visit Dripps!

Came here for their grand opening. I think it went pretty smoothly! I got a mix in of the fruity pebbles with fruity pebbles topping in a drip cone. It was really good! And also a strawberry matcha latte. I was a little disappointed with the latte only cause I feel like I didn't get much of the strawberry purÃ©e. I love the concept though!
Perfect matcha, perfect Thai Tea, perfectly cooked boba, lovely people working! First time we got the Rose tea and sweet matcha, second we got Thai tea and rose tea again perfect spot!

Amazingly delicious ice cream, great service and yummy drinks with a great atmosphere and dont forget to take a pic of your stuff next to the drip it like it's hot sign! Best ice cream I've ever had without a doubt!

Dripps Soft Opening is this week so we stopped by to try out their selection! Here's the vanilla soft serve with oreo mixed in, topped with pocky sticks. It's amazing how the infusion of their ingredients create a completely new experience. They served it in a delicious waffle cone decorated with a sweet drizzle. It felt like we were kids again eating ice cream on a hot summer day. I definitely recommend trying this spot out, they have a variety of mix-ins and add-ons for you to choose to your hearts desire. I'm excited to return again and test out more combinations!!
Love the service and the ice cream! We also tried the drinks, the butterfly rose lemonade is so good!! Highly recommend

This was an awesome experience, a little more than I'd like to spend on milkshakes but definitely a cool experience and I highly recommend doing it at least once, the staff was great the facilities were clean. I will say seating is limited so it can get crowded.

Fun little shop, & friendly service. I've tried both the lychee & peach green tea, and mango black tea; both were delicious. FYI- The butterfly rose lemonade literally taste like a rose so if you're not a fan of your drinks tasting like a flower, then you may not like this one in particular. I cannot eat dairy so I have yet to try their dairy based drinks, however they did tell me that they can substitute with almond or coconut. I will be returning to try out more. :)

Delicious milkshakes. I had my reservations about a place using prepackaged cereal as a main ingredient in the majority of their dishes. But I was wrong. They. Are. Delicious. I also really enjoy watching the assembly process.
Loved it! Perfect for a late night treat! Highly recommend trying out their special shakes

Went here a few weeks ago. We were there later in the evening and there was basically no line. My worldview was completely changed by fruity pebbles in my ice cream! We also got the Apple Jax milkshake...it was good, more of a large ice cream as opposed to a milkshake. Only reason for 4 stars was it took a while to get our order.

We had the Thunder Buddies and the Minion's Treat. Substituted banana for cheesecake on the minion's treat. The treats were delicious, the ambience was modern and hip. I'll definitely be coming back. By far the best ice cream in this part of the valley. My only mild complaint is that I wish they were a little more diligent about wiping down the tables. Go here for instagram-worthy ice cream!

This place is easy to get to, is clean and the staff are nice. I had the Matcha with Strawberry puree and it was so delicious. I thought it would be too sweet and not enough matcha but it was perfect! My friend got the pink crush and that was really good too! Will be back here again

This place is super creative for having cereal-infused ice cream, and it was super delicious too! The shop environment was really Instagram-worthy and the people working were extremely friendly and I got my order within a few minutes. Highly recommend this place if you're looking for dessert that has different textures, perfect for summer!

What friendly service! Walked in looking for a caffeine kick and was immediately greeted with a smile and info about what they served. Fun, little place with a hip atmosphere. Drink was hand delivered to me and oh my goodness....so delicious.

Found this place thru an Arizona based foodie account. I am a matcha fanatic and I ordered the matcha ice cream. The quality is fantastic, but if the owner ever reads this- substitute the chocolate pocky sticks for matcha ones!
We love this place. They got great boba and you can also adjust the sugar level to your liking. Ice cream looks delicious might try it next time. But definitely recommend the Thai tea boba :)

Great ice cream I got the matcha tea I cream but two issues: #1 came a with chocolate pocky sticks instead of matcha. #2 greatly expensive, I bought 2 for $16. Definitely not a great deal. But at the end of the day they at least deserve 4 stars because I was impressed with the taste.
My brother took us here & I gotta say..... one of the best boba places here in AZ. There's one closer to where we're staying for our summer vacay, but we drove out a little just for this place!
Best boba in AZ! So yummy and tapioca is always fresh and chewy! I recommend the brown sugar milk tea or the strawberry matcha latte! Both are so delicious!

Walking into dripps I instantly felt refreshed. The space is bright and vibrant. It's small but just big enough to seat a moderate amount of ice cream eaters. Dripps produces Instagram worthy treats that are catered to cereal addicts. But the don't only have cereal as a topping. You can easily choose from several different candy bars or melty drizzles. There is something for everyone. I ordered a milkshake. Not just any milk shake but a snickers crushed and infused melody of crunchy vanilla goodness. It was delish. My bf ordered a sundae with Capitain crunch and my mom ordered a surprisingly delicious vanilla cone chucked full of strawberry flavor and snicker dust on top (copy cat). We all enjoyed our treats and sat at a cute table near the window. This place gets busy pretty quick but the line seems to move rather quickly. I don't enjoy giving Reviews that are under 5 stars if I enjoyed my experience at a restaurant or establishment. In fact it's annoying to see someone give a rave review under a 4 star rating. *rolls eyes* I'm giving 4 stars because although I enjoyed my experience I was pretty shocked to see how small the ice cream cup was that my bf received. It literally looked like a kids serving. And that in itself costs $6. My milkshake was huge and the cone was huge. I looked around and saw others with larger servings as well. Maybe they messed up the order? Idk. I'll be back again but I don't suggest ordering a cup of ice cream. Get a milkshake or cone.

I went here the other day with my sister and I was surprised by how unique the flavors were! The place itself was designed really nicely and they even offer an aesthetic backdrop for your boba drinks and ice cream. I got the matcha & strawberry with boba and it was so good, it was a little sweet so the next time I come back I'm probably going to have to lessen the sweetness, and my sister got a rose milk tea latte with boba, which was also surprisingly good. Not only were the drinks delicious, but the service was extremely good and the workers were very friendly! Overall, it's definitely a place worth checking out.
I like this place due to great location, amazing nice employees, and interior wise is nice relaxed place. Good place to hang out.

This place is delicious! I love their cereal based soft serve. It is breakfast as desert and each bite turns me into a small child again. I have tried a few of their drinks and most have an ingredient I don't like such as matcha or Jasmin but my friends who are not against floral as a beverage love their drinks.

I forgot to post my review on this spot a few weeks ago but wanted to go back to it since it was a fun place experience. Mostly really into the decor of this spot, if your looking to go somewhere cute and trendy for pics. But I also really liked their boba tea and they have some really unique options to choose from. I'll be back to try their ice cream soon...looked amazing too!

My boyfriend and I tried this place and it was pretty good! You get to choose what kind of cereal or ingredients get blending into your ice cream or milkshake & then what cereal, candy or other toppings go on top! Good place to go if you're craving ice cream or just something sweet

First time here and won't be the last. Thank you to the friendly staff. The strawberry cheesecake was rich but not overly sweet. The graham crackers on the ice cream stayed crunchy till the last bite! Both of the matcha drinks were fantastic!
I took my son and his bestie here for a quick treat. Really loved it. The drinks are as refreshing as they are pretty, and the staff is very friendly!

The rose milk latte was delicious and pretty to look at. The matcha coconut was refreshing without being too sweet the boba was chewy and fresh. Will go again. A little bit of a long wait but I think that is because they were cutting open a coconut. The ice cream looked delicious as well different options. Small menu but since each drink is hand crafted the taste is superb and doesn't need a big menu to compensate.

Yum-mmy!!!! Me and my husband stopped in here and ordered ice cream. After we placed our orders we were chatting with the girl that took our order about the other items they make. I first off have to say that I absolutely LOVE matcha! It's a great natural source of caffeine as well as a rich source of antioxidants. She asked if we have heard of matcha, I simply said yes but definitely went into my matcha connoisseur mode. She pointed out photos of fresh drinks they make and some including matcha. She proceeds with telling us that they get their matcha directly shipped in from Japan! Which made me ecstatic!! Back to reviewing our order, I got the Strawberry Shortcake and my husband the Cookies & Cream which were both lovely to look at, delicious and super filling. We'll be back for sure for dessert but I'll be back asap to try their matcha drinks!

Got the rose milk latte, which was delicious. I'm glad this place started serving boba! We got a small, I believe, for ~$5. Tables were sort of filthy, so we had to wipe them down ourselves before sitting, but I believe there was only one person working behind the counter at the time, and he was understandably very busy with orders by himself. The flavors are pretty unique, so I'd go again!

My friend and I found this place on a whim, and we are so glad we stopped by. Many people come here for ice cream, but you have got to try the drinks as well. I love the Strawberry Matcha Latte, and all the coffee drinks.

I visited the day after their grand opening and it was still super packed, but worth it for their soft serve with their cinnamon toast mixed in and cheesecake bites on top. I just wish there was more cheesecake bites on top. I also got their rose milk and was slightly disappointed because there just wasn't enough rose for me. However, I will definitely be back to try other drinks and to get more soft serve. The space could be considered small, but has a super photogenic leafy wall for photos. It was also super nice of them to continue their BOGO deal for the week a total steal!

Around the chandler area this evening and saw this on yelp. Saw that they had matcha and I LOVE matcha from back in Cali. The matcha coffee was perfect after a big meal. Please open one out in the west valley! We need more stuff like this!!
Love the vibe! Got the Jasmine Milk tea & loved it. Great choice of music. Will definitely come back.

I have been wanting to try this place for a few months and today I finally made it in. So happy I did. I had a small scoop of the matcha ice cream with fruity pebbles mixed in and it was DELICIOUS. I didn't get her name but the sweet young lady that helped me was very knowledgeable and suggested I get the matcha coffee. She was even kind enough to Google items that we were unsure had gluten in it. I really appreciated her assistance and I will definitely go back again! Oh yeah and I got two matcha coffees. One for the ride home to Sahuarita and one for tmrw morning.
This is very high quality and tastes super good! You can get super creative with the flavors and mix-ins. I'll be coming back many more times!
I work across the street and tried rewind for the first time today! I am in love with it. The girl in the front was the sweetest! I definitely will be going back!

Our first time here and we loved it! My husband had a plain vanilla on a waffle cone and I had Bourbon Caramel which was to die for delicious! Not too sweet and the ice cream was so creamy. The prices were so reasonable for such great quality. Both staff members were very friendly. We will be back!

With all the hype over cereal mixed into ice cream at Dripps, my family had to give them a try. We ordered the Strawberry Shortcake cereal infused ice cream cone, a strawberry matcha latte & the rose milk latte. The Strawberry Shortcake was captain crunch cereal, cheesecake & strawberries mixed into vanilla ice cream and topped with graham crackers & strawberry sauce. The ice cream mix was good, sweeter with the cereal & add ins. The strawberry matcha latte had strawberry purÃ©e on the bottom, then milk layer and topped with matcha. The rose milk latte has rose syrup on the bottom, milk layer in the middle and topped with blue butterfly pea flower tea. Both drinks were good but similar to what other boba places are serving nowadays. I would recommend the cereal infused ice cream cone over the drinks because it is more unique in flavor.

Omg!! You need this place in your life especially vegans!! Vegan ice cream was amazing, plus you get to add your own toppings! So so good always trying to do dairy free and I will definitely be here every other week. Soo good
Delicious! Sometimes the wait is pretty long if there are a lot of people in line, but people in line means they have a great product!

Delicious and unique ice cream/drinks. I don't think the ice cream is worth the seven bucks though UNLESS the person making it puts in the effort into make it aesthetically pleasing. Because come one, that's what most people go in there for. One visit my ice cream cone looked squashed and lopsided, the next it was tall and proud with strawberry syrup that I didn't receive on my first strawberry shortcake cone. I'd take an out of town person here to show that AZ does have some cool spots, but I wouldn't come here on the regular. *side note- no substitutions on the signature combos. This includes simply omitting a topping due to allergies.

I first came here during their grand opening when the line was so long that it snaked out of their store. I did not regret the wait at all as the their ice cream and boba did not disappoint. I ordered their rose milk tea both times I visited which is both visually pleasing and tastes really good! I also ordered their famous cereal ice cream both times I visited which even had my mom impressed who wasn't planning to eat any of the ice cream. The worker at the counter was very nice and gave our family good recommendations from the menu as well as samples. She tried her best to accommodate to our needs and our orders came out pretty fast. I plan to visit again soon! The atmosphere of the place as well as their location is nice as well.
Amazing milkshake and great service. I will definitely be back to this local place. This was my first time

After seeing this place pop up on my yelp, I thought id give it a try since we were in the area. We went on a Sunday afternoon so there was no waiting and we were able to order right away. My husband ordered the Thai tea and I ordered the vanilla soft serve infused with fruity pebbles topped with circus animal cookies. You can order from one of their pre made menu or create your own. They offer a variety of ingredients you can infuse into your ice cream. The way the mix the ingredients into the ice cream makes it taste so good. I got mine in a cup so I can share with my little one or you can order your ice cream on a waffle cone. They also offer drinks & teas if you're not in the mood for some ice cream. Definitely come try this place out :)
AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS! Such unique flavors that blew me away. Highly recommend! The workers are incredibly sweet and nice.
Manager reached out letting me know that the issue had been resolved so that it would not happen again. I've been back several times since and it has been great every time.
This ice cream was so tasty. Cute, quaint little place, and very sweet cashier at the front. She was quick to make our order and it was a beautiful presentation. Love it for a quick treat.

Very cute location! Very aesthetic. They have ice cream and boba options. Seemed a little pricey for what the ice cream was - $6 for vanilla soft serve blended with a cereal and 1 topping. I had Cinnamon Toast Crunch with honey drizzle. It comes in a cup or cone at no additional cost.

A very great ice cream place, the portion is hugeeeee! Love the different variety they give, mixed with numerous selections of cereals. The rose milk tea was pretty good, definitely would recommend for the ice cream lovers to come and try! Ice cream definitely tasted very balanced. Not too sweet not too bland!

Love Dripps! Such a unique concept to mix cereal in with the ice cream. Every flavor I have tried has been delicious. My favorite is the Reese Puffs mixed in with Butterfinger topping. Such a yummy treat!

I was here over Christmas day, it was nice and quiet. The backdrop and neon lights is key to be deemed an IG destination as you do a quick photo sesh to make those likes and comments rain. I had the sweet matcha drink while my friends ordered the strawberry cheesecake soft serve and the rose milk tea. I was able to try their orders and I liked it all. I would definitely come back here.
Great environment and friendly staff. It was my first time here and they walked me through what I could do and then what their favorite was. Will deff be back again!

I found this place on Instagram and was in awe. It was closer to my boyfriends house than it was mine so I took a screen shot of the name and knew when I went down there we'd have to try it. Yesterday we so happened to pass it on our way home. Although it was a gloomy raining cold day I said I HAVE TO TRY IT. I was impressed. I did mix in fruit loops and he even told me that was a bad idea, yet somehow couldn't keep his spoon out of my cup. It was absolutely phenomenal, and I love soft serve. This is better because you get to mix in what you want and the soft serve is very creamy and thicker than others I've had. Only downside is it's a bit pricey for (~$7) for a small (cup) of ice cream. Worth it and will go back!
The best milk tea shop love that they have milk alternatives. Top Drinks in my opinion, Iced Matcha w coconut milk or Rose Milk tea w Almond milk

I would have to say that I'm not a huge fan of their matcha drinks, but I did enjoy their Matcha Soft Serve. I think it might be because there was so much milk I couldn't really taste the matcha. But, I mentioned I did like the soft serve. It was incredibly rich in flavor and wasn't super sweet, which was perfect. I got it the chocolate dipped cone topped with gold flakes and chocolate shavings. And believe it or not, the chocolate complimented the matcha very well. The shop overall was super cute and aesthetic so it's definitely photogenic. It's quite close to my house so I'd probably come back if I had a sweet craving.

My boyfriend and I wanted to check this place out for awhile now, but the location is so far from where we live. The inside of this place is so cute and clean, definitely insta worthy. What I ordered was a cone mixed in with cinnamon toast crunch, topped with cheesecake bites. Costed roughly around $6. I've read yelp reviews about ice cream being costly, but lemme tell ya, it was so much ice cream, I couldn't even reach the cone!! It was so good and my tummy was so happy, but full at the same time. This ice cream cone could definitely be shared with others. My boyfriend got a milk shake with apple jacks mixed in. They also topped the milkshake with the cereal as well. My boyfriend enjoyed it a lot, he finished the whole thing. We will definitely be back soon and can't wait to try their teas.

This place is extremely cute. Very aesthetic with a wall that I've seen a ton of people take pictures at. The ice cream is also great! A little overpriced for the cones but yummy nevertheless. The boba was also delicious (it was sweet and soft). Thai tea is my go-to and they can customize the sweetness levels.

This place was having a bogo special, so I was definitely interested in checking it out. My friend and I got the rose milk tea and the presentation was nice. It was in three layers: pink, white, and baby blue. You can also get it with boba. You're encouraged to stir it so all of the layers will mix. It was really good! Lastly, this place has really nice wallpaper and a wall of leaves for a good Instagram moment. Next time I go, I will try the ice cream. It looks like everyone around me got an ice cream and seemed to enjoy it.

Awesome ice cream concept! They mix in your favorite breakfast cereal to vanilla ice cream to make new flavors. The texture is a little different but still overall a great dessert! I tried the caramel apple and it was amazing!! All the flavors blended really well and the cheesecake pieces were an awesome addition. I recommend going back to try every combination! I think I'll get the cinnamon toast crunch next!

DRIPPS is my answered prayer and biggest blessing to the Chandler area this year. I'm not kidding when I say I come here at least once a week. When they first opened in September, it was even more than that, taking advantage of their soft opening and grand opening discount and BOGO. They are an awesome company, from the owners over at Pokitrition. The star here is CEREAL INFUSED SOFT SERVE. And no, it is not just some cereal just sprinkled into the ice cream. It is generous amounts of cereal of your choice literally DRILLED in and it is the best cereal ice cream in the world. I am a huge fan of Christina Tosi's Milkbar cereal ice cream, but Dripps takes it to a whole other level. I can assure you your favorite childhood cereal is among their choices. They do have signature creations you could choose from and mix and match toppings, but what I love to do is just choose a cereal and use the same cereal as topping. Their "supporting actor" I would say is their matcha drinks. If you love matcha, you will be in heaven. They use real QUALITY matcha. Great flavor, good caffeine kick without the jitters. Next favorite is the rose milk tea. It's not too "flowery" it is more milky which I love. Their milk teas are good as well. The only one negative thing is the boba balls are not as soft as I would love them to be but I enjoy milk teas without boba so they get a pass. The whole concept is just amazing and I'll shout it from the rooftops if I could. I LOVE DRIPPS!
Love this local spot and love its sister company pokitrition. I think it's amazing they have a coconut based ice cream that is just as delicious!
I love Dripps, they have great customer service. The staff is friendly and helpful. The ice cream is amazing, the cereal is not soggy at all.

More of these modern dessert places are popping up and it makes Arizona more fun! I got an ice cream cone that was "infused" with Cinnamon Toast Crunch and strawberries as a topping. I thought it was enjoyable, but there were some cereal parts that were oddly chewy, like they've gone stale. The place looks very comfortable and it has cute, modern decor that you can take pictures with. Either the marble table, the palm leave wallpaper, the grey walls, or the "succulent" wall that has a glowing sign which reads, "Drip it like it's hot." It's a cute place and it has some creative ice cream flavors. My cousin got a matcha drink and the matcha is very high grade, but we both thought it was very heavy on the matcha.
I the ice cream , great Coustumer services ,clean place, LOVE LOVE There matcha te definitely coming back , friendly environment .

I have been to this place a few times. They have ice cream infused with cereal or milk tea drinks. The cereal-infused ice cream is a pretty neat concept. I don't think I have been to another dessert shop that does this. They definitely give you a lot of toppings. This is a great place for meeting up with friends after a meal and we just want something light to snack on and catch up. The drinks in my opinion weren't as great as other places. I ordered the jasmine milk tea which was a little light compared to other boba shops. However I really love matcha and will have to try their matcha drinks next time.
Tatum walks up before we leave and says "you have the best ice cream!" Yummy and unique. Def going back and coming from Scottsdale, I must say it's worth the drive. Get it!!! Greg #myfitmortgage

I recently moved to the area, and as a passionate foodie, was looking for a new boba/ice cream shop to feed my cravings! Search no further! The decor is beautiful, and the staff were friendly; they gave some recommendations of their popular drinks, and they also do seasonal ones too! I decided to go with the Rose Milk Tea which has hints of floral notes; absolutely refreshing and not too sweet. My friend created his own ice cream with toppings, but don't worry, they've got popular creations of their own if you can't make up your mind. Overall, a great quality dessert place, and I will definitely be back!

My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday around 3pm and we expected a long line of people. To our surprise, it was just us and 2 other people. The inside was clean and well kept except for the couch they have. We figured a lot of people like to sit on that couch so there's some ice cream stains on it. It was our first time here and the menu is very self explanatory so it's easy to order what you want. The service was great, we enjoyed our ice cream and milkshake. Would definitely recommend to a friend!
Great menu with a great selection! I ordered ice cream and a rose milk latte and both were phenomenal! Staff were super nice and helpful! The orders came out so fast
Best Boba I've ever had. I'm a hardcore Boba fanatic. Really surprised as to the price. Wouldn't mind paying $2 more per cup to be honest.

My sister found this place on yelp and it looked like an awesome place to check out.OMG was I right!!They greeted us as we entered including anyone who entered and lemme tell ya this place got rather busy quick even though when we walked in there was only a couple people before us!Now I can see why! So many options regarding topping wise and mix in I loved it and the fact that they had all kinds of cereal options for you the mix in was amazing.I ended up getting a mix in swirl which consisted of a vanilla base ice cream and my choice of mix was lucky charms which they grinder into the ice cream yes!And I got a choice topping as well and I went with the marshmallow charms omg SOOOO GOOD! My sis ended up getting a matcha milk tea of some sort with boba! Hands down best ice cream place I've been to so far! Most def a place to go and check out if you're in the mood for some ice cream or drinks!
Absolutely amazing. Flavor combos are unreal ... if you like classic cereals, you have to visit this place!!
This place is soo good super cute, highly recommend the Cookie Crisp ice cream. It was very cheap as well which I was surprised. I will definitely be back to try different flavors :-)

SO GOOD!!! Been here 3 times already and love it. Wasn't sure if ice cream and cereal would be a great combo but it is excellent! Never had an issue with staff or service even when they are busy. Will definitely be back :)
This place is BOMB! My husband and I LOVE all their milkshakes. Definitely has turned into one of our go to sweets joint. Perfection!
Super cool place. So many dairy free options and a very nice staff! I would highly recommend it!

Wow! Came in not expecting much else besides ice cream but they add cereal into it and it makes a WORLD of a difference. My order: strawberry shortcake Reminds me of the ice cream bar back in the day! Definitely coming back to try all the other signatures!

I looooOVe the matcha and thai tea with boba here!! The texture of the boba is always perfect. The fruity pebble infused ice cream is my fav for ice cream! Love the cute instagram-able and family friendly interior, and customer service is always so awesome!

Just had the strawberry short cake ice cream and my wife had the one with bananas and teddy graham crackers and both were really good! Thanks to Keith for recommending this place that his friend owns!
YUMMM!!!! I can't wait to try all of the different flavors! This place is a must try!
Came here for the first time and ordered the butterfly rose lemonade, it's really good. I'll come back again!
Very instagram-able interior, and the menu is easy to understand. I looove cereal but this takes it to a whole new level! My favorite is the Cap'n Crunch milkshake.

The ice cream is good and plentiful. The mix concept is different and the mixer is kinda cool to watch. The teas were decent and definitely pretty. Overall, it's a good spot and if I'm in the area again, I'd get an ice cream and a Tea to go.
Rose milk latte! It taste delicious, must try! We got there on the second day after grand opening and they were so kind to give us a discount as we missed their grand opening day :)

Such a unique concept, yet so simple. Cereal infused ice cream. My mouth is watering just thinking about how good this ice cream is. They even have a dairy free option which my daughter took advantage of. Would definitely recommend this joint to everyone and plan to go back in the near future.
It was the best ice-cream. My daughter loved it as well. We will be back soon. Don't forget to order macha coco together with your ice-cream. It was perfect match.

Excellent, fresh ice cream with many eclectic toppings (and a drill to make room for them in the ice cream!) make Dripps a great place to go for dessert or a tasty treat. The iced Matcha green tea latte is absolutely delicious and a great way to get some antioxidants. Took one star off for the smaller space and time to wait for order. Otherwise, the food, drinks & service is top notch!

Love this place! We come here on the regular. Their ice cream is delicious (strawberry shortcake is my fave) and their jasmine milk tea is pretty good too. A HUGE plus that they also have a non-dairy option.
Very good ice cream and friendly management. Great place. They were very helpful in getting thing together to celebrate our grandson's birthday. Had a great time!

Wonderful new addition to the area. I thought it would be just another ice cream place, but I was pleasantly surprised to learn differently. This was my first experience with Matcha. The employees have answered all my questions and take excellent care of me. I feel welcome each time I come in with a hello and focused attention. Definitely a new favorite of mine!
DRIPPS is amazing because they infuse cereal (nostalgia) to my ice cream! Huge favorite: Reese's Puff milkshake every-time!!!! But this month I had to get the pumpkin milkshake!!!!

I have been searching for a great Matcha Latte. I have been to many places and have yet to find a shop that takes the proper steps and uses the proper tools when preparing a matcha drink. I can happily end my search and say I found my favorite place because Dripps makes the greatest drinks!! I love the Strawberry Matcha Latte.

Worth all the hype. I got vanilla ice cream with Fruity pebbles infused with cheese cake bites on top and i couldn't stop eating it. Little bit of a drive for me from my house but it was worth it. Hopefully they open a location closer. 10/10 would recommend going.

It is very rare for me to like something for a long period of time, I move on too quick you could say, but ice cream has always been my go-to dessert. Like many people, I'm especially a fan of ice cream that includes surprises inside like cookies and cream, rocky road, pistachio, ect. You can imagine my excitement when I heard that there was an establishment that created custom cereal/ice cream mixtures. Although feeling skeptical at first, as soon as I walked in, I was greeted by young cheerful workers and soothing lo-fi music (with an occasional pop hit here and there). The wall facing customers when they enter the store is decorated with leaves and lit up neon lights that spell "Dripp it like it's hot," an original idea that adds a classy ambience to the shop (also perfect for taking pictures). The store isn't very big, but the furnishings are strategically placed to make it feel roomy and it also gives customers the option to enjoy their ice cream sitting on stools, padded chairs, a patio, or even a couch. The oddly satisfying thing about this establishment is that the temperature inside isn't so cold to the point where you feel rushed to leave; a quality that is hard to find with many other ice cream shops in the area. If you tend to have a hard time making decisions when presented with a bunch of choices, then you'll be relieved to hear that there are six "signature" options which feature the most popular mixes so that you don't end up making a bad mix. "Thunder buddies" is my personal favorite which features Reeses puffs, bananas, almonds, and teddy bear graham crackers. Truthfully, I thought that the ice cream wouldn't be much different from that of Cold Stone or any other ice cream competitor, but the cereal gave the ice cream a crunch that can be best described by my significant other as "heavenly." They also gave the ice cream to me exactly as it had appeared on the menu (we could see the workers placing the teddy bear crackers on their feet in the ice cream). While I've never been a fan of chocolate covered cones, people have the option to have their cone dipped in blue or pink chocolate (or both) for an extra dollar. I found it funny at first, but they also have an option to buy a bowl of any of the cereal options for $4.50. Even though that may seem like an unfair price for a bowl of cereal, it makes sense when you realize how desperate someone would have to be to pay $4.50 for a bowl of cereal when they could get a whole box for $3.00. The ice cream cones and milkshakes, however, are a bit more on the pricey side and cost me $5.95 before tax. Keeping the bowls of cereal in mind, you could just go to a supermarket and buy a whole tub of ice cream for the same price BUT you wouldn't easily be able to make a cereal-ice cream as fresh and crunchy as what Dipps gives you. For the experience, quality, and price I would recommend this place for most occasions including dates, family outings, and especially on cheat day!
Got ice cream infused with honey bunches of oats cereal with banana and pocky sticks. Was delicious and the workers were nice and efficient!

I came across this after eating some poke at the same plaza. The brightness and the decor caught my eye. After looking at their simple menu I understood their concept. I chose fruity pebbles for the milkshake mix in and that nostalgia hit me. Oh those kids memories! The milkshake was flavorful and soft. I had a sample of their matcha late and it was on point: not too sweet and strong matcha taste. The thing that bothered me was that the place was packed and I had to share the table with another party.
this place is so cute :') their cereal ice cream mixes are so creative and i love the interior of the place! the yellow neon sign on the green hedge wall is a great place to take pics with friends

This place is amazing! Great customer service and delicious ice cream and teas. I drove from mesa to try this place out and it definitely fulfilled my prego cravings. Would recommend this place to everyone!

I tried Dripps for a second time today and I was really impressed by the drink I got. The owner recommended a matcha coffee (I'm usually not a fan of matcha or coffee) and it was surprisingly so good. I'll never drink coffee straight but I took a sip of the coffee before I stirred the drink and I could probably have a whole glass of that cold brew. Considering I was the only order, I think it did take some time. They seemed to crush the matcha powder (or something time consuming) fresh and put it in which is nice to see it be fresh but it took a few minutes for a simple matcha coffee being the only order there. I will be back for another. Thanks

This place is so dope! Their ice cream creations are insanely good, and their drinks are amazing. I had a rose boba tea here and the flavor explodes in your mouth. So dang good. Can't wait to try more stuff. Their staff is always friendly, the ambiance is pretty cool too. Everyone needs to try this place out ASAP!
Great customer service, relaxing environment & delicious desserts! Definitely would recommend this place and coming back again!

I came in today with two other people. There were no other customers present waiting, so we didn't have to wait terribly long. We immediately appreciated the interior design. The two women in the back came out and greeted us and took our order. I ordered a brown sugar milk tea, one of the people with me ordered jasmine milk tea, and the other person with me ordered a chocolate chip cookie dough milk shake. The person with me did not like their jasmine milk tea, but the other person with me loved their chocolate chip cookie dough shake. I enjoyed the milk tea and felt it had the proper sweetness, nothing too overpowering. I ordered a pink rose milk tea. I loved the floral flavor, but felt the sweetness should have been toned down a little bit. The other person with me whom ordered a jasmine milk tea ordered a Thai iced tea. They said that it was better than a lot of the restaurants we previously ordered Thai tea from. The woman who took my second round of orders encouraged us to try the soft serve the next time we visited and recommended the strawberry shortcake. We will definitely be returning and I look forward to trying the strawberry shortcake.

I loved their ice cream cereal and their Rose Tea Lemonade! It was nice to feel greeted when walking in. Justin explained the menu really well and gave me his recommendations. I went with the Thunder Buddies and it was so creamy and tasty. The wait was a good ten minutes though but it was worth it. I'll be back soon!
One of my favorite new ice cream spots. The quality of the ice cream is great and the different combos they have are amazing. The team there is so friendly!!!
Cute little place. Mainly ice cream mixtures instead boba or drinks. Nice for the summer hangout! Very casual laidback place.

Friendly faces greeted us with a smile as soon as we walked in. The lady behind the register was informative and genuine(wish I would have got her name). She explained everything to us and told us how it worked. Yummy ice cream. I had Reese's puffs ice cream with brownies and bills wafers, YUMM! My boyfriend tried their strawberry shortcake creation, both of us were satisfied. I would recommend this place to family & friends!

Stopped by Dripps because it was conveniently located near Chandler mall and I've heard many good things about this place. I had their strawberry shortcake ice cream. Super impressed! The ice cream was creamy with the right amount of cereal mixed in to give some crunchiness. The staff was great and the place itself was simple, cute, and clean. Next time, I want to try one of their drink options (they have so many!). Highly recommend visiting!

Im a big fan of matcha and this tasted up to par with my last Japan's trip. I could taste the matcha well on the iced matcha latte. I tried their matcha coffee and it was really interesting and good. Im not really a coffee person but i still enjoyed it. I havent tried their ice cream yet but it looked so pretty i might try it next time. Parking lot was full on a saturday night so that was annoying.

I'm Asian and I am lactose. I'm glad there's a vegan option for my tummy. I am in love with ice cream again. For their drinks they also have dairy alternatives, I choose the almond milk with my matcha latte. They are busy in the weeknights and the lines are sometimes long but I think it's worth it. Last time I came they didn't have a high chair for my niece so I suggested them to have one. Hopefully they take my comment into account.

This is a fun place. I like that it tries to be different by having the cereal mix ins. It sets it a parts from other ice cream places. It is cute inside and has cute instagram shots. It is a little on the pricey side, so that is why I knocked it down to 4 stars. However, good quality and fun place.
Favorite ice cream place in chandler and only ice cream place I go. Delicious milkshakes and I get the fruity pebbles milkshake with granola on top 100% recommended

What a fun new idea. It reminds me a lot of Milk in NYC. The ice cream is really Fluffy and enjoyable and has a really nice taste no matter the mix in you get. We got the lucky charms and really enjoyed it! I'll be coming here again for sure. It's my favorite place to get ice cream in Phoenix at the moment.
Lived up to my expectations after watching Cake Boss all those years. Went back three times during our visit! Definitely recommend finding and their Restaurant across the way is awesome too!

Last time I visited this place was in 2015, and I had a cannoli and hot chocolate after the Rock n Roll Las Vegas half marathon! This time, I got a slice of the strawberry frosting rainbow cake, and UGH. This is what an excellent frosting-to-cake ratio looks like! It's a large slice, so it makes an extra special treat when you want something sweet. I gave four stars because I think the packaging could be nicer (shift from plastic to paper/cardboard).
Highly recommend My mother ordered a slice of confetti cake from here and it was delicious!! What a way to celebrate 50th with a slice of something so delicious! Date of visit 3/6/22

Date of visit: 4/11/22 Having snagged a piece of rainbow cake from one of the ubiquitous vending machines found on the Strip (seriously, they are almost as plentiful as Starbucks here!), my love and I decided to grab a piece from the source, Carlo's Bake Shop located in the Palazzo. Expect a wait to place your order, this place is pretty much always busy. I will say that I don't love the setup for the line, it's hard to see what you want to order without feeling like you're holding up the line for everyone else. I do wish there was a way to better scope out what they have before it's time to order, I feel that would improve the flow of traffic as well. Staff was friendly and the cake was fantastic, it even kept for over a day as we had bites here and there in the hotel room as to not gorge ourselves completely! I would certainly come back and try some other things the next time we are here, or even just get another slice of this cake!

Wanted an afternoon pick me up and grabbed a lobster tail and a cannoli. The lobster tail filling was INCREDIBLE. Super rich, creamy, and not too sweet. The lobster tail was also FULL of the french pastry cream- they definitely didn't skimp here. The pastry shell was a bit on the harder side and a bit bland in taste, but the powdered sugar kept it lightly sweet and it was overall a good contrast to the cream in my opinion. The cannoli is HUGE and absolutely full of the ricotta cream. I didn't love that the shell didn't seem super fresh but the filling was pretty good. Both pastries were on the pricier side at $6.25 for the lobster tail and $5.50 for the cannoli, but would come back for the lobster tail!

Was totally stoked to try this place as I haven't had the chance to go to the NJ original location. I got 2 different pastries - the regular cannoli and the regular "lobster tail". Very creamy and delicious.

We waited in line twice here while staying at the Palazzo. We tried some cookies, cupcakes, and cannoli. My favorite was the chocolate dipped cannoli. The lines are long but they move you through pretty quick.

I absolutely loved Carlo's Bakery!!! It took me over an hour to find it, but it was so worth it! The line was super long but their goods were to die for Next time I'm in Vegas, this will be my first & last stop!! (I got so much more than this)

Best cannoli I've ever eaten, but very pricey! We got 3 original cannoli and a traditional lobster tail and it totaled $23 seriously? $5 a pastry is pretty steep but like I said the cannoli was the best My husband and I have ever had and we will definitely come back for more cannoli next time we're in Vegas

The best cannolis hands-down ever! The much-anticipated Savory delicious lobster tail cannoli was to die for. I would go there every day but I got to watch my waistline. It's a little bit on the expensive side $5 per cannoli but it's on Las Vegas Boulevard what do you expect...

First of all I want to thank Crystal for her wonderful service and beautiful smile thank you very much now as far as the desert unbelievably good the seats are extremely comfortable and the drinks are delicious we have a beautiful view of the street you can't ask for anything else please come on in and check this place out

There was no line it was perfect and went fast. I got the Carmel lobster claw and it was delicious, it was stuffed full of Carmel custard. My friend got the sugar sprinkle cookie was bland and not buttery. The chocolate dipped cannoli was amazing. The hazelnut creampuff was ok it was messy and the hard chocolate on top made it difficult to get a good non messy bite.

If you're a fan of Cake Boss on TLC you should know the name of this famous bakery shop . its located in side the Venetian Hotel. There always the long line , if you do not wait there is an option order online and pick up within 30 mins. Lobster tail pastry is a must try , this original ancestor of the lobster tail was called La Santarosa. The structure of it obviously resembles the architecture of a lobster's tail, as its shell is made of layered and crusty baked pastry, interlocking in the way that the parts of a lobster's tail does. How wonderful!!

The cannoli's and the lobster tail were amazing! I was really hesitant after reading all the reviews online. But my husband said to give it a try anyway and good thing I listened! Oh and their brownie!!! O M G! It was amazing! I'm not the chocolate fan, my husband is. He had me try it and it was so moist and it just made my mouth water! Their customer service was good. We were greeted and helped right away! I'd recommend others to go and try it out for themselves!

They didn't have lobster tails :( womp womp womp. My little brother & I are huge fans of the show therefore trying this bake shop was a must! I ordered 2 cheesecakes, brownie. Cookie, 2 cupcakes some crumb cake my total was $40 not bad. They didn't taste out of this world but I enjoyed every pastry! Line wasn't bad @ all and I will be returning :)

I went in the morning and there was only one customer in front of me and the 2 ladies helping the front of the store were very nice and quick! The pastries, were amazing!! I tried the eclair, cream puff, canolis (obviously), tiramisu and the chocolate mousse tart! All were great! They did charge me for one tart that didn't end up in my box, but accidents happen! Would definitely go there again!!
Got the cookies and cream cake slice and it was pretty good... I think it would've tasted better a bit chilled or something and the prices are outrageous for just a slice of cake it was $9...

Lots of mention of lines in previous reviews but there were only a few people there when I went. It was midday, midweek. I got two linzers and a cannoli. I haven't tried the linzer yet but the cannoli, wow! Best I've had in years. Might even give nonna a run for her money (shhhhhh).
Chocolate lobster tail is a must!! We are going back for more to bring home with us!!

I was thrilled to visit this bakery, I was not thrilled to make that 30 minute line. The choices are so limited!! Nothing like the Hoboken original bakery shown on tv. The canolis not so good I guess since we went late they were probably there for hours. The reason I gave it 4 stars regardless the bad stuff the lobster tail was amazing!!!!!! It was big, tasty and great prize! I am now looking forward to go to the one in Hoboken in December!

I got a couple cookies, not much appealed to me there in my opinion. There was so many people here. it was busy. Took about 20 minutes just to get a couple cookies and a mug. Lots of people watch the show I guess! There was alot of different baked goods, and it was not too pricey. The pricey items were the variety of gift box cookies, which are small, not worth it in my opinion.
Everything was perfect I wish there was one closer! Soooo yummy! Please come to Longview Texas!!

Visited the bakery and tried the famous lobster tail. It was delicious and I was bummed I didn't buy more. It was one of the best baked goods I have ever had! Also purchased a Carlos Bakery mug and love using it for my morning coffee! I didn't buy as much as I hoped here and completely regret it now. I can't wait to visit Vegas again and come back to the bakery! Next time I definitely want to try the restaurant too!!

Great place to grab a snack and some coffee. The lines appear long at times but really only take about 5 minutes to get through. The day I went they had a special that provided you a free Carlos water bottle with 24.00 purchase. Nice souvenir if you're from out of town.

Omg omg omg!! I came here 4 years ago to relish on the famous traditional Canoli and Lobster tail.. I came back today reminiscing the day I was here last time. Beautiful place, great staff, quick service.. a place I would recommend all to definitely try and not to forget the traditional Canoli and Lobster tail. You can't come here and not try one of these!
Best cannolis ever. Must get them. They are so awesome. I love the creme. Its not too sweet. I always try to make a stop whenever Im in vegas.

My family and I have tried many of their bakery items. In my opinion, stay away from the floured cakes, cupcakes (dry as a bone, better cupcakes at walmart) cookies and donuts. Go for the italian and any of the custard filled pastries, such as the Lobster tail and Napoleons with the powdered sugar and the cannolis... Cheesecakes are OK. Also anything with whip cream. Those are the pastires where they shine. They discontinued one of the items I like, the cannoli cake tower... Maybe I was the only one buying it? Overall, this place satisfies our longing for the italian baked goods in NYC Little Italy, where we all moved from.... such as, Ferrara's. Has been hard to find decent italian pastries out here in the west coast. This one comes close. Have never been to the Carlo's in NYC because I never heard of it. Maybe it didn't exist back then. But it would be hard to beat the italian bakeries in my neighborhood.

The bakery is across from Buddy's large restaurant that has a great view of the strip. The bakery is a little small, but the cannolis and lobster tail were very good. Not too sweet, just how I like my desserts. The lobster tail tasted like a cream puff but even better. I didn't get to try an actual cake, but they looked just as good. Tasted better than some desserts I tried at Bacchanal at Caesar's!

So, my friend wanted to stop by this bakery before heading back home to get some goodies. I bought a couple cannoli's and a "lobster tail." I can't say anything wrong about the cannoli, because it was delicious, but i personally thought that the "lobster roll" wasn't one of the best pastries i ever had. I bought my daughter a heart shaped cookie as well, and she ate that thing pretty quick.. lol.

I have cake boss recording on DVR and I watch it all the time. I didn't even know he had a shop in Las Vegas until I saw a banner. I knew I had to stop by because I am a fan !! Obviously this isn't the original shop in Hoboken but I always wanted to try the pastries they talk about on the show. Lobster tails are the ones that they claim to be the most popular and boy did they look good so I was super excited to try one. The line on Monday morning at around five in the afternoon was short and the wait was not long at all. We decided to try the mini dark chocolate mousse cake, red velvet mini cake, tiramisu, and lobster tail. All the mini cakes were around $10 while lobster tail around $6. The employees were friendly and knowledgable Everything tastes wonderful. Don't know if the prices are the same in Hoboken but it is Vegas here so price is whatever. I'm just so happy I had something to hold me over until I can visit his shoe in New Jersey one day :)

depending on the time frame that you arrive the wait is ridiculous. I am grateful however that I was able to experience the flavor of some of the sweet treats.Enjoyed the ability to watch the workers produce these sweet treats.

Well, we stayed in line for 1 hour and 10 minutes... was it worth it... hmmmm.... I would say yes... but, if you truly have some time to kill in Vegas... or really need to stay in one place not to make a full of yourself walking drunk all over the Vegas strip. Definitely delicious! The famous "Lobster Tail" pastry is worth the wait. But if you are going to stay that long in that line, load up on them! Other items on the menu are just like in many other bakeries... but with better presentation. To help you stay sane while standing in line, you have a chance to see how a professional cake decorator puts together some of the cakes that you see on the shelves as you enter the bakery. Quite fun... even if you are an adult.. even more fun if you have already had a few (or a dozen) cocktails before getting to the bakery... (just make sure you are not drooling all over the window)...

I first heard of Carlo's Bake Shop from browsing around YouTube and discovering TLC's series, Cake Boss. After finding out that they had a location in Vegas (and I was heading out to Vegas in a few weeks), I was looking forward to trying out their TV-featured pastries. I had high hopes, just like every viewer, and expected to be bedazzled. I mean, this guy can make the most outrageously extravagant cakes ever. I expected the best of the best, but was left feeling kind of disappointed. Pros: -Conveniently located inside The Venetian Hotel. Also right across from his restaurant, Buddy V's Ristorante (which is also average). -All their desserts are not too sweet. The red velvet cake, which can be too sweet sometimes, wasn't too sweet at all! -The cannoli and the napoleon cake is pretty good! -They provide free paper plates, knives, and forks if you ask! -Desserts are simple and plain. but pretty GOOD. Cons: -The wait. Prepare to wait for an hour. Since it's a tourist attraction, they have a long line that expands way past the store. -The service. The reason why the wait is so long (even though they serve everything ALREADY made) is because the servers work at a very slow and calm pace. I'm from a big city, so I'm use to quick service, but they REALLY take their time here and the wait is already long enough. =( Also, once you order your pastries, you wait in a separate line to pay. And there is only ONE cashier. Since Carlo's is such a popular spot, I wonder why they won't hire more workers and have more cash registers? -The buttercream filling. They use the same filling for their cream puffs and eclairs. Maybe if they used a different filling to complement each pastry, it would be more unique. I didn't really like it. It tasted mostly like butter. Nothing rich, flavorful, or unique. -Didn't see the crazy cakes on the show. I saw some nice cakes that they hang on the wall, but nothing too crazy. -You don't actually see them making the desserts in the window. They bake in the kitchen which you can't see. The window where you do see them, they're simply transferring desserts around. Nothing exciting. -The quality/taste of the desserts. Solid good desserts overall. But not unique or memorable. Some are very plain. I'll still come back since I want to try the famous lobster tail, but the ridiculously long wait and slow service also makes me want to avoid this place like the plague. :/
Super small bakery but they serve delicious chocolate cannolis & their coffee is great too! We will definitely be back in the future to try some more pastries!
Had the lobster tail. Not bad, but the filling is a custard instead of ricotta cheese like a sfogliatelle. The cafe mocha was not bad either. I went early in the morning to avoid the crowds.

When we got here there was a line (it was a Sunday afternoon) and it took about 20-30 minutes for us to place our order. We got a salted caramel lobster tail and a red velvet cupcake. The salted caramel lobster tail was great. The red velvet cupcake was okay, I like the red velvet cupcake at Georgetown Cupcake more. But I would go back for the lobster tail! Very limited seating at the bakery.

Lots of choices....get there early as the lines are very long. The "lobster tails" are really good. EVERYTHING is good!! I have heard the crumbcake is awesome..however, they sell out of that rather quickly. I will definetly be back....(see picture)

I was stopping over at Vegas for a day, and found out Buddy has a store here. So wanted to check it out. Had the cannoli and lobster tails, they were both made to perfection.....love it!!! However, the service is just ok, a bit slow, now I understand why the lines are so long.

I'm so happy with my experience this afternoon I went in not really sure what I wanted and tbh kinda stressed because I really needed a cake, so thankful Noah was so patient and kind to my mom and I even when we were all over the place and couldn't make up our minds ( so much to choose from & all look so yummy) so so so in love with our cake and decorations even though it was so last minute you guys made me one happy gal. Noah and jasmine are amazing!!!!!! Thank you!!!!!

The line was long to get in this place and it surely did not disappoint. We picked up mini chocolate mouse cake, red velvet cupcake, cannoli, lobster tail and some kind of cookie bar. Everything was awesome and so fresh! This place is a must try when you're in Vegas!

We've always been a fan of the show Cake Boss, so when we heard there was a bakery shop in the Venetian we made it a point to check it out! My sister ordered a maple donut cannoli and let's just say, there was no need to wrap it in a box to take to go. After 1 bite, she couldn't put it down. These bakers are TALENTED and the treats are quite the treat!

Carlo's Bakery has only been open a few days and obviously it's getting a lot of attention! We came by on a Thursday night just a little before 10pm, hoping we'd miss the rush. While it wasn't too bad, we still ended up being here for about 45 minutes from start to finish. It's located directly across from Buddy V's and it is a pretty small location. The kitchen takes up most of their space there but has windows on both sides for you to watch them do their magic while you wait. Inside, you'll see a few display cases and the walls covered with merchandise and some custom cake examples. During our trip, we were instructed to grab a number and hang out until it was called. There was no actual line. We ordered lobster tails, cheesecake, a cannoli and some other small treats. The prices aren't out of this world and with all the stuff we got, we only ended up spending about $35. The cannoli was great and had a nice shell that wasn't overly hard like you find a lot of times. My favorite of all so far though, is the lobster tail though. Trust me when I say, they are addiction! It's a light, cream filled pastry that has an unexpected crunchy exterior. At just under $6, the lobster tail is a must try! For a celebrity location, it definitely exceeded my expectations. You most likely aren't going to find the most amazing thing you ever tasted in your life here but it's well worth the visit. The staff is also extremely friendly and tentative. Plus, if you're anything like me, you'll have tons of fun watching them use that automatic box wrapper over and over again...
You saw the show, now eat your cake too! A wide variety of pastries made on site. Don't forget to take a number!

I love this place! It's the one bakery on the strip where nothing was too sweet. The wait can be a bit hectic depending on the time of day and the staff will surely mess up your order, but if it's sweet, I'll eat it. I did not detect any artificial flavors here and everything tasted fresh. Came here around noon on 5/9/14 to get my tickets to Buddy's Vegas Uncork'd event, which was awesome btw. Line wasn't too bad, I waited maybe 20 minutes. Staff is young and can be unprofessional... something you would attribute to new college students or graduating high school students. They weren't rude, but it'd be nice to get my order right. Lobster tail - remained crispy for two days! Filling is decadent but not heavy, not too sweet, and absolutely delicious. Cannoli - shell is lightly spiced complementing the ricotta filling. This will soften if you leave it overnight, so eat it soon (like you will have any trouble eating it right away). Rainbow cookies - moist and dense just like I like it. Not too sweet as is often the case with this type of cookie. Cream puff - this was okay, I like the asian cream puffs more. Hazelnut Biscottis - These were perfectly sized, crunchy, and heavy on the hazelnut flavor and nuts. I really liked these and will probably buy a big bag to take home next time. Vanilla hazelnut meringue cookie - strong hazelnut flavor and fun to eat! These were generous with the hazelnuts and definitely crunchy. It satisfies when I need a crunch. Wedding cookies - typical pecan butter cookies, nothing special, but good. Chocolate hazelnut tart - I think I wished it had more nutella flavor, but it was good nonetheless. It was light on the hazelnut aroma. Red velvet cake - this comes with cream cheese frosting filling. It's stronger on the cream cheese flavor and I prefer the roux buttercream with red velvet. The cake was very moist and light, I killed it. Star item: GET THE LOBSTER TAIL! You can even get some to take home as they remain crispy for awhile... at least in the dry dessert heat anyway.

My wife would say "this is delicious and we better than she imagined it could be". Long line, brief wait, but way worth it. We got the lobster tails and they are the best I've ever had. The price was a little more than anticipated however that's just because I didn't even know how much it would cost. Flavor wise it was worth it. You did good, Buddy. You did good.

I easily spent $53 on 11 items 2 cheesecakes (mini) 7 Cannoli's (small) 1 cannoli donut 1 lobster tail All were very tasty but the cannoli donut was my favorite! I will go back for more but I will definitely order online the day before for pick up so I don't have to stand in that long line.

My girlfriend and I are huge fans of Cake Boss so for her birthday in Vegas I got her a quarter sheet custom cake - Vanilla cake with the Oreo French filling. Usually, I'm not a fan of Fondant cakes because they tend to taste a little rubbery, but not here! The cake was very light and moist, which was surprising considering how heavy the cake was! The decoration was fabulous and overall, it was a great experience for our party. Thank you!

I had no idea this was the Cake Boss place...cool. So..not utter perfection and my eyes did not roll to the back of my head when sampling, but this place definitely does not deserve anything less than four stars. Yes, the lines are long. Yes, the place is small. No, it's not the cheapest bargain. I say it's a great bakery because the selections are scrumptious. The chocolate hazelnut biscotti and chocolate almond biscotti are fantastic. Great cream puffs also. I will definitely stop there whenever I'm in town. Bonus: the employees are super sweet and eager to serve. So go ahead and jump off the paleo wagon and have some yummy sugary carbo treats just this once :)
Very popular spot to get your goodies. Service is a little slow but the cannolis are amazing . Next time I'll have to try the cakes.

You might think you know what good cake is. But until you have tried Carlo's Bakery cakes you are dead wrong. The best cake. Moist dense and full of flavor. And don't get me started on the texture of the cream in the lobster tails. It's worth the trip to the second floor in the Venetian Grand Canal Shoppes.

My daughter is a huge fan of the cake boss, so when my girlfriend and I came upon Carlo's on our last day in Vegas, we knew we had to get some stuff to bring home to her and the rest of our kids. We got dark chocolate mousse and a cannoli to have immediately, as it definitely wouldn't stay good on the journey home. Both of these were fantastic. Best ever, honestly. For the kids we got some brownies, cupcakes, and cookies which they thoroughly enjoyed the next day. We got a ton of stuff for about $50, which isn't bad for Vegas at all.
I came here not expecting any thing above average. Wow! Everything exceeded my expectations! The chocolate covered cannoli was amazing and the rainbow cake was delicate, fun and super tasty!

I think your experience depends on many factors here. The line wasn't incredibly long when we went. I ordered a Carlo's donut. Not sure the description at the bakery was super helpful, but it was good! It had the same filling as a cannoli with crispy sprinkles. My husband ordered a brownie, and that was also very good! We got two coffees and managed to find two seats to enjoy our food and drink. It was fun to watch the bakers at work, as well. One of the customers asked the cashier about how often Buddy visits. She said he had been there the past weekend. Would have loved to have met him! :)

- I'm a big fan of "CAKE BOSS", so I was really excited to try out Carlo's Bakery up in the Venetian - Tried the lobster tail (~$5) and cannoli (~$4) +Lobster tail was stuffed with a deliciously rich cream, but we found the outside to be ha

Cannoli, good, shell was kinda lacking in flavor, non greasy, the ricotta filling was yummy. Lobster roll, just ok, the phyllo dough was too crispy, the vanilla custard filling had a odd taste and I got a very greasy taste with this one. Cream puffs, absolutely delicious. Light and airy and the custard filling was perfect. I think it's a bit overpriced, but your paying for the name and location.
The cannolis were amazing. My kids loved the rainbow cake. My sweet craving was definitely satisfied!

Never had much experience with bakery goods, saw the line so why not. Picked out a few cream puffs, a carrot cupcake, and lobster tails. Overall not super impressed, buttttttt.....the lobster tails really opened my eyes when I took that first bite. I was able to get a fresh batch of them and that flaky crispy texture was so awesome. And I've never ate any filling type dessert with so much creaminess goodness. Ordered 5, and eating the 3rd one as I'm typing this. No rahhhhgretssss

Worthy of the long lines. Had their classic cannoli which was delicious and as good as their flagship bakery in Hoboken. Although, in Hoboken location the fillings are done when you order them. Was to full to try other bake goods but I did when I was at their flagship location. All delicious. I did buy their variety butter cookies at this location to take home.

The Cake Boss!!! Wandering through the Venetian I saw the advertisements for Carlos and knew I had to go. What I wasn't prepared for was that everybody else had the same idea. After standing in line for 45 minutes and barely moving I almost walked away. I'm so glad I didn't. I'm a huge fan so it was a little nostalgic for me but the desserts didn't disappoint. The cannoli was Delish better than the ones I've had in NYC. But the red velvet cupcake OMG I have never had a cream cheese frosting taste sooooooo good. Cupcake orgasm If you are in Vegas have time to wait in line and are a fan you definitely have to go here I was a little bummed the employees said Buddy was there earlier and we missed him :( Maybe you will get lucky

Well if you are a foodie, I highly recommend the cannoli and the lobster tails. Cannoli shell wasn't too hard/thick or soggy and the cream filling was rich, creamy & delicious. Good quality chocolate on the chocolate covered cannoli. This is my first time to try the lobster tails ever and I wasn't sure what to expect. The texture of the pastry was chewy & crunchy at the same time. Amazing! I went back the next day to get some more lobsters tails and they were all sold out. . Can't wait for my next trip back to Las Vegas.
The chocolate canoli my favorite yum! Lines are a lil hectic but you eventually get the hang of it. Im glad i gave this place a try. Tip: they post cash only signs who knows why....

This place is always busy, the line is well worth it. I'm not a big fan of the cannoli, but the Lobster tails are delicious. Carlos bakery has a website we're you can actually have your favorite dessert shipped to your home.

Cannolis. Bomb. We got lobster tails and chocolate fudge cupcake. Tasty desserts. Also got the water bottle and a free apron cause I purchased $60+ which was awesome! The only downside is, if your coworkers messed up our order, do not blame it on us and show us attitude and frustration "because we are holding the line"! Don't make faces, you are working in a Carlo's Bakery! Carlo's Bakery!! woman in the cashier!!!

I'm really surprised by some of the negative reviews. This place is AWESOME! I had my doubts because the New York Bakery is highly publicized on tv for Cake Boss. It isn't the cheapest Bakery, actually it's kind of pricey. But, you're not getting basic bakery goods. We got a chocolate eclair, custard filled Lobster Tail, white chocolate strawberry, Neapolitan (THE BEST EVER), cheese danish and a few cookies. Some of the best baked goods I've ever had. It's worth the wait if there's a line... we waited for like 15 minutes. Delicious!

Short and straight. Get the canoli and to all the cake donut lovers like myself, the chocolate cake donut is divine. Yup, it's divine! Don't get it if your not a cake donut lover, it needs to be appreciated. lol!
Yummy on all the pastries. It's hard choice to make cause so much to choose from. I ended with eclair w Custer filling and Tarmi MSU and apple cluster.

Okay. So this place is pretty much delicious. I'm very very picky with my chocolate. I tried the strawberry chocolate mousse tower - scrumptious. And the chocolate chip cookies - amazing! My boyfriend tried The tiramisu- pretty good. The carrot cake - bomb! [so he says] Basically, you walk in. Take a number. They call out your number. You order. They prepare it. They call out your number again. You pay. The end. They would have gotten 5 stars, but they don't sell water or milk. Come on! People who eat there are obviously gonna want something to drink. We didn't wait long, because we went on a Wednesday night. But overall, staff is friendly. Desserts are wonderful.

So far it was delicious worth the wait!!! Make sure to grab a number as soon as you get there, you might have to wait about 30 min to an 1 hour. The bakery has good delicious deserts. The strawberry cheesecake is super smooth with a bread crust with a huge sweet strawberry on top, the cannoli has a nice crunch and sweet shell with a delicious cream, you might also want to try their red velvet cupcake too you can taste the delicious cream cheese icing with a red chocolate moist bread. The only down side about this bakery is the wait to be honest but its expected since it is new and of course Cake Boss is famous for his deserts and who wouldn't want to try a piece of this now that they are in the west coast! Hope you all enjoy and have the patience to wait for your sweets!

i had gone to the one in new york and i loved the lobster tail pastry that i had there! was happy to find out there was a bakery here too in vegas..again i got the lobster tail..its shaped like one..does not tastes like one lol..crispy, flaky outside..creamy delicious vanilla pastry cream inside..yummm

We ordered a unicorn cake and didn't give Carlo's much to go on. They worked with the ideas we had and they hit it out of the park! The cake turned out beautifully!!! I am completely thrilled with the results and would not hesitate to recommend Carlo's to everyone. The service from start to finish was professional and beyond helpful. Thank you for helping make this a memorable 21st!!!

This bakery has some great Italian pastries, like cannolis and lobster claws. They are pretty close to New York bakeries. Great assortment: cookies, cheesecakes, biscotti, shortcake, specialty cakes. Always a line to order so you know it has to be good.

So after we ate at buddy's restaurant we wanted to try dessert at the bake shop. Obviously we watch the show. I loved the lobster tails and napoleons!!! They were everything I was hoping them to be! Lol I was reading the reviews before I went and everyone was complaining about poor guest service and having to wait in line, but if u watch the show, there's always a line and it's ran pretty much the same way he runs the original! As for me I didn't have a problem with the wait, we went an hour before closing and didn't wait long. The counter people were nice. It's kinda pricey tho, I spent close to $80 on 13 pastries, only cause I was so excited for them to be here! I pretty much splurged! It was worth it tho, I want to go back for more lobster tails!

August 2, 2014 Stood in line for over an hour for this? Totally worth it! No matter what it is that you purchase, they pastries are all delicious and not too sweet! My favorite is their Napoleon. Their cheesecake is, according to my mom, better than the ones I brought back from New York. Carlo's is worth the wait and you will not regret it at all! Promise!
Cannolis were so fresh and amazing! Everything is so good! And you get a free apron when you spend more than $35

Came on my first day in Vegas and made sure to go back before I left. Both times the staff was able to clear a crowd quickly. I wish there was a place to sit and eat besides the two chairs they provide because I'd be here all day. The first visit I got an Oreo cupcake and chocolate mousse. The cupcake was moist and the cream cheese frosting was delicious (I normally hate frosting). The mousse was so rich and fluffy. The second visit we got another Oreo cupcake and my boyfriend got a caramel lobster tail. The cupcake was just as good as on the first visit. The lobster tail was delicious! (I'm not even a fan of caramel.) The filling was so light and soft. It was not that sweet which we loved since it was stuffed with it and it could have been overwhelming if it was too sweet. Going to try to squeeze in a third visit because the pastries are just that good.

EXPENSIVE! Goodness, be prepared to empty your bank account as you walk in. Really good pastries though so I'll give them that. My order consisted of the lobster tail, a chocolate mousse cake, and a cupcake. I worked on the lobster tail from Saturday night and finally finished it when I got back home Wednesday morning. Not something to be eaten in one sitting, at least I couldn't do it. The chocolate cake was pretty good even though I had to toss out the strawberries by the time I got to it. Sadly, I've yet to eat the cupcake. 4 items cost roughly $10 each so don't be shocked. Its something to try at least once, that's for sure.

We stopped in after dinner at Buddy V's to grab some something sweet for later in the evening...way too stuffed after that amazing meal! I ordered a cannoli and enjoyed it in my hotel room before going to bed - sinful, I know!
Salted Carmel cake and cupcake are both to die for! I definitely preferred the cake because it was a bit lighter, but both were great.

Days after coming home from my vacation im still dreaming of these amazing pastries, i will go and get them every single time im in las vegas! They are so delicious,do yourself a favor and buy extras to have later!

Finally had the chance to go check out Carlo's bakery. We went on a Wednesday around 12:30 so the line wasn't as long. I was super excited to get the lobster tail and my hubby wanted the canolis. We waited in line for our turn but it took a little long due to the ladies in front of us buying shirts. I swear they asked for every shirt in every size! There should definitely be a pastry line and a different line for merch. Once we ordered we got: Lobster tail Cream puff Canoli Eclair Pecan cookie Everything was good, minus the canolis...I know right?!? Very disappointed. Not what I expected at all. The lobster tail was very good. All in all, I would come out again to try other items.

I was super excited to visit them since I am a great fan of the show, but was afraid that it may have all been a hype. My fears however were completely unfounded as I discovered that their cannoli were the best I have ever had, the shell was crunchy since the attendants go to the back and pipe the cream upon ordering. it did take quite sometime for the order to be ready but it was well worth the wait. Their dark chocolate mousse cake was decadent, creamy, and not too sweet.

One word for you CANNOLI. Totally absolutely yummy! Taste just like the ones from their New York bakery I loveeee that they have the same Recipes I thought it was going to taste more like a buffet cannoli just boring with no flavor since it was inside of a casino but I was wrong!!!! So delicious!

I was finally able to come to this shop at the end of my Vegas trip. We came here around 11-12ish and there was no line at all (how lucky). First thing I was wow'ed at: they have clear windows so you can see what is going on in the kitchen :) one of the bakers was assembling a strawberry shortcake, which looked so good. The amount of strawberries they put into the cakes are CRAZY (in a good way). I was seriously about to buy a whole cake for myself, but I was flying the same day so not possible, sadly. Although the shop is small, they are able to have A LOT of different kinds of pastries. From cookies to cupcakes to puff pastry - it took me a while for me to decide on what to get. Their cannolis are not displayed, so you have to ask them about it. Or least I didn't see them from their huge selection haha. Anyways, I finally decided to get their famous lobster tail and cannoli.
