I wish I was able to order more, but I was just so full, ugh. The lobster tail was so crunchy and so flavorful! The choux (?) cream had a strong vanilla flavor to it. I had imagined the lobster tail to be bigger, but its fine because it takes me a while to finish a lobster tail anyways. I would have to say that this is the best lobster tail I had ever have (even better than Mikes Pastry's in Boston). I'm usually not a huge fan of cannolis, but the ones here blew me away. The cannoli itself had so much flavor and I could literally eat it as a cookie. The cream adds the perfect touch to it since it does get dry. I would love to come back here again, but at the Hoboken location!

These cakes are to die for. It's a good place to go if your a fan of the show and a fan of cakes and pastries. All made in house so extremely fresh and a high quality. Also selling cake boss merchandise as well. It's well worth a visit but make sure you know what you want while your queuing as if you make a decision at the end it holds up the line!

The best brownies I have ever had in my entire life are found at Carlo's Bakery! I was in Morrisville, NJ on a business trip and visited Carlo's there. I bought one brownie and took it on the airplane with me. Mid-flight, I decided to eat it. I couldn't believe how perfectly delicious it was -- the right balance of walnuts to the brownie and frosted. I love all of those combinations. The brownie was so good that I wished I had bought a couple more to take home. So -- when I was driving from Southern California to Utah recently, I stopped at the Venetian -- walked all over that place to find Carlo's. Stood in line for half an hour and bought 6 brownies for the rest of my trip. I will never miss the opportunity to stop into Carlo's for a brownie. Next time, I have to try an eclair.

We saw this bakery as a recommendation when we were researching what to do and eat in Vegas. When we got there I didnt know how to pick! Everything looked exquisite. I asked what the specialty's were and they said Lobster tails and Cannolis. However- I wasnt in the mood for any of those so I chose a chocolate covered cheesecake and the coconut chinese cookie with a chocolate droplet. Both were very good but that cookie was amazing! The texture was very good and just the right amount of coconut and chocolate. I wish I could go back and order a Cannoli. Maybe my next trip to Vegas!

Reminds me of the east coast pastries I love. Coming from Connecticut to California it is very very hard to find Italian pastries that are even decent. I love coming home with two or three boxes of pastries for my family and they are so good they're gone in a few hours. The lobster tails are my favorite. They are a bit pricey but it's Vegas and the Venetian I don't expect it to be that cheap. Highly recommend!

My parents have been here a few times, and it was our first time at Carlo's Bakery. We enjoyed these bakery treats so much that we dropped by a second time before heading home. On our first visit, we had these items boxed up to go: chocolate and vanilla cupcakes, chocolate chip cookies, cream puffs, eclairs and terra misu. On the second visit, we had brownies, meringue cookies, lobster claws, cream puffs and a mini cheesecake. My faves were the eclairs, cream puffs and mini cheesecake. These classic Italian desserts satisifed our sweet tooth, and were not too sweet.

My friends and I visited there today 2 of us had m&m cookies and 1 had the sprinkle cookie. They were all really tasty, they were just the right consistency they weren't hard but the weren't really soft.

Everybody by now knows what Carlo's Bakery is because of the show Cake Boss. Carlos Bakery has become the Applebee's of bakeries with locations across the US. I was in search of something to nosh on for breakfast and decided on a Cannoli from Carlo's. My expectations weren't too high but I was pleasantly surprised at how good the cannoli was. I did not try any other items from Carlo's, so this review is based solely on a single Cannoli. Great job!
The lobster tail is delicious! The ordering and checking out was fast! The cannolis were good too, but kind of priCing. Overall great quality!

This place never looked like much and it ALWAYS has long lines. This time the line was short so why not? We got a salted caramel horn, an almond croissant, brownie, and some other pastry that left me in heaven. Everything was stellar and fresh and delish. How good can a brownie be, right? No this was different. I think the difference here is they toast the nuts first, which added a great flavor. I will definitely line up again for this place. YUM.
The Bavarian cream filled doughnut was excellent. Jelly filled was also good Carlo or buddy whoever I'll be back.

We were visiting Las Vegas for a week and I was very excited to check out Carlo's Bakery... Big fan of the show. It is located in the Venetian Forum shop right across from Bobby's V Restaurant. The place was pretty busy so they had workers that she can't even take your orders on a iPad they were really patient they explain anything that you needed to explain. So customer service was pretty good. Once your order was ready they call you up by name and you receive your order from there while you wait you could actually look and see the baker's making the cake and all the goodies that they sell. Once we got back to the hotel and try some other stuff, it was pretty good but it's not worth on the $40 that we spend on everything. So it is pretty expensive I think it's just because of the show was on TV. Cannoli was very sweet that I didn't finish it rainbow cake and velvet cake was just okay as well. I had kind of better that was really moist. Because this in a little refrigerator so it stays the kind of little old or still. Overall excited to experience the cake and goodies. Maybe it was one of those one-and-done type things

I am crazy about this place. Bustling with people, this place has some absolutely mouth melting desserts. I visited this bakery on independence Day and there was a host of cupcakes n other creations in the colours of red, white n blue. Simply delicious.

I love Buddy's show and have wanted to come here.... we got tiramisu, a connoli, a pastry called lobster something an a baby cream puff. It was good but I think I may have thought to high of this place ... it was very small but clean. We ended up going over to buddy's restaurant across the street which was awesome!

They have good baked goods here cakes cookies etc. long line very pricey so don't thinking you get a donut for a dollar more like 4 to 5 dollars I would recommend just trying it is not a bad place I would go here again

Little pricy, but they have such a huge assortment. We ordered a lobster tail, a couple of made to order cannoli's, some fondant cookies and a few other goodies. Presentation is on point. The lobster tail was very flaky and delicious with even tastier cream filling. I recommend trying it if you're on the fence about what to order because the selection is so big. We were lucky to be there during the holidays because their fondant cookies with all the festive designs will make great gifts.

The famous 'Cake Boss' bakery is located in the Venetian hotel and it was a bit stressful to find. My girlfriend is a huge fan of the show so it was a must. The array of cakes and cookies and cannolis is extremely impressive considering the space is quite small. We ordered a lobster tail and a cannoli, both of which were quite generously filled with sweet cream. Both cakes were delicious and quite large. No seating, as has been said before, but we found a table nearby. Enjoyed my experience overall.
Ok I got the variety for 25 bucks it was ok, I wonder if it taste the same in the east coast.
In Vegas for a convention again. Tried Carlos again. This time, service was great. Red Velvet cake and cheesecake were great. Was told that the lobster claw was amazing. Much..Much ...Much better!
The Cannolis are amazing here, so fresh and tasty. However, the Caramel lobster tail wasn't so much, but the manager replaced it for me to a Choco hazelnut which I really liked it!

Super excited about this one! The cannoli was AMAZING!!!!! It's a little pricey but is to be expected. The staff was super friendly! I got a 6 pack of cupcakes, a brownie, a chocolate chip cookie and a cannoli for just under $30.
Amazing. This is a must stop for any foodie. From cakes to Italian pastries the only problem youll have is deciding what to to pick. Staff is super friendly and fast.
Location was great, bakery was clean, staff friendly and efficient. Canoili was heavenly. Cakes a little too dry. Prices were typical Vegas. Would go back for the canoili!

We had a hard time finding this because the maps at the hotel are not very good. After asking several employees, WE MADE IT! I had been reading posts for months on Yelp, didn't know what to expect honestly. We arrived around 10:30am and there were hardly any people there. Ordered and paid quickly. Make sure you look at the prices because their things aren't cheap. I enjoyed my experience and I would go back. I ordered the lobster tail and 2 M&M cookies. My mom ordered a cream puff and my sister a cheesecake.
So many delicious options that its hard to choose. You can't go to Vegas and not grab dessert at Carlos Bakery. Service was friendly and efficient.

Completely love this! I was excited to try and sample some of their desserts, and I'm happy to have shared them with my cousins~! They do not know who Buddy is, but they did enjoy the samples. They'll thank me later if they ever watch the show what we sampled: chocolate cannoli, chocolate merengue with I believe walnut?, coffee cream puff, and lobster tail! My brother and one of my cousin favored the cannoli, while my other cousin and I favored the lobster tail. I am craving to have some more!
My girlfriend bought me a surprise birthday cake from here, and it was absolutely delicious. It tasted very good and was nicely decorated. I will come back again despite the crowds and wait

It smells good as you walk by. The pastries are good, but there are two lines you have to stand in. The first is to place your order, and the other is wait to pick up your order. It would be helpful to have to more cashiers ringing people out.

LOVE Carlo's Bakery. My husband convinced me to go to Vegas by saying I could eat some treats here. Sooo glad I allowed him to talk me into it. We came in the late afternoon. There was a pretty long line. I was nervous as I had read here how slow it was. I found this to not be the case. We waited in line past the restrooms for about 20 minutes. The girl in charge of the line did a great job at keeping the line moving and nicely telling people who were cutting where the end was. Once inside it was a bit smaller than it should be. I ordered my lobster tails and some cupcakes. The person who helped me was wonderful and called me up soon to check my order. Then I had to wait to be called up again to pay. Thankfully they opened a second register which made it much quicker. I've had one of the lobster tails. Yummy and soooo worth it. Loving them. Cupcakes are actually nice and moist and delicious. A little pricey but worth it in my opinion. Definitely would recommend this place especially the lobster tails.

I finally got to visit carlo's bake shop this weekend. little difficult to find but ask around and you will be successful. Don't be discouraged with the long line and make sure u grab a number as soon as you arrive. It's a very small location so the line is mostly so it won't be crowded inside store. Very friendly employees. Well waiting in line one of the employees was walking around with a menu to give u a heads up on what to order when your time comes. She also has no problem taking your picture under the Carlo's bake shop sign. Ask employees for their favorite treat. Food: I was not disappointed with the pastries. Canolis, lobster tails and cream omg amazing!!!!! Fairly priced!!!!! Don't get discouraged with the line trust me it's worth the wait!

So we almost got out of the line several times, but felt committed since this was our second attempt at trying Carlo's. I'm glad we waited. We got the black and white cookie, lobster tail, cream puff and cannoli. I would've given the tail a three, only based on my preferences, and I have no point of reference. However, the cannoli with chocolate chip filling was awesome! Granted, I am a California girl who has only tried some in north beach in SF, but these were really, really fantastic and deserve five stars. However, I gotta say that I feel the line and ordering process could be streamlined. We waited an hour and we started just past the window of the shop. It seemed it could've been run faster with more help in the wrap up/check out department. If you don't mind waiting, get the cannoli! The other items were tasty too, but that stood out. Would love to try a cake next time!

Pastries and baked goods were absolutely delicious! We completely stumbled upon this little bakery while we were on a trip in Las Vegas and it was definitely worth it. Prices are a little bit expensive considering that it's just a simple brownie, cookie or cannoli but also considering that it's a pretty famous bakery because of the show Cake Boss it's definitely worth the trip. Would recommend to try at least one thing there but don't go crazy otherwise you will spend a lot of money
California Cheesecake well worth the wait, great assortment of different flavors, not to mention the free samples, line wrapped around the side of the building. ..

So i called 24 hrs before i realized i needed an emergency cake due to the fact that the cake i had order was not gonna be delivered what i had asked for so i needed a cake as soon as possible i called on a Saturday at 730 am and i was able to talk to elizabeth such nice girl completely caring then i had the pleasure to speak to Joanna the supervisor such nice lady was able to get the custom cake order inn for me for that same day at 2 pm this place is amazing super understanding and caring i don't know any other bakery that would do that for you in such short notice u guys are awesome thank youuuu so muchhhhh btw my cake was only 50 bucks n i got exactly what i wanted sooooooo happy u made my daughters bday that much better and the kids demolished the cake soooo bomb

Being a huge fan of the show Cake Boss, I had to make a quick stop at the famous Carlo's Bakery inside the Venetian. Despite the heavy crowd, I managed to get a hazelnut cream puff fairly quickly. It was light, fluffy, and yummy. It lived up to my hype, but was way too expensive. I would come here mainly for the large selection of desserts.

Service was great. Friendly people. Very cute looking desserts. The dessert was not too sweet. I find it delicious. This place was a bit pricey though. But then again, you are paying for what you get on the strip. They probably pay high rent expenses and so on.

Pros ·Delicious food ·Nice services ·Many varieties ·Unique Cons ·Long line(I don't think it's worth it to wait that long but than again I am impatient). ·pricey but you are in Vegas so i expect to be a little expensive.

Welcome to fabulous Las Vegas, Carlo's Bakery! I ate at Buddy V's a couple weeks ago and one of the managers stopped at our table to check on us. After letting him know I was a "Cake Boss" fan, he let me know when the bakery would be opening and that contestants from "Next Great Baker" would be there. I obviously cleared my schedule for opening day! Carlo's Bakery (located inside The Venetian) is literally right across from Buddy V's and the pathway between them is a little more narrow than usual, so I wondered about how they were going to tame the long lines because there was no way there wouldn't be one. The grand opening was at 6 pm, so I wanted to get there early hoping to beat some of the crowd. I had my hubby and 2 nieces with me and we arrived to Carlo's Bakery around 5 pm to find a long line formed already. Venetian security had a field day with this one! We found our place at the end of the line and even though there were a lot of people in front of us, the line only grew l-o-n-g-e-r behind us. I was thankful for the spot we had after seeing just how long the line got! I appreciated that we were given samples from Carlo's employees while we waited. So let me talk about the wait. WOW! It was almost a 4 hour wait from the time we first got in line and actually got inside the bakery. I know that is a long time, but it wasn't so bad with all the activity going on around us. Between the free samples and seeing people from Next Great Baker and Cake Boss go by and stop to talk to us and take pictures, it didn't feel like 4 hours and honestly was a freaking blast! Hubby was a real trooper holding our spot in line while we would take off to get our picture with Buddy, Grace, Danny, Mary and people from NGB. Poor Buddy! He really didn't have the proper help keeping people back (like I said the pathway is a little more narrow than usual) and at one point they did have a line to meet him, but they had to stop it because so many people were crowding around and there wasn't a clear path for the people walking by who had no idea what Carlo's Bakery even was lol. At one point, Buddy came back for pictures and my nieces and I were able to get a picture. After the picture, Buddy gave one of my nieces a great big hug and a kiss on her forehead. She was SO excited smiling bright and cried a little saying "I'm never washing my face again" ...bless her precious young heart! They both had a blast and it's one experience they will never forget, myself included! One inside the bakery, we were greeted and the girl who helped us was very friendly and helpful. it was kind of crazy inside the bake shop with people, so I just randomly picked out different things I could see. Ordering was quick, but getting what I ordered took a bit. While we waited (maybe 10 minutes) the sweet smell inside was heaven and I liked the open windows showing the bakers working. They have these windows not just inside the bakery, but outside too. When my name was called I went up to pay for my order and saw everything was packaged nicely. This was a great experience and I will most definitely be back! Lobster Tails ($5.95) - Excellent! Try this! It's flaky with a cream inside and a little Bailey's Irish Cream. This was my favorite of what I tried. Eclair ($2.50) - This was cut if half and had a filling. It also had chocolate on top. This was pretty good. I thought at first site that it didn't have enough chocolate on it, but the chocolate was thick and the right amount. Cream Puff ($2.50) - Custard filled with powdered sugar on top. I took a bite and thought it was good, so I told hubby to try it and he finished it. Glad I at least got a bite! Chocolate Cannoli ($3/Mini) - This I figured I would like, but I ended up loving it! The amount of filling was decent. I'd order this one again. Cannoli ($2.50/mini) - The filling has a ricotta cream with chocolate chips. I did like this one a lot and would eat it again, but I personally preferred the chocolate cannoli. Strawberry Tart ($2.85) - This was my least favorite. If you do try this, I would recommend eating it soon. When I got home with my box, the strawberry tart looked like it melted a bit and the strawberry slid off. None of that really bothered me because I hadn't had it before and didn't know it wasn't something that didn't travel well. The way it tasted did bother me though, The bottom was rock hard and I had trouble even biting into it. I might try it again in the future, but am in no rush. Chocolate Fudge Cupcake ($3.50) - I had the option between a vanilla or chocolate cupcake and chose the chocolate. It had a chocolate fudge frosting with sprinkles on top. This was just average. Not bad, but not great. Carrot Cupcake ($3.50) - Of the 2 cupcakes I tried, this was the best. The cupcake was moist and the cream cheese frosting was very good. They also have merchandise for sale (mugs, cookbooks, etc.) and take special orders for cakes and other goodies.

It gets 4 stars because of the lobster tails & cannolis and because I love Cake Boss. I took off 1 star because of the red velvet cupcake which was just not good at all. I'm a red velvet snob and expected a red velvet cupcake from Carlo's to be like everything else I've tried there.. Amazing. It wasn't. Hard to describe what exactly was wrong but didn't even taste like red velvet to me. Anyway, lobster tails are my favorite, hands down! They're amazing. I literally constantly crave them. My friend wanted them to add some chocolate on top of hers when we went and they wouldn't do it but I'm fairly certain that would be really good. Their cannolis.. Mm so good! I visited the Carlo's in Hoboken a few years ago and had a cannoli so I had to try the ones here. I had the regular one and the chocolate one. Both are great! My friend got a hazelnut covered cream puff in addition to some lobster tails and she said it was really good. It is a must try for me for next time. I spent about $28 (I think) for two lobster tails, two cannolis and two red velvet cup cakes. Also, there were a lot of people there in a small space but they do try to get to the next number (yes, you have to take a number when you get there) quickly. I didn't have any issues with the customer service either.. Everyone was friendly! I would, however, recommend a way for customers to be able to know what is in the display cases before ordering. Even while ordering at the one with the pastries, you're unable to see the cupcakes case as people are standing everywhere while waiting and vice versa. I probably missed out on something simply because I couldn't see it and didn't know it was there. After reading some other reviews, it seems there is now a line to get in which should alleviate that problem.

The classic cannoli I had was great! I'm not usually a huge fan of cream-filled pastries but this was delicious, not too sweet or goopy. I also picked up their one pound bag of mixed cookies and biscotti which I brought home to my sister and dad, they loved them. Why the four stars? There was a long line and when I finally got to ordering they were out of lobster tails and it would have been an extra 15 minute wait. Overall, Carlo's did not disappoint and it's cool to be able to say I've tried Cake Boss pastries!

Lobster tail was out of this world good. Read some of the other reviews and I'm not getting that there was an alcohol taste in the filling. Perhaps put the daiquiri down first and then take a bite? Either way, drove 9 hours and felt it was worth stopping in. Line was a handful of people. Took 5 minutes to get in and out circa 1000 am on a Friday!
Visited bakery while in Vegas. It was a nice treat! Also- flew back home with bakery goods. Perfect packages for traveling.
I absolutely love their cannolis but they are very pricey. I've been lucky that the few times I've visited the lines were not long at all. I would definitely go back next time I'm in Vegas.

I Love Buddy and had to make two separate pit stops here on back to back days. The first day we waited 20 minutes or so for the strawberry shortcake, a cannoli, and a lemon sugar cookie. The cannolis looked so good on tv but I was not a fan. The following day we went back for another strawberry shortcake and more of the sugar cookies, lemon and raspberry. Spent around $45 in total! We will be back!

Decided to try this Bakery as I have heard great reviews and there seems to be a lot of "buzz" surrounding this location. The staff was awesome! I came in, took a look at the choices (quite a lot to choose from), and asked one of the staff members what is the most popular item/what does everyone order. He mentioned the cannolis - so I had to try them! Wow - they were amazing! Fantastic quality! A bit pricey (about $4.50/$5 per cannoli), however, loved trying this bakery.

I'm not going to read the reviews here because when I went yesterday, i had a pleasant experience. I'll make this simple and quick. 1: go in the morning before 9:45, maybe 10 at the latest. 2: know what you want to help speed up the process when the person takes your order. 3: Lobster tails, and crumb cake. Those are my my favorites. It's up to your pallet in what you want to eat. Buy one of each of everything!
Wow this bakery is the only one I seen in ca . All there pasty are made fresh and are very delicious. Yes it's pricey but it's so worth every Pennie . I love there cannoli and cookies

Buddy's baked goods are not overrated. I wanted to sample everything!! I visited Carlo's twice during my trip. The 2nd time especially I got greedy, ordered too many items, ate them all, couldn't stop. SO GOOD.
On our Vegas trip we had to stop by here and get some sweet treats!! Everything taste really good. We have been here twice and both times there are long lines! But it's worth it!
I loved go to Carlo's bakery at the Palazzo. Thankfully the lines weren't long, at all, and the service and pastries were top-notch. I will definitely be going back and bringing my guests who visit.

I was hoping for desserts as good as seen on the tv show and I was not dissatisfied. I ordered the Oreo lobster tail, peanut butter cupcake, chocolate mousse and chocolate cannoli. The cupcake was moist and very wonderful hint of peanut butter with the best frosting. The lobster tail was flaky and filled with the best creamy Oreo filling. The chocolate mousse was creamy and perfectly edible. The chocolate cannoli was the best I've ever had with a great crispy outside covered in chocolate with a fantastic tasting filling. I'm going back tomorrow before my flight to stock up on items to bring home.

I've never had a canoli, so we gave Carlo's Bake Shop a try. There was a good size line and it seemed very disorganized. First you order your baked items, then you wait in a cluster -"F" of people. Next they call you up, show you your baked item, then back to the cluster to wait again. Then you get called by the register to pay. It's very odd and I'm sure there is a better way to do this. HOWEVER, the canoli was so yummy. Being a western girl, I just don't get canolis on the street corner here.

So, here I sit back home watching Cake Boss on my DVR. I think I should tell how my adventure of trying to bring back bakery items from Las Vegas to Hawaii. I was afraid TSA wouldn't let our so delicious cannolis and lobster claws onto carry on because of the cream. I really wanted our friends and employees to taste these oh so special Italian desserts. In hindsight, maybe I should have asked the Palazzo to store it in the freezer overnight. We had an early flight in the morning. I also should have packaged the items separately. I put them in our suitcase and packed clothes around them and hoped for the best. When we finally arrived home, the box did suffer from being smashed. It also suffered some from the varying air moisture content. The creams were still good, but they did not look pretty. The saddest part was because of the moisture content, the cannolis were no longer crispy. The lobster claws were beat up, but they are good. I am still eating them. I wish I wasn't. I'd rather be loosing weight, but they taste good. I wish I could fix the cannolis. I haven't given up on this idea. I know I'll try again.

Long lines. Had to wait about 20 minutes to order. Bought a single desert cake for about $10. The mini dark chocolate cake was very good. Their shop is not on their outdated directories in 'mall'. They are located close to Barney's.
Stopped by for some cannolis and a lobster tail or two. Was pleasantly surprised that there was no line. That changed to a line of 20 just minutes later. Always feel satisfied after visiting. Thanks

We had a long wait in line about 30 to 40 minutes. It was worth the wait the crumb cake was on the stale side we did get our money back from that. But other than that the cupcakes the lobster tail was delicious. It was worth the wait in line
Pricy but good pastry. Wish they have a more central location on the strip. The crowd wasn't as busy as the NY location. Smaller store for sure

I was fortunate enough to visit Carlo's bakery without the long lines (I went close to closing). We ate lobster tails probably everyday of our 4 day trip, they were so so good! The cream inside is amazing and the dough is flaky and just the right amount of sweetness. We did not try anything else, but I highly recommend the lobster tails.

I consider myself a connoisseur of pastries. Carlos didn't disappoint...nevermind the endless selections you have or the prices. I've gone three times in the last few weeks, and each time I get the meringue cookie, strawberry shortcake and LOBSTER TAIL. If you like flaky, crunchy, creamy, and sweet (how could you NOT) you must get a lobster tail. The cream inside this croissant like pastry is perfect, not too sweet and absolutely decadent. Customer service is great...but be ready to wait, as it's located inside the Venetian.
1st time in Vegas. I love your Lobster tail !!!!!!!!!!!!!! Looks like out of all the celebrity chefs in Vagas you have it right.
Service is quick and friendly, raspberry regauela(sp)? Was my fave! Was outta control had to try everything! Thanks Carlo and family!
Absolutely amazing! Super pricey but definitely worth it for the pastries. Food, good but for real Italian food I've had better for the price. Great for a romantic dinner with a great view though!

Had to make a trip to come here because I love the show! It was quite hard to find and really small. Long line, but the price wasn't as bad as I thought it was going to be. It was a great place to stop by once because of the novelty.

This restaurant never disappoints visually it's very satisfying to see rows and rows of beautifully decorated pastries. The strawberry shortcake is awesome. You can also get tshirts coffee mugs and other gifts. Wish that we had this in our town!!!

Excellent place. A lot of variety. I wish I could afford everything on display. Definitely will be back. Just need to make sure I save before returning since I want to make sure I try more than one dessert.

I just visited Carlo's and I was very pleased. I got the cannoli and it was really good. They passed out cake samples to the people that were in line. It was good so I got a cupcake. I'm only giving it 4 stars because I waited in line for almost an hour. There was only one girl ringing up orders but she was also taking orders. Maybe they should have 2 cashiers and the other people taking orders to help speed up the line. Other than that I enjoyed going there.

I was pretty dang excited to eat their goodies. Huge fan of the show. We waited about 30 minutes to get into the store. But was entertained watching them make a cake through the window. The chef was really nice and kept waving to my girls. We ordered fresh donuts that were amazing! Couldn't believe how yummy. Orders a cupcake. You have to try cake right? It was good but then we are the lobster tail!! Oh my it was all it was cracked up to be. Amazing!! The servers were nice and I loved how it came in the boxes and tied with bakers twine just like the show.

$3.50 for the red velvet cupcake which was so moist and tasty. I was mostly impressed with the frosting and the fact that it wasn't ultra sweet like most places but creamy just the way I like it. No line on a weekday afternoon although there was some confusion as to how and where to order. Limited bar stool seating also made it hard to enjoy my new sweet.
Finally, tried the canoli and it was okay as I had better. HOWEVER - the Napoleon and the Lobster Tail is a must! The best I have ever had and so worth the wait.

Had my wedding cake done here and it was amazing! It came out exactly how I wanted it too and tasted great! We had white cake, fresh strawberries, and chocolate mouse inside the cake! I highly recommend buying your wedding cake from here! Amazing job! I even got lucky and got to watch it be made!
Good sweets if your looking for something good it's here at Carlo's Bakery in the Venetian hotel

The only negative is the long line most of the day. Oddly, we found it much quieter around lunch time. There are so many amazing treats that you have to go back and try more. Everything was delicious, and the staff very friendly and helpful.

Given the popularity of this bakery, we waited 1 hour to experience all the delicious goodies we always see on The Cake Boss. They have windows on one side of the bakery so you can watch the bakers prepare all the desserts. Staff was extremely busy but still friendly. We bought the Boston Cream, hazelnut cream puff, chocolate meringue, vanilla meringue, & of course cannoli. All delicious!!! We'll be coming back on our next visit!

Waiting in line no bog deal u can watch them make cakes and stuff, had the chocolate canoli was very good, best I had ever had, very good filling . Took home the Napoleon cake, was very good also. Price is a little high but I understand why, quality cost.

Went to the bakery to bring things home to MN. My daughter is a huge Cake Boss fan. We got a tshirt, cookies to bring home and a lemon tart for myself. The lemon tart was awesome! Staff was great helping with the tshirt and getting a gift card (niece and nephew will be coming next week!).

After watching tons of episodes of cake boss, you can bet that I really wanted to try these seemingly mouth watering desserts. I was absolutely thrilled that I could finally taste it, and not just imagine how it would taste! The appearance of the store imitates the Hoboken store from the show, and there's also a window where you can watch people decorating things, which is kind of cool. When I went, it was only the second day it was open, so it was pretty crowded. You take a number, and when it gets called you get to order your desserts. Then you have to get that same number called again so you can get it all packaged and pretty and pay for your stuff. There's not a lot of sitting room, so plan to take your desserts home. If you're really impatient, you could always sit on a bench by the "canals" in the Venetian and eat them while watching the gondolas. EVERYTHING LOOKS DELICIOUS! I settled on the "lobstertail", which is a pastry stuffed with I think it's french cream, since it seemed to be something sort of unique to Carlo's Bakery. It was so good! The outside was flaky and crispy, and the inside was rich without being too sweet. It was so perfect! I'm definitely looking forward to trying more desserts! The big problem will just be what to get next!

Came here after eating at Buddy's V's Ristorante they had quite a lot to Choose from its a little on the pricey side so be prepared for that. Can be crowded at times so it's best to come out early when their shelves are fully stocked out and fresh. Had the famous Lobster Tail it was highly recommended and it was great crispy on the outside very creamy on the inside also their connoli is good too. Overall their process of getting in and out could be faster.
Best desserts ever tasted recommend going to buy their desserts.Very creative and awesome

You have to get the cannolis. They are the best. Very reasonably priced. I thought they would be more expensive but they're not. I think the next time I'm in vegas i will have to take home a dozen of them! Highly recommend

I'm only giving it 4 stars because of the lines they get. You would think if they get a lot of people, they would get just a tad bit more staff. The bakery is very small, so I guess I understand why the long lines. The cannoli was soooo worth the wait! That, and the chocolate dipped cookie (it's half white, half milk chocolate). Yum yum yum!

Ordered a celebration cake online to be ready when I arrived to Vegas . The customer service was excellent. They even offered to write Happy Birthday on it for me when I realized my candles would not fit right on the cake at the time of pick up. I received many compliments for the taste as well. I will definitely order again while in town.

This place is soooo good!!! Not too overpriced, but the taste of their desserts and pastries is worth every penny! I would have given them 5 stars, but I had to wait in line for 1 hour just to get into the bakery. I had my kids with me and they were not doing well with the wait so I had them stand against a wall (totally out of the way of everybody), but security there at The Venetian was very rude and said they were in the way of traffic (they were not) and made them come back in line with us! Would come back again, but I wouldn't bring my kids next time...and I would be prepared for the wait and have my comfy shoes on!!

I have wanted to go back east just to taste these baked goods. I wanted to know if it was really as good as everyone on TV was saying. I mean come on, people waiting three hours or more in line just cuz their on TV?! Well I only had to wait 45 mins here in Las Vegas and it was REALLY WORTH THE WAIT! I haven't been able to find a GOOD cannoli in this town to save my life! You sure can here. And the rest of the pastries are to die for. I'll be going back over and over. Thank you Buddy for coming to Vegas!!!! It's a much shorter drive to go to the Strip then to have to fly to New Jersey.
Went early on a tuesday ..had a hard time finding it in the big venetian .they didnt have all the pastry ready so early i guess.I got a canoli tower 7.95$ and fudge cup cake yummy yummy yummy !!!

Don't try to purchase everything because the pastries look cute. It wasn't a long wait, maybe 5-10 minutes or so on Sunday morning, I ordered 1 Lobster tail based on the reviews, it was AWESOME. not too sweet, and freshly made~ remember not to purchase too many varieties, it will disappoint you!

Had the Neapolitan and the mini cannoli. I've never heard of this place prior to coming to his place but the baked goods are pretty good. Layers of the Neapolitan were still very crispy, and the cannoli were very tasty.

Was excited to discover a Carlo's Bakery across from the hotel I was staying at. Planned to hit it first thing in the morning for my much needed coffee and a pastry or pastries...don't judge. Got there about an hour after they opened and was pleasantly surprised on my a few people ahead of me. The line took longer then I thought it should take govern the amount of people but I was ok with it as I was able to fully decide what i wanted when it was my turn. Everything looked absolutely delicious. After resisting to order one of everything I settled on mini connolis, cannoli tart, peanut butter chocolate cupcake, and a variety of cookies. EVERYTHING was delicious. Melted in your mouth good. Minus a star for not having coffee. Apparently the machine wasn't working? ? Bakery with no coffee is just a sin in my opinion. Next time I'm in this neck of the woods I'll be back to try a few more things. Hopefully they get the coffee thing worked out.

I was in Vegas this past weekend. My party we had a surprised birthday for one of my girl. I was in Vegas looking everywhere for a bakery. I found this on Yelp. When I got to this bakery, I was surprised it was Cake Boss. The service was good. The lady who helped me was very detailed what they offered. The cakes were nice and presentable. I bought a strawberry shortcake for one of my girl's birthday with a beautiful tag. The cake was delicious. The line got busy right after I bought my cake. They had a deal going on, giving out free mug or water bottle.
Cupcakes here are pretty good. Cake is nice and moist and the icing is not overly sweet. Would definitely come back.

Friends and I enjoyed this place. Great view of the back kitchen where the staff is busy making all the baked goods. The line looked long, but is was maybe less then a 25 min wait. The only issue was that the Rugelach was too dense.

BEST RED VELVET CUPCAKE! I went to all the cupcake bake shop in Las Vegas and this bake shop has the best red velvet. My mom will be ordering her wedding cake here soon. The only thing I didn't like was one of the employee is really rude. This was my first time coming here, so ordering I didn't how they do it. I was only going to ask her a question but held up her hand to my face. She didn't even let me finish. If I come back to this shop I hope she will not be there to do this to me again.

We are a fan of the show and have always wanted to go to their main store, but when my daughter and I heard about the shop on the strip we had to go. Their selection is not large, but what they do have is very good. My daughter and go the lobster tails and HOLY COW they were amazing. The next day (Sunday) we arrived early so we could get some goodies for the family, but they did not have any Cannolis. We got some more lobster tails, biscotti and White Chocolate Mouse Cake. My wife was very happy with the cake and my other daughter was disappointed they did not have any Connolis, but was very happy with the lobster tail.

This was a must stop for my Cake Boss loving daughter. There was a bit of a wait, but it wasn't too bad and the girls were able to view the bakers at work. We ordered a cannoli, strawberry short cake, and a red velvet cupcake. The cannoli was FANTASTIC!! The strawberry shortcake had A LOT of whipped cream, but it was yummy. And the red velvet cupcake? You'll have to take my daughter's word for it, she wouldn't share! I wanted a lobster tail, but it was too much for this trip, next time FOR SURE!!

Loved it! Ever since watching the show on TLC I have wanted to try their things but they were located on the other side of the country. We went a litter overboard with pastries but I have no regrets! There are a ton of people there so be sure to get your ticket quickly so that you are not waiting too long. It was about 20 minutes from the time we got the ticket till we got what we ordered... not to shabby for a place this popular!

Loved it in 2014, purchased $72 worth of treats, loved the lobster tails best so wasted no time getting that this time with my 6 month old at the time I July of 2016. Buddy your lobster tail creme was the first thing other than milk that I let my son taste ever! You can be his Godfatha.

I walked by here and didn't know what it was, but the line intrigued me- and I'm a sucker for pastries. So I waited and I waited and I finally entered the bakery. Waited and waited again and finally got to order. Waited and waited again and finally got to pay for and receive my order. So yes. You must be patient. But that lobster tail is AMAZING and I'm considering stopping by once more before leaving sin city.. A bit pricey and could likely be more efficient. Lobster tail = so good. Very crispy and flaky and the filling was rich. Cannoli = OK. I don't normally eat cannolis though Mini white chocolate mousse = excellent Red velvet cupcake = nothing memorable

The bake shop was located in a pretty secluded spot in the Venetian . There was a long line out the door, around 8:30pm. We waited about 35-40 minutes in line but it wasn't too bad since an employee kept walking around giving us delicious samples ;) I tried the cannoli, red velvet cupcake and caramel cupcake. The red velvet was definitely my favorite!

We had a discount coupon of Carlo's Bake Shop by Venetian for our stay, that excite me to visit Carlo's. I found some Interesting cakes with snowman face as Christmas was approaching.. they were really CUTE worth eating hehe :-) Carlo's had lots of variety in terms of cookies/crumcakes/bisccoti/cannolis. We got there early in the morning after our venetian suite checkout and Carlo was bombarded with Carlo's lovers.We were in queue for almost 30 minutes.....Gosh! But definately worth waiting :-) Got 2 huge bags from there with thousands of calories haha :-)

Best Cup Cakes I ever had. Brownie was average or below average. But the cup cakes were excellent. Great frosting. They should win awards if they have not. Long line out the door. Like 30 minutes to get cup cakes. No seating. But great cup cakes. Employees manning counter was a mess. Clean counters. Employees running around like chickens, with their heads cut off. Took like five times, to get them, to get my order right. Definitely some miscommunication, between ordering, packing, paying, and pickup. The disaster service, was worth the aggravation. For the Best Cupcakes I ever had. The cup cakes should get 5 stars, the brownie I had maybe 3 stars, the disorganized staff is insane, -1 star.

First time I ever had a cannoli was in NJ at Carlos Bakery. Ever since then, it's been my favorite treat. So I get them where ever I can find them. This place is great but they don't fill the cannolis when you order like they did in NJ. They are pre-filled sitting on the shelf. They are still good. I'd of course go back. I want to try the Lobster Tail.

When we arrived the line was fairly long, it moved very quickly though and in no time we were picking out our treats. We ended up with a lobster tail, 3 cookies, a canoli, and a mini chocolate ganache cake. All of it tasted wonderful and surprisingly was only about $22. The staff was AMAZING! My oldest son wanted some cherries, and they went in the back and brought several back for him. It made his day lol. Everyone had a smile on their face and made sure we had everything we needed. raeganmirickfoodblog.blo¦

Carlos bakery is my favorite bakery. I had been dying to go to this place for the longest time. The lines are always very long everytime I had gone. And the place is pretty dang hard to find in the Venetian! I had tried to figure out the best times to go, as sometimes I'd go on a Friday at noon and understandably they are packed. I mean packed. I mean a line like a ride at a theme park. Today however, ahhhh today was different. Today was MY day. Today was the day that I would get to eat baked goods from the great cake boss. I decided who would go on a Wednesday at 4pm? Boom. Only a short line. I looked for about 10 minutes and there was so many decisions. These are big decisions. Not life or death obviously. But big in my mind. So....I got the carrot cake and 2 red velvet cupcakes. It came to about $15 which is expensive but also fair. They put them in a nice little box so I could take it home and enjoy. I don't have much else to say about the place. It is well maintained, clean, and the people are friendly. You can see the workers in the window working on the food. Now how were the baked goods? Delicious! They were among my favorite for the red velvet cupcakes. And the carrot cake was superb as well. Like I . But like I said the lines can be crazy long and finding the place is quite a challenge. So my advice, go there, and if the line is tooooooo long then come back another time. Like say Wednesday around 4pm.

Suprized are daughter with this place she loves the show... We enjoyed some of there pastries and they were good...they were nice enough to grab a peace of fondant from the back for my daughter to try... Nice staff...
My red velvet wedding cake came from this shop and was the best thing I have tasted ever . It was a perfect end to a perfect day.

I've been wanting to try Carlo's Bakery since they came to Vegas. 5 years of living in Vegas and I finally tried it! I love Cake Boss and I have been waiting to try some of their amazing desserts. And let me tell you- so so good!! Totally worth the wait. It was really busy, but that is the price for amazing desserts. Definitely will be going back! I highly recommend them.

We had the lobster tail, cupcake and towers. My littles had the Oreo and strawberry shortcake towers. My son a lobster tail and cupcake. I think you expect so much after watching buddy on tv all these years that no one could ever live up to the hype. We thought they were good and now we have a story to tell. Luckily we waited just a few minutes. We got there around 9:30 am. FYI buddy opened up a restaurant across from bakery. You can order Canolis and a few other deserts there. You might pay a little more but worth it if the line is long. The restaurant Called buddy v's rocks! Best lasagna and meatballs we've ever had! We also loved their calamari best to 2nd best we ever had. Parmesan chicken yummy too. Free Rosemary bread dipped in olive oil and Parmesan good too. We'll definitely go back. They have a lunch express for $22 Appetizer, main dish and Canolis! Gotta try buddy v's his food is so yummy!

YUM. I tried the cannoli, lobster tail, & crumb cake. To be honest the crumb cake was very very hard like a brick. But the others were very tasty. As for the line we only had to wait about 10 minutes. We came around 4pm on a Saturday, today. The workers were also very friendly and talkative so that was nice. :)

The best part of coming here was the free samples. We wanted cake but there was only 2 of us and the little cake samples were a perfect and satisfying offer. But the REAL. And SERIOUS reason for going there was to try their lobster rolls. Each roll was $5.95 so it adds up. They do not price cheaper of you buy a dozen. We easily spent $70.00. The promo at the time was spend $39.99 and get a signature mug. I give those lobster rolls 10 stars. The cream inside was really good. It's the epitome of a "cheat day" item if you are dieting and it was and is WORTH every powdered sugar molecule. Some other items we threw cash at was the pumpkin cheesecake, homemade 'milano' cookies, cannolis, and the American eclair. The items are pricey so I would either keep going back and divide your 'taste-bud-wants'. If you don't want to come back and live far away from a 'cake boss' site (like the one in Vegas)then you should spend nearly $100 and try all you want.

I love Buddy and his family oriented bakery / T.V. Show Cake Boss so naturally I had to go out of my way and stand in a long obnoxious line to get a taste of his pastries. After doing my homework by reading tons of reviews & browsing through pics I came to the conclusion that the only item worth trying would be their Lobster Tail. I was right. Their cookies/biscotti were basic and insanely overpriced at around $17 a pound. The Lobster Tail pastry alone cost $6 for one so I was good with that. The exterior shell was so crispy as in crunchy, not flaky like a croissant but more like it had a nice crunchy bite to it which I loved. Filling consisted of a mixture of Custard, Whipped Cream and Baileys Irish Cream (Irish whiskey and cream based liqueur). It was divine!!! Tasted better the following day when the Baileys flavor was more developed and pronounced. Great stuff! Hope an L.A. location is on its way...

We arrived a little later in the evening and mid week so we didn't have to wait to be attended. They take your order and then you are asked to step aside while they pack it all up. We got a lobster tail, two cannoli's, a sprinkle shortbread cookie, and an Oreo cake cup. Total was $29 something. Not cheap, but I was a huge fan of cake boss so I had to check it out! The pastries were good. To each his own. Okay, I was not wowed, but I will say the cream was very light and yet rich- odd, and my review is based solely on me as a fan of the show.
Have had the cannoli on numerous occasions and it is amazing. The wait in line was a little long but that is to be expected.

Came to bring my niece to Carlo's bake shop she's a huge fan of cake boss and since she was in town she asked me to bring her here (she's 11yrs old) it was a little difficult locating the store but managed to find it. There was a long line but not as bad we did take a number and within 10 minutes we were taken care of. My nieces face was wowed with all the beautiful desserts. We ordered a large cannoli, a mini chocolate mousse cake and a mini red velvet cake. The texture of the cakes were very good and very moist and spongy. I loved it and most importantly made a highlight of the day with my niece. Would definitely be back to try out other desserts (:

On my very first visit to this Carlos Bakery in Las Vegas inside The Grand Canal Shopes at The Palazzo/The Venetian. The wait to get in was really no wait at all because I came around the slow part of the day. I got a cannoli which I had always wanted to try. It was extremely delicious and fairly priced too. I also purchased A souvenir metal coffee mug. I love the food their and next time im in the area im going to come back for more for sure. If you want awesome desserts that's delicious in your stomach and good on the wallet come to Carlos Bakery the worlds greatest bakery.

I really like the chocolate chip cookies here. Everything else I have tried, (cupcakes, cannoli, cream puff variations) are good but not anything special. I have yet to try their lobster tails, so I will return for those next time I stay at the Venetian. The line can be a bit of the problem here, enough to say that if the wait looks too long, it might hamper your expectations on the dessert themselves.

OMG the desserts are amazing. Check opening times because the line could be an hour wait to get in to purchase baked goods however the wait is worth it. It is right across from Buddy Vs a delicious Italian restaurant. Highly recommended. We got a bunch of cannoli, the lobster creme puff was to DIE for and we got the 7 layer cookies. Yum!

I have been wanting to try Carlos bakery after watching Cake Boss and it lived up to my expectations. My boyfriend and I arrived at the bakery 15 minutes before they closed and we had to wait about twenty minutes to order which wasn't too bad. I got 3 cannolis, 2 regular and 1 chocolate as well as a mini white chocolate tart. The cannolis were the best I have ever eaten, especially the chocolate. I suggest going earlier in the day because they will have more pastries to choose from. The price isn't something to rave about but you're getting quality pastries, not something store bought which I don't mind to pay.
This place is a little hard to find and a little small for the amount of people that flood the place. A lot of options to choose from!
Awesome place we loved it!! The pastry was excellent the first day but did not travel well. When we got back home it was not worth eating unfortunately!

I had no idea what to expect from this bakery. My wife decorates cakes as gifts and I see her watching "Cake Boss" but I have to admit I'm not too familiar with all the TV show stuff surrounding the bakery. The bakery is supposed to be some replication of their Hoboken, NJ bakery. Inside is very clean but small. The wait in line was brutal but given that this place just recently opened and all the hype around it I am not going to complain about the line but it was brutal being a guy who just wanted a cannoli or cookie. This was one of those things I did for my wife and seeing how much fun she and her nieces had made it worth it. We had a few boxes of treats and my wife had a special box made for me so that she and the girls could sample their treats and I could have my own. She knew this outing wasn't my cup of tea so that was thoughtful lol. I had a couple cannolis that were filled fresh in front of us. Thy have some pre-made and also empty cannoli shells so you just have to tell them if you want it filled fresh or not. I think the people who pick the pre-made ones and don't know better to ask for it filled will end up with a soggy mess. I had a carrot cupcake that was moist and tasted good. The lobster tail is out of this world and I can only imagine with the one here being the regular size what the XL version across the way at Buddy V's is like! My cream puff was the best thing next to the lobster tail I just wish it were bigger. I liked everything I had but I did think that it was wierd when my wife showed me the Carlo's mug she purchased. It said "Hoboken" on it. WTH? This is Las Vegas! Please get some mugs that actually say Las Vegas on them. It just makes sense!

Be prepared to wait in line and look at the menu while you are waiting in line!!! I had a large cannoli and a hazelnut cream puff... It was my last day in Vegas and I was trying to be good!!! Everything in the glass looks inviting!! Staff was super friendly and speedy, loved that this bakery was at the Venetian which I was also staying at!

We got the brownie, chocolate chip cookie and the strawberry cheesecake. Everything was delicious! Went later at night and there was not a long line at all. It is extremely hard to find if you come in through the Venetian. I would recommend heading in closer to the Palazzo. The ONLY reason this doesn't get 5 stars is because there were no prices listed for anything other than family trays of goodies. Other than that, it was fantastic.

I came here because I am a dessert whore and to see what the hype was about. Yes, it's convenient to rely on others' reviews, but I wanted to experience it personally. What the hell, I was there anyways. Luckily, there was no major line when I walked up. There were so many sweets to choose from. After scanning the display cases, something caught my eye... The Mini Tiramisu!!! There were ladyfingers surrounding the entire tiramisu! Although feeling still a bit skeptical, I knew I was going to regret if I were to walk away from it. After paying, I went up to the room to indulge in this still-questionable delight. As I stuck my fork into it, I was pleasantly surprised. The ladyfingers were uber soft!!! I gingerly but carefully forked all the way down to the bottom of the tiramisu and gave the first bite to my girlfriend. Her big eyes went bug eyes! She promised I will LOVE this tiramisu. After giving my husband a bite, he approved of it also. Now, it was my turn to taste this piece of heaven. OMG it was love at first bite! I started squirming screeching from delight! This was the best tiramisu I've ever had! It was made just the way I like it--very soft ladyfingers and a completely soaked bottom with a not-too-overpowering sweetness all around. I was completely sweetly, madly and deeply hypnotized by this too-good-to-be-true tiramisu. Yes, Buddy surely knows desserts! Now I fully know and acknowledge his amazing creations! It's not just a hype, it's an eye-rolling orgasmic explosion in your mouth! Seconds??? YES PLEASE!!!

Went on a Friday around 9:30 am. Waited in line for about 30-45 mins. to order then waited about another 15 mins. for them to pack my goodies and pay. I ordered the dark chocolate mousse cake, cannoli, lobster tails, and strawberry cheesecake. If I had to rank the goodies I got in order from my favorite being the first, it would have to be dark chocolate mousse cake, lobster tails, strawberry cheesecake and then the cannoli's. If you like dark chocolate like me, you will definitely love the dark chocolate mousse cake. Wish I had me a piece right now.

Sweets were great! No line on the day we went (we were there in between lunch and dinner). There were so many choices. They also had various gift items with their name on it. We shared an eclair and cannoli. Both of them were delicious

The shop was beautiful and clean with a very colorful display of many different varieties of goodies. My only qualm was the fact that we had to wait 45 minutes just to get in and order! But the strawberry shortcake, chocolate chip cookies, and cannoli's were amazing!!
Carkos Bakery in Vegas! Best cupcake in Vegas!!! Big fans of the show. I highly recommend.

Came here for one thing only: lobster tails. I've been wanting to try these bad boys ever since I saw it on an episode of Cake Boss a few years ago. The hubs and I strategically grabbed a number, checked in for dinner at Buddy V's, got seated, ordered our dinner, then the hubs went to order our lobster tails. How about that for a game plan? The cream was just heavenly; light, fluffy, and not too sweet. The only disappointment was they were out of cannoli's but honestly, I can care less about trying those now that I've been able to experience these beauties.
So So good. Carmel Cupcakes and Buttercreame cupcakes no words. I'm not a sweet eater but these were do worth it.

Great service! Great treats! Big fan of the show and I didn't realize they were in Vegas until we started walking around the hotels. Definitely worth a stop! Try the puff pastry, and the cheesecake so good! I like that you can watch them baking from the windows

This place was as good as I had hoped it would be! I have wanted a Lobster tail ever since I saw them on the tv show years ago... my husband brought me to Vegas, and helped me achieve a bucket list! I hope to someday visit the real Carlo's bakery in New Jersey but, this was the next best thing!!

Carlos bakery I love you lol. The sweets are amazing. I bought several cupcakes and they were delicious. The line was kind of long but it didn't take long to order. The staff was nice and friendly. They even told us about the bakery getting built and about the cake boss visits. You feel like family. I can't wait to come back.

They were busy, that was to be expected on Mother's Day though. Service was great and the tiramisu and boston cream pies were delisioso! We had Little canolis, macaroons and rainbow cookies. I enjoyed the coffee as well!

Quick, friendly, and extremely organized! There were many treats to select. They had a glass wall in which you can watch the busy bakers. There were plenty of staff members working hard and quickly serving guest. Thanks for a great Experience.
We had a lobster tail and hazelnut butter cookies both pretty yummy !I recommend checking it out if your in Vegas .

I got a cannoli and it was delicious. My mom was pleased with the lobster tail. My dad on the other hand was not pleased with the prices and wished it was cheaper. In total we paid almost $15 for two cannolis and the lobster tail. While it was a little packed I found it worth it as I used to watch Cake Boss a lot and always wanted to go to one of the bakeries.

Our wait wasn't bad at all...twenty minutes, top. We were a little confused about what to do when we got to the counter as no one greeted us or guided us on what the procedure was, but we ordered a canoli (meh), a red velvet cupcake (ahright, not bad), cream puff (another meh item), a lobster tail (so good!) and the best jam filled cookies we've ever had. Overall impression, clean, homemade tasting, not too sweet but sweet enough, I'd wait in line again type of joint. Especially for the jam cookies.

My husband and I love cake boss so when we saw this place we just HAD to try it. We were not disappointed, the pastries we got were absolutely delicious and delectable. They were sweet and soft, not over baked. And the staff was great, they helped us decide since we didnt know what to choose they have soooo many things!

First off if you never had a cannoli this is the place to go! I probably got one of each dessert! I was not disappointed I knew buddy was something else! Mr. Cake Boss should be happy how this store runs the employees were very customer friendly:)

The only thing I didn't like was waiting in line. I seriously have no clue why people do not give this 5 stars. I had the Cannoli and the cream inside was amazing! Not too sweet or heavy. I loved the look of the bakery, it also has a viewing window so you can watch them making things as you wait in line. I will go back next time I visit Vegas.

I meant to go to the Bouchen bakery instead,but I couldn't remember which bakery had the best cupcakes.This is where one staff said the only bakery stuff there was.Disappointed now I realize the mistake. I did try the brownie, peanut butter cupcake and an oreo pudding. I loved the brownie.It was so rich and creamy. The cupcake was good too.Liked the frosting lots. Oreo pudding was okay, not worth the money. Not going to come back as the line was too long. I'm headed to the Bouchen next time.
This place is amazing!!! The lobster tail was great and so was the cheesecake! To many cry baby's on yelp about waiting in line. It's a known bakery of course there is going to be a wait.

Came for the Cannoli and shockingly they wren't that great! but everything else is spectacular. The cheesecake is perfections and the biscotti mamamia! There's a lot of mouthwatering and deliciously looking items to choose from, been trying two two each time I am there. Definitely a must try when in Las Vegas, just skip the Cannoli and go for anything else! Oh and sometimes there can be a little line so be patient.

Was so excited to finally try the things I've heard about and drooled over for years. AMAZING! Better than I ever imagined and then some. Looking forward to going back again soon. Well worth the short wait in line, and the prices are very reasonable considering the quality. I LOVE IT...IT IS NOW MY ALL TIME FAVORITE BAKERY!
Delicious but expensive. $3.50 for one chocolate chip cookie. Had a cannoli and a cream puff so far, delicious. You pay for Carlos bakery's fame
OMG!!! Sugar-Tooth-Heaven!!! As a kid I enjoyed rainbow cake. Italian/American folks know what I am talking about. Carlo's Bake Shop nailed it. The chocolate strawberries are so freaking good.

So of course we stopped by since I watch his show on tv and I bake I just had to :) I tried the cannoli and it was nice and fresh and crispy... But flavor was only okay... But then we tried the lobster tail and boy oh boy that was a little bit of heaven in my mouth! It made us go back for 2nds! The only down side is this place isn't cheap... Walked out with a box of goodies and it was $49... So that's a bummer but still worth trying... Oh the strawberry cheesecake is very delicious too

Wow. I can't believe how complacent people are. I loved everything that I bought. Don't believe the reviews until you go and try it for yourself. These "one star" and "two star" people are just unhappy and miserable people.

Was here at around noon today. I only waited in line about ten minutes for my number to be called. I ordered a lobster tail, a chocolate cannoli, and a regular cannoli. Waited about another five minutes for the cashier. All of my desserts were in the box when I got home. Tried all of them and they were all very good. Thanks.
Yummy!! So many things to choose from. We tried a cookie, brownie, cannoli and a cupcake and all were fresh and delicious!
Holy Canoli! And crumb cake! Also loved the cheesecake! Lobster tail didn't do it for me...neither did the carrot cake or red velvet.

We went here for the 1st time as part of our family double date. There was a 45 minute line! People behind us said they stood in line a previous time but didn't get in on time so here they were again. Glad we didn't give up. We tried all these pastries & none failed us (picture will be posted in pink box): strawberry cheesecake, chocolate mousse cake, Tiramisu, cream puff, dark chocolate mouse cake, & large chocolate chip cookie. All were amazing but dark chocolate mousse cake was heavenly!! Even though it was good, I'd skip the cookie because it wasn't worth $4+. Downfall, pricing is steep for diabetes proned baked goods - even though they did good, nothing was too sweet except maybe the cookie. All this came out to $50...I am coming back for the dark chocolate mousse. I read other people's reviews & want to try their lobster tail, cannoli, & crumb cake next!! CAN'T WAIT, going again this weekend!! :-D

Finally got a chance to pick up desserts from Carlos bakery. The oatmeal cookies and Carrot cake were really really good. Buddy, your father would be proud. The line was crazy long but it went fast and it was well worth it. Carlos Bakery is a must.

My 26 year old daughter told me to go here and get a treat for my 50th birthday..I went on aug 13th 2016,I did have to wait in line.got there around 9:30 pm at night. I got me a vanilla cupcake and 1 choc.I though it taste very good.My daughter could not have a treat she can only eat gluten free. I wish they had gluten free. I know Bouchon does but did not know they were only open til 7pm.I would not try canoli.I do not like cream cheese in mind.My aunt is from italy and she does not put cream cheese.She puts pudding in hers. and it taste so much better that way.
Amazing! Best deserts and pastries I've ever tried. Have to go back before I leave Vegas.

We were here on a Friday afternoon and thankfully the wait wasn't bad at all, maybe 10-15 minutes max. The employees were nice and helpful and got everything we wanted right away. This was my very first time trying a cannoli and I'm not a big fan of the cream they used but the shell was great, the Napoleon was Ok but the lobster tail was AMAZING! Overall it was good but a bit pricey.

It has been quite a while since I've been wanting to try this bakery for a while, made it here for breakfast, they have really good desserts & the french vanilla coffee came out really good. 3 desserts & 1 coffee did come out to $19 yikes worth every bite though

Wow. There's a reason this guy is the Cake Boss. My girlfriend and me went to Carlo's Bake Shop after attending a show and was surprised to see that the line was minimal, probably because of how late it was. Typically there a long line out the door of folks waiting to experience fine baked good. I had the California Cheesecake which was one of the best cheesecakes I have ever had. My girlfriend stocked up on snacks for the remainder of the trip and purchased a strawberry cheesecake, a couple different types of cupcakes and some amazing cookies! Everything was full of flavor, aesthetically pleasing, fairly priced for Vegas, and the customer service was top notch. I will be making a return journey for my more cheesecake when I return to Vegas!

More gluten free options please!! I wanted a cupcake bad and figured with all their cupcake options in the case, one of them had to be GF. They weren't, but as a consolation prize they had a personal cheesecake covered in chocolate that was. It was delicious, not too sweet and not overly rich.

Best cannoli's I've ever had in my life! Also, the lobster tails are to die for. Unbelievably tasty. You will be so happy you came here. Worth the usually long lines. I just really wish they had a place to sit, but that's okay. That's the only negative thing about this place.

Maybe it's because I was born and raised in Hoboken and was able to enjoy these pastries with no line before the fame so I may be biased. The pastries fir years have been amazing so I never mind the wait. To me it taste awesome but it's a taste of my childhood and I would wait online to recapture that moment. The line is not that bad for what you get. Lobster tail and cannoli was great!!! Everything there is great!!!!

Best Cannoli I have ever had in my life! And I have searched high and low!! Perfect cream, chips, texture! My kids and I loved how we can watch the bakers and decorators while we waited. And the Cannoli Cake! I can't wait to go back to Vegas so I can eat some more!!
I love the biscotti it is pricey as this is vegas and tourist attraction. The Biscotti is well worth it though very lovely with a nice cup of coffee.

This place is worth finding! Up an escalator and down a hallway that leads outside is where you'll find Carlo's. Small? Yes, it's very small, but kust the right size to get in and out. A little pricey IMO, but everything was fantastic. I would go again, but i'll leave a trail of breadcrumbs to find my way back to the casino.
Loved the cheesecake, brownie and cupcakes. Omg!!!!! Only downfall they do not have chocolate milk
The line was a little long, but the pastries were good. It is a little pricey but it is Vegas! Great place to visit, but would love to go to the original.
What?!!! Not enough words exist to describe the crisp crunchy pastry and fresh creme I just ate. Best of the best. Cant handle it.

I'm a huge bakery nut and this place was AMAZING!. It is located inside the Venetian Hotel and Casino. I visited around 3:00 on a Saturday and the line was pretty long outside the shop, but it was quick, and the shop was efficient in getting orders quickly but still being very friendly. I wanted to order multiple items, but most of the good (because they had frosting) were only good for a few hours our of a refrigerator. The girl taking my order was very friendly and offered to let me pay for all of my items but only take what I was planning on eating, and they would store the rest of my order until the end of the day! Because of this option I was able to order more it me because I didn't have to worry about them going bad before I could eat them. I bout a Lobster tail, a cupcake, and an Ã©clair. All of the items were very good, but the Lobster tail was by far them best! I was very happy with the service, the food, and how timely they were with orders. I would come back here again.
Try the hazelnut cream puff. It will knock your socks off. Went on a Tuesday so very short line and live music across the hall at buddy's made the wait fun.

The cookies. The cannolis. The line might be daunting at times, but this is worth the wait. It's clear there is delicate care and attention to detail in their products. Ive heard the "lobster pastries" are delicious and I'm gonna have to go back again for this next treat.

Get the lobster tail. Best dessert I have ever had the pleasure of experiencing. Next to that, the cannolis... Oh my goodness!!! You'll need an intense workout after devouring them but you won't regret it!
First timer at Carlo's Bake Shop. I tried the Cannoli's of course, strawberry tart and a caramel cupcake. All pretty good. It's definitely somewhere to visit while in Vegas.

I love watching Cake Boss and was excited when I found out Vegas had this spot! This place is definitely a go to! I got to try a little bit of everything...from the chocolate chip cookies to the apple turnovers to the carrot cupcake! My favorite was definitely the turnover it was so flakey and soft and the carrot cake was moist but it was kind of flavorless...

We went there on a Friday at 1pm and there was no line. We ordered two Canolis - a plain one & the chocolate coated one. The Canolis were really yummy and a really good size. I love the cake boss so it gets a 4 star as the crust of the Canolis was beautiful - not sure I would rush back again or line up.

Glad we went a little earlier because by the time we left there was already a line waiting on the side. Didn't like that they took our order then called us back to view everything then call us back to pay for it. Couldn't one girl just get our order and package it while I told them what I wanted then ring us up?? Oh well. But the treats were okay. Not as bad as some of the fellow yelpers kept saying. Had the lobster tail, red velvet cupcake and a flower one. Then two different cream puffs and a few other things I can't remember. Would definitely be back.

Worth the long line and high prices. Crumb cake, carrot cake, and strawberry shortcake were out of this world. The line was about an hour when we went. They need to speed up their process which is why I couldn't give 5 stars. And unfortunately we didn't run into Buddy.

We had to go while in Vegas just to say we've been there. The line took at least 30 minutes to get through but we got some cookies, an eclair, and a Boston cream parfait thing. The cookies were delicious, the other stuff, average. Glad we went tough!

I stopped by on a Saturday mid afternoon. The line was not long. Waited about 30 minutes. yes, the line is not perfect yet. I did grab a ticket first, but then an employee came around with tickets (her number was smaller than mine) because most people do not grab a number. I got a lobster tail, Ã©clair and cannoli. The best was the lobster tail and Ã©clair. The cannoli was OK. I will be back!!! I will try different things - the cheesecake. Next time will have to try the restaurant as well.

We visited this location because of the recommendation from a coworker. But, we ultimately returned a few more times before the end of our stay, because we enjoyed the chocolate chip m&m cookies. I agree that the service is hit and miss - some of the ladies who work here act as if they are barely able to tolerate the tourists.

We definitely beat the rush!! Very satisfied with our service! Magaly was the one taking our order and she was such a sweetie!! We didn't see chocolate covered strawberries (we wanted some to drink with our champagne for our anniversary) and I asked Magaly about it. She said they don't have any to sell separately, but she would check with the baker. She comes back so happy and smiling and told me her baker would make them for us! It's people like her that do their best to satisfy customers that make me wanna come back! Thanks so much!! We haven't even paid yet or tried anything! I was just too excited to brag about Magaly! Keep up the good work, girl!! Thanks so much!! :) :)

I really enjoyed the pastries that we tried but I agree with other reviews that there is NO sense of urgency from the employees! Wait in line to order your pastries then go get in another line to pay for them! Both times we went, the paying line took forever. The cashier seemed to always be M.I.A
The best bakery in town. My daughter watched the shows and she couldn't wait to try it!!!

Without a doubt, cannolis are one of my favorite desserts ever. So after driving down the strip during a BUSY edc weekend, I notice buddy's picture at the venetian. My heart dropped. I have been wanting to try his cannolis for the longest time. My boyfriend and I even considered getting it shipped on the website just to try, but I knew deep down it wouldn't be the same. After the long weekend with little to no sleep, I begged my friends if we can stop by so I can live one of my many food dreams and eating that beautiful carlo's bakery cannoli. With two hours before the flight, we quickly walked through the canal shops where we waited in a not too long line. That was the first thing that made me happy. I HATE waiting. We weren't in line for very long, maybe about 20 minutes. It was finally my turn to order and there they were, the cannolis I've been waiting to try all weekend! Knowing I couldn't take them all the way back to California with me, especially in that horrible Vegas heat, I had to settle for two :( I also decided to get a few lobster tails and a piece of crumb cake because I was definitely eyeing those as well. Loved the cannoli and the crumb cake! Haven't tried the lobster tail just yet but judging from the other two, I'm pretty sure I will love it as well. I don't remember the girl's name who helped me but she was very nice and helpful! She was kind of short and had glasses. Made my experience just that better. I can't wait for my Vegas trip to get more!

I ordered cannoli and lobster tail... these are the two that you should try when you are at the Strip in Las Vegas... the lobster tail is crazy delicious if you like a cream filled dessert.... way much better than a cream puff.

So I been waiting for a while o check this place out, Im really not a huge bakery fan but I love watching Cake BOss and wanted to see what exactly is the big fuss. I wasnt a fan of the cupcakes but i liked the cannolie but LOVE the LOBSTER TAIL....

I love Cake Boss and made a special trip one evening of our Vegas vacation to visit Carlo's Bake Shop in the Venetian. Giving this place 4 stars for yummy deserts. The evening we went to visit was a Saturday night, the line was long but it moved quickly. There is a window to see them preparing deserts but not much was happening when we were in line.
