Once we got to the front we choose a bunch of different deserts - a cupcake with a Ace of Spades on it, some butter cookies dipped in chocolate and sprinkles,a chocolate mousse mini cake with ganache, a brownie, a cannoli, a napoleon and a black and white cookie. The icing on the cupcake was yummy, the mini cake, brownie, cannoli and b&w cookie were all tasted. Everything except the b&w cookie was really good. I'm not a fan of that cookie and it is one of their famous treats on the show. Oh well. It was fun and $37 later I was relieved I didn't spend more. They took the order, collected the items and packed them all in boxes tied with string and bagged. I didn't like that they didn't specify what needed to be refrigerated and unfortunately we left it all on the table that night and realized that we needed to throw out some of the perishables the next day without tasting them.

I read quit a few poor reviews but had to try it anyway! It's cake boss! I had a great experience! Great service, no line, friendly staff! Dessert was fantastic! Shared a lobster tail and caramel cupcake!

I am not a fan of the show but wanted to have the taste of real cannoli's once again. Being from the East Coast, I decided to try my luck through the crowds. YEP, it's crowded but this is Vegas. Everything is crowded. Cannoli's: Wonderful! The pastries and brownies: DIVINE. The lobster tails: Amazing. The Nut bars: OH. MY. HEAVENLY. NUTBAR! I have tried so many things from there, and I have not been disappointed once. It is a fantastic addition to Vegas and I hope they open another "off the strip" location so I can make them a weekly trip. The staff is all wonderful and attentive. Keep up the good work, guys!

The cookies were mediocre for the looooong wait in line, but the lobster claws and the canolis were amazing! I cannot understand why they do not add more help and at least two more registers. This place is all long waits. Five stars if they figure out a way to speed things up. Three hours is too long.

Carlo's Bakery in Las Vegas was such a neat treat! No, it is not New Jersey, and the place is small, so do not expect tons and tons of variety. For a small shop set up inside the Venitian Hotel shoppes, it was very fun to visit! My favorite baked goods were the eclaires with chocolate on top, and the pecan white puffs! They even sell souvenirs which was the icing on the cake for me! The sweets are not cheap, yet not expensive. Expect to pay about $4.00 for one sweet. You are in Vegas though, almost nothing is cheap! You can watch employees bake pastries while you wait for your sweets to be boxed and bagged! I went there twice during my stay in Vegas and even brought some home with me on my carry on!
Such delicious pastry's. The prices are a little high but are worth it. The cannoli's are to die for and my favorite! Don't be surprised with how busy it is, you need to try it out!

I was here on Monday afternoon I waited in line to try out the cannolis and lobster tails they were AMAZING! As I was placing my order the girl was very nice enough to box it the way I wanted it she had excellent customer service (girl with a tattoos) she recommend the crum cake and the red velvet cupcakes they were also amazing I'm glad she recommend it she called me to checky order I was amazed by how fast it was done and how quickly it was packaged but as my name was called to the register the customer service was not very good my wife and I were so disappointed by the way she treated us very horrible attitude and on top of that she gave me the incorrect change I was $5 dollars short and when I asked her she just rolled her eyes and snatched the money out my hand I believe her name was Jessica or jeniffer, other then that everything was perfect I'll be glad to come back here just as long as I get attended by another cashier who gives the correct change with less attitude

Went here Tuesday 9/2 and there was only a short wait. The workers that helped me were very friendly and helpful. Everything I ordered was delicious especially the cannoli and lobster tail!!!!!! I will definitely go back on my next trip to Vegas!!!!
Highly recommend the lobster tail & the cannolis! The items were slightly pricey but you pay for the name & quality. Caution- the line was super long but it was definitely worth it!!

I went to this place and it was amazing! I was only in line for 15 minutes and they had samples along the way! I had the strawberry short cake and was the best I've ever had! I would totally recommend this place.

The bakery itself is tiny and overcrowded (which leads to raised expectations ). The staff is quick and friendly (which helps after the inordinately long wait time! ). However, the cakes themselves aren't exceptional . They are good, but given the wait time and the price, "good " simply isn't good enough ...
it was great, got a box of goodies and intended on taking them back home for my family to enjoy but for some reason they never made it, we ate them all!

I have been waiting to try this place since my last trip to Vegas. Line or no line I was committed to checking this off of my bucket list. Good thing too because the line was really long and I was in it for over 45 minutes. Fortunately, the hubby was willing to wait, and more fortunately, the line was organized. I just felt bad for the girl managing the line. Since it was separated into 3 sections, she had to keep running back and forth to keep the flow going, guide potential cutters to the back of the line (which was past the bathrooms), and hand out menus and samples. I would just suggest that they also block off the first part of the line leading directly into the bake shop so it is more obvious that people can't just walk in when it's extremely busy. A lot of people coming in from the front didn't even realize that the line was so long, so that caused a little friction between the staff and the customers who had been waiting so long. Anyway, down to the pastries... We ordered the mini cannolis, lobster tails, cupcakes, raspberry rugalach, and m&m cookie. The cheesecakes looked divine, but at $10 a piece I had no trouble passing them up and I think a lot of people felt the same way because they seemed to have an untouched, endless supply. I really wanted to get their 7-layer cookie because they looked so good on that one Cake Boss episode where they made a gigantor tray for a pregnant lady, but I didn't see any. The cannolis were delish. The lobster tails had a crispness unparalleled by any pastry I have ever had, but less cream would have made them perfect. The cupcakes were ok - not sure why they put a walnut on top of their red velvet cupcake (completely unnecessary, and dangerous for someone with a nut allergy who would typically consider this a safe bet). The frosting on their blue snowflake holiday cupcake was just too sweet - I would have liked a whipped cream based frosting. I can't personally speak to the raspberry rugalach because I wanted to save whatever available stomach room I had for the cannolis, but according to my husband, they were pretty good (that's a lot coming from him). The m&m cookie was waaaaaaaaay too sweet. I'd skip it entirely. Even if this is your go-to dessert. Skip it. And don't let your kids eat it. Even if they beg. Service was good - quick and competent. The cashier was really nice and very helpful when I asked for water and additional cream for the coffee we ordered. All in all, I was glad I finally got to try this place. A little overpriced, but that's Vegas for you. If you've been thinking about trying it, just do it. And be sure to order the cannolis!

This place was busy and the service was good, our counter person was good at what he does. He knows the product and how to sell it. We took our goodies back to our room. Everything I had was excellent. The items price wise are in line with the hotels on the strip pastry shops. I would go back again.

I had to check it out when I heard it was coming to Vegas. The line was a bit long but it moved pretty quickly and it has only been open for a few months and it is the strip. The staff has been friendly every time I have gone also. I LOVE the American Napolian pastry. I have driven to the strip just for that. I also like the crumb cake a lot (it reminds me of the kind my grandma used to make). The cannoli and lobster tale were okay but not great (to me) and my son liked their chocolate chip cookies. Yes the prices are a bit higher than you would think but they are handmade, a celebrity bakery, AND it is the strip after all. I have not spent more than $20 there and gotten at least 4-7 things every time which is not that bad when all is considered.
I love this place. Wait is long so come before 10 am. The cannolis was good but really didn't care for the lobster tail.
loved it, the wait is long but what do you expect its on the strip, lobster tail cream was awsome, find your favorite and enjoy. Thanks carlo
Delicious cannoli and lobster tail! Long lines, but worth the wait. No where to sit and eat at the bakery, so brought our treats back to the hotel room.

We bought a custom cake for our daughter's 15th birthday, as she has watched the show since its inception. The staff were very helpful, as they prepared the cake for travel, as we were taking it on the plane with use. When we picked it up, the cake was even more beautiful than we imagined. The fondant, flowers, and scrolling were mind-blowing and the edible glitter was a great touch, making the cake sparkle. Unfortunately, after I picked it up and brought it to our hotel room, the custom made fondant #5 of the "15" sagged and broke. I was worried that, after I signed the form when I picked it up that products damaged after pick-up can't be returned, they would not be obliging. Nothing could be further from the truth. I got to the stored just as they were closing and the staff stayed late to fix it the best they could as a new one could not be made at that late hour and we had a 6am flight out the next morning! The surprise on my daughter's face when we should up with a Cake Boss cake is something I'll never forget. Upon eating it, all involved agreed it was the best red velvet cake they had ever had.
How exciting that Carlos Bakery is in Las Vegas. We had the Lobster Roll, it was perfect! There is a long wait to get into the Bakery. Don't give up, it is worth the wait.

I heard the lines can reach up to 2 hours but i went at about 4 and only waited 40 minutes. They were out of canolis but i ate at his restauraunt right after and they had both the canolis and the lobster tails which were THE BEST IVE HAD. The cupcakes were moist and delicious. 10/10

Cake boss!!!! Very small bakery right across from buddy's restaurant in the Venetian. For being so small it has a good selection of desserts. Prices were very reasonable for these types of desserts. The bakery staff was super friendly and helpful. We went around 730 pm on a wed and they were not too busy. I can imagine though that there are times when this place gets packed. My girlfriend tried the lobster tail and I had the mini white mousse. My dessert was awesome, loved the flavor combination and it was actually enough for 2 maybe even 3 people. The bakery is really cool because you can see the bakers through a big glass window creating awesome desserts. The place smells delicious also! I'll be back!!!

Waited in line not very long maybe 15 minutes. The young man taking orders was very sweet and helpful in his recommendations. We had just eaten a buffet so did not get much but what we had was outstanding!!!!!!! I had a cannoli my son a chocolate covered strawberry, some friends in our party had the creme puffs and cannolis. EVERYTHING was delicious. This place is on the list of HAVE TO GO while in Vegas. They also wrapped it up very nicely in boxes tied with string and bagged!

This is a stop you must take if you are in the Venetian! The lobster tails and crumb cake are to die for. It is the best crumb cake I have ever had in my life! The wait time is long but nothing compared to the original location! If you get there early enough the wait time is not bad. I think I was there some time between 11-1 and the wait time was not bad but it got really crowded right after we got there. It is worth it if you are a fan of Cake Boss or just looking for some amazing crumb cake. I highly recommend it. It is also fun to watch the people make the pastries next door while you are waiting for your treats!

My kids are huge fans of Cake Boss so when we were on vacation in Vegas and we saw the billboards with Buddy we knew that we had to stop by. Yes, there was a 20 min wait in line but even the service for that was wonderful. I am disabled and I walk with a cane, when the line tender noticed me he pulled me out of line and offered a chair for me to wait in, most places are not that considerate. The sweats were also wonderful and the girls working the counter were very nice as well as helpful. I will be back next time I'm in Vegas.

I got the Chocolate Strawberry Mousse Tower and it was delicious. I also got a Lobster Tail and a mini Dark Chocolate Mousse Cake for my husband and the kids to try. I'm sure they'll be just as good, based on the reviews on here. The wait was about 1 hr, but I was expecting it, so it didn't seem that long. I'd say it's definitely worth going if you're a fan of the show. I don't know when I'll ever make it to Hoboken to go to the original Carlos.

My sister and I went on Tuesday and there was no line. Only maybe 5 ppl infront of us. I got a lobster tail and cannoli. Both were delicious. Loved the lobster tail. My sister got some cookies and the crumb cake. My favorite was the large round raspberry jelly powder sugar cookie she got. So dang good. The jelly was so delicious and fresh. The crumb cake was good but was hard. Overall the pastries were good and just experiencing Carlos Bakery here in Vegas is pretty cool. But for the $$ they charge you could go to a local baker and pay less for the same quality.

Carlo's Bake Shop is an awesome place for a pastry. I wish the location was better in the Venetian/Palazzo shopping area. I actually went here twice during my trip to Las Vegas. First time I ordered the strawberry shortcake, a cannoli, and a triple chocolate cookie. The strawberry shortcake was good. The shortcake was soft, strawberries were fresh, and the cream wasn't too sweet. The cookie had white chocolate chips and the cookie was obviously chocolate. I wasn't a big fan of the cannoli. It was my first time ever having a cannoli. The second time I got a dozen of cookies to bring back home. 3 oatmeal raisins, 3 triple chocolate, 3 chocochips, and 3 m&ms. They have other treats behind the glass and you can see each one clearly over there. The service can be a little better. The lady seemed like she had an attitude and didn't want to be there. Other than that you should at least try this place once.

Amazing!!! I love the show Cake Boss and I was super excited to find out about the bakery in Vegas. After reading the reviews here I was hesitant at first because it seemed like I would have a bad experience but I'm so glad I went. First we went on Saturday evening and we only waited approximately 15 minutes and that was total wait. There was not a huge selection but it's a small bakery and I wasn't expecting everything to be there. We ordered the dark chocolate mini cake and a brownie and ooooohhhhh myyyyy wooordddd they were incredible! Worth every penny. So I would have to say if you are influenced by reviews hopefully this helps because my experience was completely how I wanted it to be!

I really enjoyed the red velvet cupcake and my boyfriend had a chocolate cupcake. They were ok! The only thing that didn't make sense was that Carlo's does not serve milk to go with their fabulous desserts. I was told by the staff that I could go downstairs and get milk at Walgreens, which I thought was weird. I'm a local and I don't think I would go back. Milk...it does a dessert good!

Completely a fan of this place!!! Everyone is complaining about the wait but we got in and out in less than 10 minutes and we went on a wednesday afternoon!!! For sure worth the wait! The lobster tails are mind blowing!! Cannolis delicious and the cupcakes YUM!!! I would for sure go back and I had been waiting awhile to try some of the cake boss goodies and it turned out to be everything I expected and more! Stop with the bad reviews about the wait because on the show there is always a wait as well!!!

My friend keep talking about buying some treats here while our trip in vegas. The line was not as bad we arrived @10pm and we made friends waiting line so made it more fun. My rexommendation to be there as soon they open because they have somethings only in the morning. Bought extra for the family and they loved ut so the wait is totally worth and make sure you take enough $$$$$. When your there you go over bored. I wanted to try everything but they had rub out ofalot things but defenetly going back
So delicious! We ordered cannolis and mousse cake, both were fantastic. I recommend going right after opening or right before closing otherwise the line is very long!

I'm doing a late review.. a year late, but o well. I think Carlo's Bake Shop met all expectations of mine. Being a fan of the show I knew what to expect, long lines and a variety of pastries! The line was actually not too bad for me, it was somewhat long, but this is a tourist spot, so I really didn't mind. I went for the infamous lobster tail and regular canoli which I have never tried, so I really didn't know what they SHOULD taste like. i thought they were good, the lobster tail was flaky on the outside and the creamy inside was super sweet. The canoli was pretty similar in taste for me. The next time I go I won't get the same thing just because there is a lot more sweet goodness I want to try. The people writing all these horrendous reviews about Carlo's Bake Shop need to not be so critical...It's a famous Bake shop so expect a long line and pick and chose wisely, your fault if you don't like what you picked lol all bakers are different so have an open mind, gosh. lol

I consider myself a cannoli expert. Seeing the show on tv made me curious and I've wanted to try the baked goods from here for quite some time. The cannoli were some of the best I've had. The lobster tail was light and crispy. I would have given 5 stars but the selection was limited.

I was so excited to try the deserts from here after watching there shows so many times.... they did have a lot of options and yes there was a huge line so my rating is mostly on everything the pastries were really good I only got the lobster tail and chocolate cupcake which when I got home I wanted more to bad I live around 700miles away hahaha well anyways I lowered a star because they have BAD service the girl employees are so slow!!! I mean there's a huge line and there's only 3 girls helping with the order and than yhey stop to have a full conversation with each other!!! Like really do u not see the line !!! But besides there bad customer service the deserts are really good

Had to visit the Carlos bakery and went on a sat. Night. The line was as long as a show line in Vegas. Didn't wait but went back at 745am before they opened at 8. Already 10 people in front of me. Wow but worth the wait. Very organized pleasant staff, prices reasonable, best lobster tails I ever had. The cannolis are to die for. Yum I will be back waiting in line before I leave Vegas. Kudos to the manager and to buddy.

I don't get the negative reviews. I've been wanting to try this place for a while. Finally got the chance. Yes, I waited 40 minutes, but once I got in, the service was fast and smooth. I got a lobster tail, a chocolate canoli and a strawberry tart. I used to hate canoli's, but the one here is AMAZING! So was everything else. I dream of the chocolate cannoli now. I think it's more than worth it and would swim in those chocolate cannolis if I could!

The lobster tail was great with the touch of Bailey's. The Napoleon were goid. The seven layer cookies were average barely any taste of almond paste. The Ã©clairs are nothing special. I will reserve my final ratings till I taste a cake. Overall a good place.

I am so glad they brought Carlos Bakery out to Las Vegas! Being a local it's fun to have family friendly places to visit here. Although it is a busy place that is to be expected! We tried a vanilla cupcake, raspberry tarte, a cannoli tower, and cannoli! Everything was so delicious!!! It's a little pricey but a must go to! Ignore the negative reviews, budget in a treat or two and have fun! My husband and I loved it and will be sharing this with our family and friends.

I love this place! My sister and I tried it for the first time about 3 years ago and have been in love ever since! Customer service is always great even if it's busy, they get through the lines pretty quick! I love the rainbow cake and today I tried their lobster tale cookies and cream flavor and it was AMAZING!
Holy Cannoli! While visiting the Venetian Casino we decided to grab a sweet and since Cake Boss is a staple we decided why not. It was pretty amazing!
Loved the lobster tail My chocolate covered strawberry was mushy tho, but they were nice enough to refund me.

I always get the lobster tail! It's my absolute favorite. The texture is amazing and crispy. The filling is the perfect sweetness. I went today and there was no line. I wish there was tables outside to sit and eat but there's not even a single chair....

rainbow cake was so pretty!! The sprinkle cookie was our favorite. It is an absolute must if you are cookie lover. It has a soft cake like texture like nothing else I've tried in the cookie world. Cannoli was tasty and the vanilla cupcake was simply perfection. Make the trip to the Venetian for some desserts!!

Ok, I'm updating my review to 4 stars because we had the cannoli and confetti cake. I'm still giving the rainbow cake, cheesecake and lobster tail low stars, but the cannoli is definitely with the money AND the calories. The confetti cake was a delicious way to welcome in my 40th birthday!

My daughter is a HUGE fan of Buddy Valastro, Carlo's Bakery. We have been to the original location in Hoboken, NJ. I am more of an Ace of Cakes fan, just kidding... I only added this to get my daughter mad, LOL. Quality/Quantity - We have tried everything in his bakery and at his Buddy V's Ristorante. So on this trip we only got: Salted Caramel Lobster Tail - one of his most famous items Chocolate Dipped Cannoli - okay, but another one of his "must try" items Lemon Linzer Cookie - nothing special, my daughter just wanted it. Atmosphere - Small take-out location. However, you can see the bakers work through major glass windows. But his Buddy V's Ristorante across the bakery is huge. And he just opened his Pizza Cake Restaurant location at Harrahs Casino. Service - Good Price - $17.18, expensive; but still worth it for his signature items. Owner Suggestion - Congrats on all your success! From all your television shows to being a producer, and of course all 20 bakeries and 3 restaurants with 1500 employees.

I honestly almost didn't go here because of the negative reviews. But you know what... I'm glad we decided to see for ourselves. The cake and cannoli were great! The cake wasn't dry as others have said. It was moist and very good. Give Carlo's Bakery a shot if you're at the Venetian!

I was very excited to see Carlo's Bakery at the Venetian Shops. I had visited the original location in Hoboken and was blown away by the desserts and staff. This location was set up similarly in style. There was social distancing being enforced with only a few customers entering the bakery at one time. I walked over to the cases and browsed the goods. A staff member came up to me to take my order. I ordered two cupcakes (both with white cake - one chocolate icing and the other vanilla icing), two chocolate chip cookies, and two brownies. The staff member didn't speak much to me and didn't come off as very friendly. It could have been a busy day even if I arrived at a lull. After ordering, I was instructed to wait for my name to be called for pick up and to pay. I waited about 5 minutes before my name was called. Everything was packaged nicely so that it would survive the 5 minutes walk to my room at The Palazzo. My total was a little less than $30. Which seems a bit pricey for 6 items. When I got back to my room, I couldn't wait to dive right into a cupcake. It was delicious! The cake was moist and the icing was perfect! Just as I remembered from my visit to the Hoboken Bake Shop. After eating the cupcake, I couldn't help myself and I ate a chocolate chip cookie. It was so soft and chocolatey. These cookies were as good as the ones I brought home from The Hoboken Bake Shop for my family to try. Very tasty! The one thing I disliked was the brownie. It tasted off. I normally love fudge brownies, but I couldn't finish this one. It had that dusty chocolatey taste to it. The icing on top was okay. I was a bit disappointed with this dessert. Overall, I love this bakery! The cupcakes and cookies are by far my favorite from both this Vegas shop and the one in Hoboken. Definitely recommend!

You're forewarned to get to the bakery it is a mission from the Venetian guest parking lot. But the walk is worth it. We ordered a cake with Cristina for my mother in law and it came out fantastic! We got some goodies while there and all in all FRESH, DELICIOUS & perfectly sized for us! Major thank yous to Cristina she went above and beyond for us it is greatly appreciated! Thank you Cristina for making the cake even better than we thought! Definitely worth taking a trip into the Venetian for Carlos Bakery Team!

We bought a variety of desserts to share & taste. Everything was delicious! A couple favorites were the lobster tails filled with Irish cream & the rainbow cake. The chocolate covered cannoli was kinda heavy on the chocolate & if we were to order one again we would buy a plain one, not dipped. Just a personal preference, not that it was bad it was just a lot of chocolate overwhelming the cannoli flavor for us. It's not a cheap dessert place but their desserts are to die for & we will return to Carlos' on a future trip to Vegas for a decadent treat. It would be nice if they had any kind of seating available. The few chairs we saw were roped off not to be used. After walking a ton in Vegas it would be nice to be able to sit somewhere & enjoy these desserts, not just have to take them to go. If they had some kind of seating to sit & enjoy the desserts I would give this place a full 5 star rating.

There are many places that you can go to and have the best chocolate cake or have the best in Carrot cake but when you you like something that is very creamy and makes you return for a second time and get a second that is really good and the flavor is the best . There is one thing that many Say is anything you do in Vegas is stays in Vergas but there are so many thing that many people don't know of is there are some really great bakeries that are in the city of Las Vegas and the many restaurants are the best in Dinner .Yes for many if you remember the television series Cake Boss is the one that has created his own restaurants and some of the best baked delicious deserts that have attracted so many across the United States . Yes the many deserts that you see his stores make and the colorful cakes can make one say its a wonderland of fine cakes and deserts and the many deserts are of the New York style deserts . When I had went to Vegas that I wanted to see what Carlos was about the many people and yet the bakery looked like just another bakery and the customers were just the ones that were getting things to take back home to there many states . The many deserts that were at Carlos had to be the great grouping and the many fruity flavors that came out of Carlos Bakery I could tell the staff there had done many cakes and they were getting things ready for more to be put out .The many cakes they have there are the best in town and the many Italian flavors you find the multi colored cakes that have the best fruit flavors , and the grand cakes the carrot cake and the Red Velvet Cakes that have real cream cheese frosting . At the Venetian Hotel you can see the Gondaleirs that steer the long boats that you can take a ride in with your wife or wife to be there are so many that love the Venetian . With Carlos Bakery and the Restaurant that is close by you can the best Italian Dinner that you have ever tasted and still have room for desert . Yes the Venetian is one of the best and with the great place of Carlos you get to sit have great cake or baked good that is pure Italian .

Yummy cake and cannolis! Located inside the Venetian hotel! They do not have seating so it's a grab and go kind of place. Lots of variety! It definitely gets crowded so try to arrive early or not at peak times! It is expensive but worth the cost.

I've always wanted to try his pastries since I've heard so many things about it but I've always been to lazy to try to find it lol. Embarrassed to say this cause I've always stayed at palazzo/Venetian as a visitor to resident. I had to wait in line but they had an efficient system going on so the wait wasn't too bad. Let me just start by saying EVERYTHING LOOKS GOOD! Like I wanted to get everything but I knew it was going to be very expensive as no prices were marked, it's like order what looks good then surprise! I ended up getting 2 lobster tails, 2 cannolis, and a strawberry cheesecake. The lobster tails were AMAZING. They were crispy and perfect, even when I ate it around 5 hours after buying them. I liked that they weren't too sweet and even my mom loved them. I am definitely going to buy more of those when I go back. The cannolis on the other hand weren't that good. I ended up only eating half of one and gave the other one away. I was disappointed in them and wish I had ordered more lobster tails instead. The cheesecake was expensive like almost $12 and it was so small. It was pretty good though, there's not much crust or anything like Cheesecake Factory ones but more like just the cheesecake part. If you're a cheesecake fan I definitely recommend. Overall I'd definitely go back for more lobster tails. I'd highly recommend you get some if you stop by! The bakery is pretty pricey but if it's good, it's worth it!

I love EVERYTHING here ... literally, There's all kinds of yummy desserts here such as cookies and cakes & my personal favorite is the rainbow cake it's DELICIOUS Every time I visit Las Vegas I have to make a stop here just for that rainbow cake!! I usually buy one slice of it & then regret why I didn't buy 2 But the good thing is, that it's a giant slice and serves me twice!!!!! Yaayyy

I've loved the show so I visited the last two times I was in Vegas. The service is always great! The store is clean and decorated in a bright, warm manner. I had cannoli last time. It was fabulous. This time, my friend enjoyed a rainbow slice and I enjoyed this delectable display of sweetness. I was only able to eat half. It was topped with apple pie, with the pumpkin pie in the middle and pecan pie as base. Then, there are white cake slices in between. It's heaven in dessert form. The pumpkin was creamy perfection. The pecan pie was excellent. And the apple pie just added the extra touch of sweetness! Of course, the white cake was fantastic. You must stop in when you're in Vegas!
Everyone was very kind here. It was very organized. I loved the strawberries and the cheesecake. The fudge cake was alright though to me as well as the cannoli.
I tried the red velvet & vanilla sprinkles. They both were delicious but I prefer the vanilla. The employees were really polite.

I love bakeries and this one was delicious. I've been a couple times. Previously had the cannoli which I sadly didn't love. This time had a lobster tail which was flaky and creamy custard. The fudge brownie was so soft and fudgy. My kind of brownie. And my kiddo loved his Oreo cupcake. Service was quick and my kids liked watching the people make the cakes and cookies

Found this gem in the Venetian. Amazing amazing amazing!! We got a slice of the rainbow cake and it was the perfect balance of cake and icing. We also ordered two lobster tails. I wish we ate them right away. We waited a tad too long to eat them and they were a bit hard. Taste was there though... you know that it's the most popular item they have when there were only a few left on the tray. Hehe!

Ventured out to the Grand Canal Shops to eat here at Carlos. This bakery is top notch when it comes to pastries. I had a lobster and cream craving that came over me. I was able to soothe it here with a lobster tail pastry. The bakery is so cute with an old world type feel, I believe that the store having red brick delivers this to the guest. The ambiance of the bakery is a positive excitement but fast paced. The guest specialist that assisted me was very welcoming and so upbeat. This most excellent specialist was named Jasmine. She wrapped both of the pastries that I purchased in a cute little box and with a red and white ribbon on it. The gift wrapping is extra and did not even have to pay extra for it. The cashier that rang my order was Aleena. She was also pleasant and professional. The process was smooth and painless. I order as I said before the Lobster Tail which was so great. The lobster flavor was perfect and oh so good. This Mousse Puff with Chocolate was talking to me through the glass to so I decided to try that as well. The puff was great but the chocolate was so creamy. I decided to mix the chocolate cream and the lobster tails creme together and it was a delicious black and white delight.
White chocolate mousse cake and carrot cake were delicious! The white chocolate interior was so creamy like cheesecake with a cake base. Carrot cake was moist and balance of spice.
I have loved watching Cake Boss and was excited to try this place in Vegas. The cannaoli was amazing. Love the selection and it was really easy to get in and order.

I do enjoy Carlos bakery however it seems everytime I visit they have less variety that's why 4 stars and not 5. I remember the first time I visited they had danishes and smaller bites today they had cake slices, cheesecakes, cupcakes, lobster tails which seem smaller and cannolis.

Had to, just had to, when you are in The Venetian you have to go to Carlo's Bakery. My daughters are in town and we told them about the bakery...had to go. They got carrot cake, confetti cake, cannoli and cheesecake. Carrot cake, according to my daughter is amazing

Who doesn't love an occasional sweet treat after winning or losing! Located inside the Venetian Carlos bakery is an open kitchen where you can see the action and pickup a cookie or baked delight to go. Even in the afternoon they offer plenty to choose from. My favorite at that time were the cannolis. Carlos bakery worth the stop.
The bakery was amazing! Loved the Strawberry Shortcake I got for my birthday and the Cheesecake I got for my mom were beyond delicious!!

Would recommend getting the Hoboken Special as it contains most of the small pastries really signature to the Cake Boss show (cannoli, lobster tails, and the rainbow cake as slices). The lobster tail pastry is very similar to the Italian sfogliatella pastry, but is unique to New York and filled with French cream instead of ricotta cheese. Though I also REALLY loved the mini cheesecakes and was really happy about the variety of lobster tail flavors. Also, if you get a bigger order, double-check you got anything before leaving. Would recommend eating the lobster tails fresh. They're still good overnight in the fridge, but it's NOTHING compared to when you first get them. XD For those not as familiar, Carlo's Bakery is the Italian bakery featured on the Cake Boss show. They're based in Hoboken where the original bakery is, but now have locations all over the US and some in Canada. For those from California, they have a location in Santa Monica. This Las Vegas bakery location in The Venetian (so free parking) also faces their sister restaurant (Buddy V's Ristorante, different from Pizza Cake By Buddy Valastro that's down the Strip) and supplies the various Cake Boss "ATMs" (vending machines) where you can get fresh slices of the rainbow cake. XD If you're there when it's busy, you'll probably see employees with ordering pads taking orders as far down the line as they can. We kind of jumped the gun and ordered early on, but I would advise against doing so as there are more items up front near the register that you might want. Specifically, I wanted to get an additional lobster tail. They'll let you add it to your order but with how busy things get, things sometimes slip. In our case, since our whole order was in one taped-up box, we didn't realize we were charged for (but missing) the additional lobster tail. They were great about that though. We called ahead, they checked their records, and recognized us when we went back to get that pastry. And it was SO worth it. We ended up going back a couple of times while we were in Vegas, just kept coming back. Overall, would definitely recommend, they're so much fun!
If you have a sweet tooth and are looking for a huge selection of delicious desserts, definately go check out this unique bakery!!!

Ordered a 6" cake, lobster tails, and cannolis. I don't know if I'd spend so much on a cake again, it was good but probably not gonna be something I'll need to have again. Lobster tails were ok. But the cannolis are very good. Even the next day still delicious.

Back home on the East Coast, I have been consistently unwilling to wait in the LONG LONG lines that are always present to get into Carlo's Bakery! This time however, was early in the morning, inside of the Venetian Resort and there was NO line. It was a great opportunity to order a coffee and a cannoli and sit in the piazza, under a fake Venetian sky, eating my CB breakfast. Cannoli was solid! Thanks Cake Boss!

I've been wanting to try this place for the last 3 years, my first visit the line was about an hour long and I didn't want to wait but this time I was waiting no matter what! I absolutely love Cake Boss and every time I watch it I'm always drooling over the cakes and desserts so when I found out he had a bakery in Vegas I knew I had to try it out. The line was pretty long when we got here, I think we waited 30-40 minutes but it was definitely worth it. The bakery is very small and they have a few people taking orders but only two cashiers so this could be why the line takes so long. They have about 4 cases full of yummy desserts, they have a variety of cupcakes, cakes and cookies. Of course they have cannolis, their famous "lobster tail" pastries among other delectables. I ordered the Salted Caramel Lobster Tail and Cannoli Cake Tower, then we ordered a half a dozen cupcakes to taste. The lobster tail was very good, the saltiness complimented the sweetness of the cream inside and the caramel so it wasn't overly sweet and the pastry was nice and flaky. The cannoli cake tower was so good, there was a thin layer of cake at the bottom with a nice thick layer of cannoli filling in the middle, another thin layer of cake then whipped cream on top. It really didn't need the whipped cream and I wish there was one more layer of cake so everything balanced out but it was still delicious. I would definitely get that again. I also had the salted caramel cupcake and it was very good, the cake was nice and moist, the frosting was light and not to thick, the cupcake was good overall and it wasn't too sweet I was really surprised. I'm glad I was finally able to try this place and it was worth it, I wouldn't come here all the time while in Vegas one because of the line and two they are quite pricey. Expect to spend $50 if you get more than 3 or 4 items.
Solid cake. They have it all ready to go and it travels well. My family was not disappointed when I walked in with slices for them!

I've been to a few of Buddy's bakery locations across the country, EXCEPT for the original location (beside the point). I get a lobster tail every time. It's crispy and the filling is delicious. What I enjoy most about the lobster tail and some of his other baked goods, is that it isn't too sweet. All the aspects of the pastry are allowed to shine. There's really not much I can say here that will sway most people's opinion of this establishment and the chain of bakeries overall. I'm a fan of this location and I can really only recommend the Lobster tail and the Cannoli, because those are the only things I have tried.

Today's snack was on the Cake Boss, Buddy V ;) While the desserts my husband and I tried were all very delightful, I found that they were a bit too sweet. We had such a sugar rush after. All of the employees were very nice and helpful!

My wife and I have been watching the tv show featuring these products and finally went to the Venetian Hotel to try them. We bought two cannoli's that were soft and extremely tasteful. The cannoli cups were filled with cheesecake that was delicious and beyond all our expectations. Don't listen to the negative reviews on these delicious products.

Love the amazing and beautiful variety of treats at Carlo's Bakery. Most are almost too lovely to eat, but who can resist! The treats are amazing and very tasty, as well. Want to also mention the staff, all very friendly, fun and make the trip even more enjoyable! Going to Carlo's should be part of every Vegas vacation! Warning: It's delicious!

Carlo's Bakery From the Hoboken New Jersey original location to the Las Vegas Strip, good bake goods with their famous canoli. I would prefer and highly recommend the Lobster Tails bakes treats, order with Regular, Chocolate, Cookies and Cream filling which are nice and crispy outside and delicious creme filling. Souvenirs and many items to take back as treats for yourself or others

Got a few cupcakes, the rainbow cake was good. The line runs quick. Similar to In N Out there's a order person taking your order and while you wait you can see the workers making cakes and what not. Across the way there's a restaurant of the same, we didnt try the food there but it looked like a place to visit in the future.

Been to Carl's bakery in New Jersey grew up on Carl's bakery and now they're on Vegas in the strip I go there for my cannolis my chocolate cake and different pastries depending on what we need the perfect pick me up for breakfast as well as a snack and while you're on the strip amazing customer service
Great baked goods, but overpriced. Not the best pastries but it was a great experience.

I was so excited to try this place out. Big fan of Buddy V. I had the famous Cannoli. I also had the butter cream rainbow cake & the chocolate fudge cake. The rainbow cake was very pretty but dry. The chocolate cake was super tasty and rich.

Love the vending machine with a decent selection of cakes for almost $9 each slice. We chose the red velvet cake, came out cold and good flavor but the cake was on the slightly dry side is all but a huge slice was given.

There isn't super high reviews on this page about Carlos Bakery however I was very excited to try and I wasn't disappointed. We got cannoli cheesecake, 2 cannolis, and Red Velvet cake. The cannoli cheesecake was good, the cannolis were alright (probably wouldn't go for those again), however that red velvet cake was AMAZING! Both my husband and I loved it. I felt it was one of my favorite cakes I had ever gotten. It was out of this world amazing! The service was pretty quick and friendly! I'd go back to try some more cakes I think the cakes are the way to go here.

Every time I visited Las Vegas, the line for Carlos Bakery was always way too long, but in my most recent trip, I had a chance to finally try some desserts. Located in Venetian, the bakery itself is quite small. I ordered some sugar cookies, a slice of cake, and a cannoli set ($21). The cookies and cake was nothing special, but the cannolis were absolutely delicious! They recommended that I try the chocolate dipped cannoli, which just added more sweetness to my experience.

I was sad to see the poor reviews for Carlos bakery this is the one place I always make sure to stop at when I have a sweet tooth and am in Vegas. I always order the original cannolis. They are alittle pricey, but you are getting a quality dessert and are in Vegas so what is really cheap (nothing good). I have paid way more for bad cannolis then I have good ones and I have to say I absolutely love the cannolis here and always stop no matter how far away I am on the strip to Carlos. I have brought all of my friends here and I can't rave about this place enough. It is always busy and is such a cute place to stop and look at. The staff is friendly and helpful and even if you aren't a huge sweet person I think the cannoli is the right amount of sweet it's not too sweet and not not sweet enough.

Cannoli was very close to #caffepalermo NYC no Vegas Cigar. Final Grade : A. The best cannoli in a long time. Italy is my #1, Caffepalermo #2 and now #3 Carlo's Bakery. Congrats. If visiting Vegas and you love cannoli's like me, this is it.

The best milk chocolate covered strawberries I have ever eaten!! Chocolate was semi-sweet and creamy. Strawberries were extremely fresh and juicy. Couldn't have asked for anything better to end the night. Thank you Buddy!

This place can have quite a long line. But luckily I caught it at a great time. We went yesterday around 3p, the Thursday before Christmas. The line was short and things moved pretty fast. I picked up two treats for mom and me to share. One Chocolate Hazelnut Lobster Tail - the Pastry on the outside had quite a Crunch, but the inside was nice and soft thanks to the glorious Hazelnut Custard! It also had a thick drizzle of Nutella on top. I have to say I wish they hadn't automatically packaged it because the wrapping paper ended up getting more of that Nutella than my stomach did. Our second treat was unmarked, so I'm not sure of the name. It looked like a big, glossy, chocolate cookie. I'm pretty sure it was some kind of meringue because of the light, chewy texture and it's shiny exterior. It only had nuts inside and I have to say I would've preferred chocolate chips. But it was yummy! Next time I'd love to try a cannoli!

So I've always wanted to try his cakes since watching TLC. I also ordered a carrot cake and strawberry cheesecake. The line for the bakery wasn't that long but was a limit during Covid -19. I was in and out. They had all the options out in the case and once done ordering they went and prepped your order. It is definitely a must try. Cake was good and moist and not too sweet.

I used to watch Cake Boss pretty casually, so it was exiting to get to visit one of his locations. Inside the Venetian, you'll find Carlo's Bakery, and you'll know when you've found it because there will be a line out the door! But don't let that scare you - Although the line looked long, they get through everyone quickly and we probably didn't even wait more than 15 minutes. While you're in line, there's a huge window where you can watch the pastry chefs create desserts, it definitely helped kill the time! There are so many different options to choose from, and I just wanted something small so I tried one of the cannolis... It was fantastic! Also pretty huge for just one! The staff here are very friendly and efficient, too. Even though it might seem like a tourist trap, it's still a fun place to visit if you've watched the show.

Came here during the weekend and there was quite a few people in line. The line went fairly quick. I had high expectations for this placing watching the show. I was pleasantly surprised how delicious the cakes were. I was expecting it to be overly sweet but it was just right. I tried the canolis but it wasn't my cup of tea.

What could be better than scrumptious pastries inspired by Buddy?!? Not much that I can think of. Carlo's has all the amazing treats featured on his show and they all taste incredible. The bakery is small and a shell of his real bakery in Jersey, but it gets the point across. Every time I go I am greeted immediately by a friendly bakery employee and order whatever I want from the case. They are very knowledgeable and helpful in assisting you with your sugar cravings. It is definitely expensive, but it's expected. Once you order you pay and wait for them to beautifully package it all up. You can get anything from cakes and cookies to lobster tails and cannolis and if you want a souvenir to last you can even buy memorabilia. I haven't had anything that I didn't enjoy, though my favorites are the butter cookies, linzer cookies, pecan shortbread covered in chocolate, and the almond coconut cookies with chocolate on top. Do yourself a favor, go to Carlo's and indulge in some sweat treats...you're in Vegas after all!!!
Got the 5 pack of cannolis. And man can I say they were sweet. Definitely could only eat one. But they were delicious. Fast service and decently priced.

If you're like me and can't easily get to Hoboken, New Jersey for Buddy's original bakery, at the very least you must try his location in Las Vegas! You feel like a kid in a candy shop. Displays filled with all the sweet cakes, rolls & cookies you can imagine. Get at least 5 lobster tails because you're going to want at least 2 for now, 2 for later and 1 to share (if you're into that, otherwise it's all you)! There's no actual lobster in this pastry, the name comes from the lobster-tail shape. Paper-thin layers of dough with a satisfying crunch filled with gobs of sweet cream, topped with chocolatey hazelnut drizzle. Enjoy!

Every time I come to Vegas I always stop by Carlo's Bakery I love their brownies. I stopped in around Christmas time and unfortunately I didn't see any brownies in the case. When it was my turn to order I asked about them. The lady said they didn't have any, but then a baker showed up with some goodies to put in the case and overheard us. She said they had some in the back that just needed to be frosted and offered to frost them if I was willing to wait She literally made my day I love those things. I also tried this time one of their lobster tails and it was great - my husband even liked that and he is not a fan of sweets.

Upon arrival you can see into the bake shop from a window. It's pretty awesome when a bakery lets you view what goes down! We didn't want to order a whole lot because we were just about to get lunch. We got a chocolate dipped strawberry(so juicy and the chocolate didn't crumble!) and a fondant sugar cookie(perfect amount of fondant) next time I'm going to get a lobster tail for sure! Pros: -lots of variety of cookies, lobster tails, donuts, pastries -Taste was on point -Easy to get in and out -You can watch the bakers -Cakes are on display Cons: -The people working there seemed confused, we stood there waiting for a few minutes before someone finally asked to help us -People seemed to not understand where the line formed. We kept getting cut off and crowded

Selection is super limited to a handful of items, but do yourself a favor a grab a million of the lobster tails yummy goodness--HELLO!!! The whole time I'm eating those darn little things I kept saying, "this is interesting," which is a compliment to the baker! I love creamy desserts--add whipped cream, French cream, mascarpone and I instantly fall in love but man, these little lobster tails had me crunching away! Is it a philo dough over a croissant??? You bite into these little heavenly jewels, and you get this flaky crunch, then soft crescent, then light French cream. I mean who knew something so simple could just make you want to dance a happy dance???? if y'all know me, you know I can't order one thing in a bakery, so we added cheesecake, every flavor lobster tail, and a strawberry shortcake slice. Cheesecake was super awesome amazing. I don't like cheesecake ordinarily, but they were so pretty and petit, I had to try!!! It's a bold bakery that offers mini cheesecakes with no crust and a simple strawberry on top--hot damn it was good!!! Although I enjoyed the strawberry shortcake--I prefer a chiffon cake (from Candlelight Bakery) over a sponge. The lightness of the cream and tartness of fresh strawberries just always seem to go better with the airiness of a chiffon...all in all, the star of this visit were the lobster tails!! going back today before we leave Vegas to grab a box!!!

I'm a huge fan of the Cake Boss and when I found out I could visit his bakery while in Vegas, I knew I needed to! The location is inside the grand canal shoppes inside the Venetian. There are plenty of signs to help direct you. When I arrived, there wasn't a line and I was able to put in my order right away. I ordered an Oreo lobster tail, a fondant cookie and a chocolate cannoli. The girl took my order and then asked me to wait for a bit while they packaged it. My name was called, I paid and I was on my way. Super quick service! Let me tell you...the lobster tail was delicious! The pastry was crunchy, flaky and the filling was so creamy, light and fluffy! It was pure perfection. And the cannoli was the best I've had. The filling was so tasty and paired well with the cannoli shell. The ricotta filling had just the right flavor of cinnamon and a few chocolate chips inside was just right. I have no way to describe them other than by saying they were decedent. I think that's it. Even the cookie was soft, flaky and the fondant was smooth as silk. Wowza! I'm so glad I was able to visit and try a few sweet treats.
Cannoli was average. Not what we are used to from Arthur Avenue in The Bronx. However the sfogliatella pastry was absolutely perfect. Staff was very nice and helpful!
We went with the chocolate cake from the machine at Rio, and it was pretty darned good! Large piece, plenty to share! Give it a try.

This review is based on presentation only as we didn't buy here today. This is The Valastro's bakery in the Venetian Palazzo - across the hall from their Buddy V's restaurant. This is a cute bakery split into 2 sections. One for preparation and one for baked goods sales. We passed on buying as we planned to eat dinner Buddy V's later and order dessert there (which we did and OMG - the Italian Birthday Cake!). This all said, if your looking for a sweet baked item, try this place.

very expensive. i got like 4 things it was $30. wtf. and they want a tip. everything looks and tastes soo yummy. i got a cannoli, lobster claw, cannoli cheesecake, rainbow cookie. i wish the hotels would have actual mini fridges we could use to buy items. these celebrity restaurants are all the rage everywhere in vegas

I've been to this bakery a couple of times. The location is what keeps me from frequenting it more; it's not convenient for me. The selection is great. Everything we've ever tried was very very good. The prices are okay. I really enjoy viewing the small kitchen area when someone is in there preparing desserts. There is typically a line and luckily the few times we've been there it wasn't too much of a wait. Staff have been friendly and efficient. The canollis were completely filled; no hidden gap in the middle! Not too rich so it was easy to eat a whole one and not share; mine! I've tried the famous 'lobster tail' which was good. Overall, the store decor and goods are above par, but the location means I rarely get here.
For those who ever watched Cake Boss on TLC or other channels but never made it up to Hoboken NJ to try it out. This place is great. Same great treats with a little Vegas price.

I ordered several baked goodies from the famous Carlos Bakery through Goldbelly. My initial experience was Carlos Bakery Las Vegas and it was everything my carb loving heart desired. The Frozen Goldbelly rainbow cake, lobster tails and cannolis were all delivered in pristine condition. After careful following of instructions- the cake was as expected- soft, sweet and perfect. I have ordered both the individual slices and the whole cake- both are absolutely worth it. The Cannolis as well were magical. I don't know what they're doing to these but they are amazing. Crispy and creamy all at the same time. I ate several and still wanted more. Now the Lobster tail I would recommend having at the bakery. They are an experience and need to be eaten fresh. They were much smaller and not the foodgasmic experience I had at the bakery in Vegas. Overall, it is a lot of hype and depending on what you like and what is fresh (bakery vs Goldbelly) it can be said there is something carbtastic for everyone.

The prices were quite steep for this kind of place. We got: cherry cheesecake, strawberry cheesecake, lobster tail, chocolate moose and some sort of strawberry eclair. The cherry was good minus we had a pit in one of the cherries... everything was pretty good but we must be super spoiled with Oakmont Bakery in Pittsburgh, PA because nothing compares to it. Still, all in all, a good bakery but definitely not our favorite!
Great stuff coming from someone who prefers savory to sweet...I have stopped here on all 3 times I have been here and I will stop here next time again.
We got the dulce de leche lobster tail. It did not disappoint. Tons of filling and great flavor. We tried a chocolate dipped cannoli which added a new dimension to the cannoli experience.

I could embarrass myself silly in this place. Yeah I'm a fan of bakeries and patisseries. I'm a home baker and love all things chocolate (dark is the best...milk chocolate doesn't count. Boring.) and any dessert that has cream cheese as an ingredient. My friend and I picked three items to share and they were amazing. No complaints. None. The lobster tail was my favorite. I thought it would be the chocolate mousse filled cake or the cannoli. Nope, nothing could hold a candle to that lobster tail.

WOOOOOOOOW! Is all I can say after having the Hazelnut cream puff. I thought I would never say this, but forget the cannoli and go straight for the cream puffs (hazelnut to be precise!) I died and went to heaven when I entered Carlo's Bakery at the Venetian. I was a fan of Cake Boss on tv, so visiting here during my trip to Vegas was a MUST! It's REALLY hard to find once you're inside the Venetian. I had to ask ten people. It's literally right next to the walgreens, so if there is an entrance near there or through Walgreens, take that route! Don't be like me and run around the Venetian like a chicken with its head cut off! One thing that I am sad about, they forgot to put the red tote bag I purchased in my order! I only realized after I got home... oh well!
This was an amazing experience. All the deserts we tried were delicious. We had the lobster classic, chocolate cake, vanilla cupcake and strawberry cheesecake. It's a must visit.

I have been the Vegas many times and every time we went by Carlos Bakery there was a huge line and even though I love sweets I couldn't stomach the line. Since we are staying at the Venetian it is now just a 5 minute walk away. This is a Thursday night and the wait was 10 minutes. We tried a little of everything and it was all very yummy. They have a lobster claw which is a cream filled pastry and it was great. I also tried the chocolate filled cream puff, the cannoli and two different cupcakes. Everything was fresh and delicious. They wrap everything up for you in a nice box with a gift-like presentation, very classy. The price point is such that everyone can afford to try "something" as most of the items are in the $3 to $5 each and I paid $11.00 for a chili dog earlier so in comparison this place is a deal. I still have 3 more days here in and I am certain I will be stopping by again to try some other delightful goodness. Update. I'm back several months later and this place is still rocking the sweets!! Make sure to add this to your list of must do's in Vegas! Enjoy!
2nd time ordering the cannoli's, their delicious and great priced! Make sure to sign up for their rewards, you'll receive free items when accumulating points. Plus they offer military discount!

I always come here when I'm at The Venetian Hotel. The last time I came here was on a Sunday, 03/20/22 before 9pm and there was only one guest ahead of me. The cannolis is a must, not too sweet, crunchy and my go to. We got the cheesecake which was a good size portion and tasted good as well. If you like cake, try the confetti cake and red velvet cake, they are delish.

I am a huge fan of cooking and baking shows and loved watching Cake Boss so when I saw there was a Carlos Bakery here, I knew I had to stop in. After reading he reviews on here, I wasn't so sure it would be worth the stop or the money but I'm glad I came anyways. The bakery is actually a lot smaller than I thought it would be. There was also a long line but it moved fairly quickly. I ordered all 4 lobster tail flavors because that seemed to be very popular amongst the yelp reviews. Of course I got the cannolis, one regular and one chocolate dipped. And one slice of red velvet because that's my favorite flavor. Total was about $45. The staff were all nice and helpful. I had a piece of each cannoli and I don't have much to compare it to so I thought it was really good. I prefer the original over the chocolate dipped one. The lobster tails were good. I wasn't expecting such a crunchy exterior but it definitely added texture to the soft cream inside. The red velvet was great. The cake was moist and the frosting had a nice flavor and consistency. I thought it would be overly sweet but it was very balanced. If I lived in the area, I wouldn't go here often to be honest. But it is definitely worth a stop if you're visiting!

I've always been a fan of Cake Boss and Buddy's family. I've been to the original bakery in Jersey and I've actually met most of his family, including him. I have to say I am really impressed with the selection at this bakery in the Venetian! I loved my lobster tail, especially how crunchy and creamy it was. I got a cookies and cream cupcake which I liked as well. I would definitely recommend going, especially since they have a very small line compared to their bakery in Jersey.

wow the food is so amazing here. I know this won't see the business owners eyes but the cannoli's are awesome. I wanted to get a box of 5 and instead I got three because I could not mix and match so that was a few dollars they didn't make and I wonder how many times that happens a day. Everything was yummy especially the lemon custard lobster tail. It was awesome to see my childhood tv show come to life.

Love this place! My mom and I go every time we are in Vegas! Usually not long of a wait and the pastries are always up to par! I recommend the Rasberry linger cookie and the lobster tail, some of the best pastries I have ever had!

The rainbow cake is THE BEST item to get! Followed by the cookies and cream lobster tail! I've been here several times and have always had great customer service. Sometimes there can be a line up but they tend to move fast. I Always stop by here when I'm visiting Las Vegas.

I've been here twice now; once last year and I ordered a few cannolis which were to DIE for, and I also got their rainbow cake with vanilla icing in single slices. I enjoyed it so much that I thought that I'd get one of the already made cakes they have ready for purchase for my mother in law's birthday. The cake was just 'ok' this last time (in January '21) it wasn't as moist as I remembered.. but I'm sure that could be due to it being one of the ready made cakes.. I'm not 100% sure. All in all, I still quite enjoy this place and their many desserts. OH!! they also have yummy iced coffee.

My first time coming here and I was super excited to try some sweets. The line was super long but that wasn't a surprise. Went by super fast. The customer service was great. There cakes were good very moist nothing I thought really special didn't really like the red velvet idk just to much cream cheese for me. The sprinkle cake was good as well. The cakes didn't really give me like a wow omg yes they are so bomb worth a try. Oh yes and the prices are unbelievable. Very affordable!!!

We picked up some desserts after early dinner. They have a lot of different ones to choose from, but my kid wanted a rainbow cake which could be seen everywhere in Vegas (they sold it on a machine at the pizza cake as well), I just went for their class lobster tail. I love my lobster tail; it's so crispy and not overly sweet. Desserts are not too cheap, for 2 items, I spent 15 dollars here, but hey you are in Vegas!

The Lobster tail and strawberry shortcake...omg my mouth is watering just thinking about these.... ahhhhhhh. My cousin Keane, his wife Adriana, my bf Javan and I decided to go to Carlos' Bakery the night before we had to leave Vegas. We decided the go 1 hour before they were closing and upon arriving there wasn't too long of a line and plenty of desserts and sweets to choose from. Adriana strongly recommended the lobster tail to me and when I saw the strawberry shortcake it was too hard to pass up. I also purchased one of their cannolis to see what it was about. Ordering and paying was quick and easy. The staff was very nice and helpful too. I barely watched Cake Boss when it was on TV but I was definitely hyped for this spot and the hype is real! If you're going to visit, get the lobster tail for sure. The crunchiness of the shell and buttercream together are a match made in heaven! The strawberry shortcake wasn't too sweet and just the right size to eat. The cannolis was soft the day after I bought it but still good. If you're at the Venetian, stop by and grab a lobster tail. You won't be disappointed!

Have been to New York several times but never been able to come here because it's been busy and always out of the way. We got the lobster tail and the confetti cake. The lobster tail is amazing, and it is a must if you ever come here. It is so crunchy, and not burnt, and the cream filling is not too sweet at all, it's the perfect amount of sweet and whipped-ness (not a word, I know!). The way the lobster tail crumbles when you bite into it with the perfect amount of crisp is genius! The confetti cake on the other hand was way too sweet. I did not like it one single bit. I which they're able to use the same custard / cream filling in the lobster tail as the icing for the cake. That would be incredible. I truly found the cake way too dense and way too sweet. Two pairings that make it overwhelming. Overall: 10 out of 10 would recommend the lobster tail, 5/10 would recommend the cake, and 7/10 would recommend coming here. It is quite over priced

My gf is a huge fan of Buddy so of course we had to check out the bakery! Stopped by the bakery for dessert after getting lunch at his restaurant. Overall satisfied and impressed with the quality of his desserts. We got the cannolis and one of the lobster pastry things. Not sure what they're called but it was heaven!! Loved everything about it. The filling is delicious and never had anything like it. Highly recommend Carlos bakery. Service was great as well. I was really hoping they'd have some desserts from his new show "bake you rich". Hopefully it's in the works.

Friends, food, fun that's all a girl ever needs sometimes. That and several CANNOLI. Always wanted to come here because of the whole Cake Boss series. The icing on top were the cannolis! Friends and I were here at around 815 pm on Martin Luther King Jr day. There was a short line of about 5 people in front of us. It was my first time but I had my heart and tummy set, then someone mentioned the lobster tails! The place is pretty small, there's no place to eat and sit, but there's a nice shelf for you to quickly set your box of goodies down and stuff your face or mix your coffee, whatever floats your boat. There's a viewing window of the bakery but I really wasn't paying attention. There was a staff of two serving everyone and the bakery cold cases were fully stocked. Everything looked amazing. I stuck with my gut and got four cannolis- 2 chocolate dipped and 2 original, and an original lobster tail. Polite and quick with service, I would've stayed to ask questions but the line behind me was 10 deep. Got home and scarfed a cannoli down before bed, then ate my awesome lobster tail for breakfast with coffee the next day. I gotta say I will probably be back for more!

My mother is a HUGE fan of Cake Boss and Next Great Baker, so I was insanely excited when my brother and I told her about the Vegas trip, and that we were going to take her to Carlo's. She was sooooo excited, and told everyone that she was going to Carlo's when she talked about Vegas. I'm sure her excitement probably got some people watching the show, at the very least, because she told that many people. Lol. My mother wanted a cannoli. This was her big thing. My brother got her one on her birthday, and she hated it. Lol. So she was a little hesitant to try it here, thinking it would be the same. This one was perfect. It was crispy, and sweet. My mom loved it. I'm so glad we convinced her to try it. We also had a lobster tail. I don't remember what kind it was, but there was a couple choices. It was my least favorite thing we tried. The outside was weirdly crispy, like I was chewing it forever. I ended up picking out the filling and just eating that. The selection in the bakery seemed a little weak, like they were out of a lot of things and the shelves were a bit empty. That was the one thing I noticed. Other than that, what we did have, I thoroughly enjoyed. That was my one big complaint, I suppose, if I could pick anything apart. The staff was amazing. That definitely stood out to me. We had a kid, I don't know his name, helping us. Even though the descriptions were listed on each thing in the display case, my mother conveniently missed that and started asking about different things and what was in them. This kid was more than patient. and didn't just say read the sign. Although, I'm sure he was thinking it. Lol. He was more than happy to discuss it with my mother and answered all of her questions thoroughly and with a smile. He gave us plates and a knife since we were sharing everything. He really went out of his way to make sure we had everything we needed and it was a great experience. Would I return? Absolutely. I wish there was a Carlo's bakery closer to me than Las Vegas. But then I would be even fatter than I am now. Lol. But the experience was wonderful. It was so amazing to be able to take my mother here and try all of the things she has seen on TV from the show. Definitely worth a trip. Review 81 of 2017.

My friend and I stumbled on this place as we were exploring the hotels. I love the show and have always wanted to get my hands on their goods! There was a line, it was around 10am on a Sunday. We didnt mind waiting as we just needed to satisfy our sweet tooth. While waiting in line you can watch the bakers making baking the delightful treats! As we got closer my eyes kept getting bigger and bigger. If their items were calorie free I would have ate more! Since we had already had breakfast I just got a canolli but decided to wait to eat it. After about and hour we sat down and enjoyed our treats. Everything tasted really good! I know for sure I will try their other items. Recommend if you get a chance to visit the Venetian hotel. I am not sure if it gets busier during the evening but the morning seemed to not be too bad. Note: I did not find their prices to be pricey as some reviews mentioned. Items made from scratch come at a cost, and you can taste the quality. It's a treat not a daily occurrence. Eat up and enjoy!

We showed up without a reservation and we were seated right away. Josie, our waitress was not only extremely pleasant but incredibly quick and proficient and explaining the menu, taking our order and making sure that we received exactly what we expected. A great evening and we will for sure be back. We simply can't say enough about Josie and her upbeat personality and friendly reception during our stay.
These cannolis are a must get when you are by Carlo's Bakery. The taste is like no other cannoli out there. Really cool place!

My mother and I went in to get a wedding cake ordered for my wedding for the 4th of July weekend and Shenel was amazing. I had been nervous about this process and Shenel, the pastry chef, made this experience so great and easy. I was pleasantly surprised how smooth the process went. Shenel put me at ease stating she would actually be the one who will make my cake. I could not be more grateful for her help and cannot wait to see how everything turns out. THANK YOU SO MUCH SHENEL!! -Sonny

Always wanted to try this place but the lines were always so long. We lucked out on this day as there wasn't a line so we walked in and ordered the 4 pc cake deal for 26 bucks We got a red velvet, a chocolate, a confetti birthday, and a rainbow cake with strawberry frosting. Cakes were good, I think the chocolate was made on site, the rest were in a sealed container so north sure They were all yummy

Regretfully I was tooo full from BuddyVs restaurant and had a dessert to actually order a cake but I have to say that I admire the energy and whimsy that surrounds this bakery. People seem to flock to these colorful and enticing cakes and sweets. Probably the most iconic is the rainbow layer cake. I also realized that that are numerous Carlos Bakery vending machines with slices of cake scattered around the strip like in Paris. I look forward to trying a slice one of these days and then I will update the review with the verdict but since I tried the birthday cake at BuddyVs I am confident the cakes will be rich and delicious.
This is a must try! Don't pass on the legendary Buddy's pastries. if you've never been, try the cannolis!
Carlo's Bakery made my wedding cake and all the pastries for our wedding! The cake was unbelievably delicious and absolutely more beautiful than I ever expected! Everyone raved about the pastries.

Lobster tail is as good as I remember. The pastry is crispy with lightly dusted powdered sugar and the cream is smooth and not too sweet. The rest of the pastries look okay. I come here mainly for the lobster tail. Before COVID the line usually wrapped around the corner but it is quick today.
This is by far my favorite place in Las Vegas!!! Ya wish they had one closer to Texas so I could come more often. Highly recommend if you want something sweet and at a good price!
Excellent cake and cookie, I can taste the quality ingredients used to make the baked items. I did find it a bit pricey. Worth check out thought. Four thumbs up

Was a bit skeptical after reading the bad reviews but I went anyway because I love the show.. to my surprise it was actually pretty good! Ordered the lobster tail and the cannoli . Ordered regular flavors because I figured those would be best. The lobster tail was flakey and the cream inside was really good and sweet! Tasted like some type of cream cheese! Very unique; haven't tasted anything like it before. The cannoli was really good too. I do have another fav cannoli shop in West Hollywood so I was pretty sure that buddy's cannolis would taste bad based on the reviews but it was actually really delicious! It has its own taste to it and it wasn't too sweet or too plain! I enjoyed it. Huge fan of the show!!! Been waiting nearly 10 years to try Carlos bakery and I finally did! Although I'm upset that I haven't tried to actual jersey location but I guess this will have to do for now! Will try other items next time!! Location is a little difficult to find. Obviously in the Venetian hotel but the Venetian is completely complicated. Prices were kinda high but it's Carlos so ya knowwww
First Cannoli experience and it was incredible! I had the tradition and chocolate. Neither was too sweet which I liked. I'll definitely be back to try everything else!
Really pricey but the chocolate chip cookies are worth their weight in gold. They are now serving cake slices as well and I think it's a great way to sample their cakes before fully committing.
Bakery is good, always busy. The cake is moist and very tasty. I've bought the cookies,cake and cannolis ,and I'll I can say is I want more!! So much to choose from!! Need to get back there
Had the cannoli, lobster claw and strawberry rainbow cake. All were delicious. Service was pretty fast and place was great. Thanks!
The staff was extremely helpful and accommodating. Cake is out of this world ! Had the chocolate fudge and a sprinkle cupcake. Both were A+

Carlo's is right across the hallway from Buddy V's restaurant inside Venetian's Grand Canal Shoppes and it's so worth the long walk to get there. I tried the pecan chocolate chip cookie which has 2 kinds of chocolate and the cookies and cream cupcake. Both were super sweet and amazing! Prices are normal for a casino, so there was nothing to complain about.
The cake was killer and we loved celebrating my birthday with Alice's if the sweet delicious rainbow cake!

I have been a huge fan for many many years. I have always wanted to go to this bakery. So when I saw Vegas had a bakery I HAD to go. This place is mega clean and the staff are very friendly. All of their treats looked amazing! Wish I could have bought more while there but we were headed to the airport right after. It was very good. All that I imagined that it would be! I would love to go here again soon! So happy I go the opportunity to come and try treats for myself.

Staff was nice when I was there! It just kinda hard to find the location! I recommend the original cannoli, lobster tail and red velvet cake. The original Cannoli taste so much better in my opinion rather than the chocolate dipped one, cause the choco one for me was way too sweet for my liking. The lobster tails is my favorite but sometimes when you keep in the fridge too long of course the pastry kinda dry and so hard to bite. My suggestion is eat it right away for lobster tail since if you keep it too long it was way too hard to eat the pasty. The one that way over price is the cheesecake. The cheese cake is okay not that good and it almost $11 for small tiny cheesecake... yeah it's on the pricier side for all pasties and cakes.

My husband surprised me with a red velvet cake from Carlo's Bakery in Vegas. I was not only blown away with his (my husband's) overall presentation but the cake itself was perfect. Moist, thick, not too sweet and perfect cake to icing ratio. Thank you for helping make my day special.

I got there at 10:30pm on a Saturday and everything was well stocked. Except, they didn't have any crumb cakes. I ended up getting several cannolis, a red velvet cupcake, and original lobster tails. They also had samples of their red velvet cake available which was delicious. We brought the desserts back to our hotel room and enjoyed them right away. I was looking forward to tasting the lobster tails. I'm a big fan of the show and I've been wanting to try these for quite some time. Maybe it was because of the build up but I wasn't impressed with the texture or flavor of the shell. It tasted like it was stale and too crunchy. The cream was a little on the runny side but it had good flavor. Perhaps the texture of the shell would be different if it were fresh? I don't know. The cannoli.
