I'm not even a fan of cannoli but this, this was really really good. The cream was the perfect consistency and sweetness. The shell was crunchy and slightly flaky. Yum. Get it. You won't be disappointed. I bought enough stuff to get Carlo's Bakery swag (glass cup). If I were to return, I'd order a crumb cake in advance to try it out. Hopefully I won't be disappointed.

We had to go her for our pasties of course, being a fan of Cake Boss and all. Well needless to say they do a wonderful job!!! We went 3 out of 4 days of being in Vegas, yummy all the way!! They do it right savory and sweet, we got a spinach feta croissant type pastry, caramel lobster tail, and chocolate croissant. Everything was so delicious and very memorable to say the least. The staff extremely knowledgeable and kind!! We will be back when we go back to Vegas!!

Every time I'm in Vegas, i need to get their lobster tails. I failed in love with them in NY and since then, whenever I'm in a city that has Carlos bakery, I can't resist to get one, or two or maybe more... These are the best I ever had, the shell is very crunchy and not sweet at all, so it goes very well with the pastry filling that is light and delicious. I'm not a fan of theirs cannolis and other items. For me it's just the lobster tail. It's a bomb.

The couple of experiences I've had here have all been positive. The lines are long of course but what do you expect? They're highly sought after. (The line is formed against the side and there's windows so you can see inside the bakery which is pretty cool while waiting). It's also alllll the way towards the end of the strip so it can be a walk if you stayed in the middle. If you really want to give the place a taste than the wait shouldn't be a problem considering everyone else is there trying to do the same, it's just about being courteous. Anywho I LOVED everything I tried so far (I will be back ahah) but my favorite treat are the cannolis omg they are so great, good crunch, yummy filling and I love the little chocolate chips and chocolate dip on my ends. Buddy was there on one of the days I went and I felt the passion in his work and I'm not just being a fan he's a hard worker, you can sense integrity.

Great selection and service. Order taker told me that the cannoli is the most popular item so that is what I ordered. It was awesome. Cream cheese was filled with chocolate chips. Baked items are also made in house.

Got here right before they opened on a Friday morning! As soon as they opened I was greeted with a smile & Welcome to Carlos Bakery! I called before I arrived to Las Vegas and already received good customer service and had all my questions answered about the cake options & prices. I bought a beautiful white cake with fresh strawberries for my daughters 21st Birthday! It was delicious, moist and the strawberries were sweet! We all loved it!

Grew up watching cake boss and have been a big fan of buddy. For the birthday cake and it was pretty good. For some reason I expected a lot more given the hype this business has. It was still very good but maybe I just got the cake on the wrong day. Hope to return soon and have a better experience

8/16/21 Another late review Always pass by but never had the opportunity to give it a chance and Finally we did! Love the easy set up, you order first on the bakery counter and then when they have your order ready they call you by name and you pay. Wait is not long at all, may seem long by the many people that go there but just wait, it goes by quickly. We got a box of cannolis that come with lobster tails and woww they are so worth the price!!! Cannolis are not too sweet they are just right on the sweetness. Definitely want to come back and try a slice of cake.

Good tasting desserts. The red velvet cake is perfect, great flavor with cream cheese frosting that is not over powering. I also purchased a cannoli, which was delicious. Chocolate chips were in the cream which was an added surprise. The prices are rather high but you are paying for the name. I would hands down purchase from this location again. They were quick and spot on with the way they were running the bakery.
This cake was delicious! I was nervous it was going to be a little too sweet but it was the perfect balance. The cake was very moist and the frosting was delicious.
The shop exceeded my expectations! I dealt with Lisa from beginning to end and was not disappointed. You guys should definitely consider this spot for your sweet tooth!

Although quite pricey, the cannoli sampler was awesome! It reminded me of this little hole in the wall spot back in Boston that locals kept to themselves about to avoid the touristy hype. The cookie I got was kind of dry and crumbly - I prefer the soft and chewy cookies. Would go back just for the cannolis.
Awesome service. They were able to make a last minute surprise birthday cake and on time.

We got the 5 pack of cannoli and 4 pack of lobster tails variety pack each. It was very delicious. The price was a little steep we paid 47.00 for both. I can say i ate at carlo's bakery and had the cannoli for 47 dollars. No line we were in and out very quickly. I enjoyed the experience can i find cheaper cannoli somewhere else? Maybe. Will it be as good as carlo's . But for my first Cannoli at least i have a good starting point for what i know is a good cannoli.

This place is right on! It's tiny but the line moves fast. There was some confusion with my order. When the bill rang up to $40+, I was shocked but then they realized that they charged me for a whole cake rather than just 2 pieces. Then they had to open up the tied box to place the 2 pieces inside. Just as I was leaving they were going to give me my 2 lobster tails that were already in my bag. The lobster tail was so crispy and the cream inside was so smooth and tasty. The box of goodies flew home to Hawaii (stopped by TSA and the box had to be wiped for drugs or bomb residue) but luckily it didn't get confiscated and we got to get it home to be given as a gift to the caregiver of my 4 legged baby to thank her for her love and care while we were away.
A go-to location every trip to Vegas. Enjoy the lobster claws!

When I found out there was a Carlo's Bakery in Vegas, boy was excited. I've haven't had the time to check out the one in LA, so when I found out there was one in Vegas I had to make a stop. I think the reviews are a little bit lower than they should be. Sure people expectations our high and so are the prices here. This place similar to Milk Bar in the Cosmopolitan is one of the most expensive places to pay for dessert. I only tried to item a chocolate Cannoli & hazelnut lobster claw. Just for those two things it was like 12 bucks, we could have really spent even more money, but I just wanted a taste. Originally I was going to go with the Oreo Lobster claw, but one of the employees said the hazel nut ones one of the best flavors. The lobster claw is like a croissant, but it is a little harder, the hazel nut cream was delicious. I thought my wife's cannoli was alright. I would come back though I feel like there could be more choices in unique baked goods.
Due to Covid, they only allow a certain amount of people to come in, but they seem to be handling it well.

Chocolate cannoli to die for and actually not to sweet. My baby sis loves her rainbow cake slice and the lobster tails original and hazelnut ammmaZING! It was my dream to go to Carlo's bakery and get one of each and I did and those were by far my favorite but everything was delicious. My dad loved the hazelnut cookies and lemon ones too. My best friend said her fave was the double chocolate chip cookie and carrot cake. I will definitely be making this my go to stop before we leave.

Got SUPER lucky & came on a day where there were only 2 people ahead of me in line! Anywho, the bakery is adorable! Located in the Venetian, it took forever to find (we parked @ self- park & walked through the shops by the Canal). But the trek to find it took us through areas we would have never seen otherwise! But it was so cute! There's big windows to watch cakes being decorated (but no one was in there while we were there)... Can definitely understand why people get aggro over the wait- it's pretty small & people tend to be indecisive and ask TONS of questions... When it was finally our turn at the cashier we ordered 2 chocolate covered cannolis, 4 Rainbow/Venetian/7 Layer Cookies, & an original Lobster Tail. The grand total camr out to just under $35??!!! I don't go to bakeries often, but I've never spent that much on 5 single baked goods & 4 Cookies?! But I will say this- they were REALLY, really good!!! The Cannolis here HUGE & generously filled. The shells were thicker than I'm used to, but they held up very well on our car ride home! The cookies were just like I remembered them... I used to get them from a little Italian bakery in my neighborhood growing up & rarely find them anymore- these were delicious! But the Lobster Tail- that was AMAZING & worth the $5.50!!! I was told the cream has bourbon in it but didn't think I would taste it, but it was definitely in there! It secretly made my husband and I happy that we didn't have to share it with the kiddos (LOL)!!! Definitely worth stopping by once if you're a fan of the show or looking for some Italian baked treats. I probably won't ever come back again but I'm glad I tried it once!

I wanted to pick up a cake for a special occasion and when I saw the picture of the rainbow cake I knew it was the one. I ordered the cake to be picked up the next day. When I arrived- at 11:30 on a Sunday morning there was no line at all and my cake was ready. They had placed it in the box and then wrapped the box in plastic which helped keep it fresh. The cake was EXACTLY as pictured. It was absolutely beautiful and tasted just as good. I loved all of the layers. If I lived closer I would order more often.

All of their assorted goods looked very delicious and so creative! I marveled and drooled over their individual pastries and beautiful cupcakes! I highly recommend the lobster tail. It wasn't on display when I was in line, and had to order it. You bite into a very flaky and crispy outer coating to get an explosion of mildly sweet cream all in your mouth! Yes, it was quite a beautiful moment. The cannoli looked really tasty.. but I thought it was way too sweet for my liking. Overall, I think it was worth the wait though, it took about 30 minutes but there's just so many things you can choose from to try!

Like most television promoted bakery's (or restaurants), it is expensive. Would prefer to be able to sit down to eat our baked goods but they do not offer that here. It's pick up and to-go only. Otherwise, all else is worthy and reasonable to give it a try. We'd recommend the cannolis and cookies (peanut butter and M&M's).

Pretty much what we expected to be. But the desserts were amazing we got so many I don't even remember all of them. You must try a chocolate covered strawberry and a mini cheesecake. They are definitely what it's all cracked up to be.

After 20 minutes of searching in the giant maze of a shopping mall I finally found Carlo's and I was so excited. Everything looked delicious. My son got their cookie and I got the traditional lobster tail with a latte to wash it down. So good! The staff is awesome!

Ate my cheesecake too quickly to even take a picture. We were warmly greeted by the guy taking our order. He suggested he white chocolate mouse and dark chocolate moose. We ended up with the chocolate covered cheesecake. We ordered with him then went to go pay. Once ready, they call your name. The cheesecake was $12 but was AMAZING! So moist and delicious. Service was great and quick. Can't wait to try other cakes from Carlo's bakery

Whatever you do, make sure to swing by for dessert and take it to a bench and watch the gondolas pass by in the Venetian. We took our friends there and had the famous rainbow cake or what the kids nicknamed "unicorn" cake- delicious! Definitely share it with someone! We had the cupcakes a little too dense for my liking. Got some chocolate covered strawberries too. Carlos is a great place to take the kids and have them watch the cake bakers decorate in front of them. And the choices of desserts- so many to chose from! Eat it all and then walk it off in the Venetians and Palazzo shops. Just don't try on jeans after!

If you're a fan of Cake Boss, you know the name. If you're not a fan of Cake Boss, come anyways. The lines are long, but move pretty quickly. Our cupcake, cookies, and brownie were all excellent. The cookie was good, but I was in love with the brownie in particular. It tasted like a small piece of dense chocolate cake with a lovely rich icing. Definitely a great option for your sweet tooth. Take it to go, though. There's really not many places near the bakery to stop and eat at.

Cupcakes were TERRIBLE dry like the mixture never had any wet ingredients:( I would never purchase again! However, the Cannolis are to die for....DELICIOUS especially the the lobster cannoli w/hazelnut cream and the cheesecake was good too but the cannolis was everything
Cannoli!!! Omg these were so good. We also got chocolate dipped strawberries which were food as well.

An East Coast bakery out West? Sure, why not! I'm not going to complain when their offerings are delicious and decadent. They had something for everyone of us: chocolate dipped strawberry, cannoli, and a pecan sugar cookie wedge/square. Their signature pignoli cookies were delicious as well. Service was helpful, fast, and very friendly. Nice to have you here Buddy V!

As others have mentioned the wait in line is painfully long. That being said they are working as quickly as they possibly can to get you through the line in an efficient manner. As you can see in my photos we bought a lot of different things so we could try it all. Everything was delicious and I even have a coffee mug now as a souvenir from our visit. It is pricey so be prepared.

Some background info for everyone that doesn't understand the hype and are giving poor review solely on the length of the line. Carlo's Bakery as well as Buddy V's directly across from it are famous restaurants/bakers due to the owner Chef Buddy Valastro star of Cake Boss on food network. Unless you're planning on being there at the butt crack of dawn when the open, plan on waiting in a line. Just like everything else that's famous, there is always a line, hence the famous part. In the end I still thought the pastries were amazing! After ordering about $60 worth of desserts I could not have been happier. The filling in the lobster tail was something of another world, in reality the flaky exterior is just a cup to hold all the cream. You're actually suppose to stick a straw in it and suck out all the filling. I was truly impressed by everything they had to offer. If you are ever in Vegas do yourself a favor and stop by this bakery,

Love this place so much. Today, I got the sprinkle cookie. What a fun atmosphere and their desserts are so yummy. I'm a fan of the show, and been to the original bakery in Jersey. So, it makes it much more interesting going. Big fan of buddy! A must stop for tourists!

i got a vanilla confetti slice of cake and as soon as i got back to my room it was all gone because i instantly started eating. cant wait to visit vegas again cause ill be buying more than one slice next time

Great selection of pastries and coffee, but the employees should be more attentive. They should be nicer, provide options instead of showing that they are "bothered" by people. When we went, there were only two costumers and like 4 employees!

Holy Cannoli... After two attempts I successfully purchased about $39 worth of pastries... I only indulged in the carrot cupcake so stay tuned for an updated review. So far so good. Be prepared to wait this is definitely a tourist spot which means long lines filled with adults and children who are uncertain what to order...

I tried the canoli ($3.95)pastry from here and it was so good. The place was a mad house, just like it is on TV, but the employees are friendly and attentive. There was just enough variety to choose from, based on the size of the store, which wasn't too bad. I would go back again to try more baked goods.

Pros: great pastries, lots of detail and work go into each pastry, great prices, friendly staff, and fast service... Cons: small inside and gets crowded... Overall, a must place to visit in Las Vegas if you love pastries...they put so much effort and detail in every pastry that goes out of the kitchen...FYI Carlo is Buddy V's dad and is located across Buddy V's restaurant...much respect for Carlo because he cares about his customers and the details matter...

I'm a huge fan of the show Cake Boss and Buddy Velasco so when I heard there was a Carlos Bakery in Las Vegas, I had to go! Carlos Bakery is located in the Venetian Hotel. Its on the North end of the shopping area. The line wasn't too long when I went in the evening. Everything looked so delicious! Many people were ordering cakes but I wanted to try the cannoli and lobster tail... that's what I always see on his show. Wow, the cannoli was so good... One can be shared with two people, it's so big. The lobster tail was even more amazing than the cannoli. So crisp on the outside and flavorful on the inside. Oooh, yum! One day I would love to try his cakes. The prices were a bit pricey for everything. I got 6 cannolis and 3 lobster tail for a little over $45... but I got a free mug with it! :)

Carlo's Bakery. Yet another reason not to move back to the east coast, because Buddy has literally brought my home back to me! I couldn't have been more excited when the head waiter at Buddy V's told me it might be opening up! And now, the time has come! I attended the Grand Opening--Waiting in line was epic. Seriously. If it's gonna be similar to that everyday, I think I might go before the place even opens to reserve my butt a spot in line! Most of Buddy's family was there! Taking pictures, some even passing out snacks for the waiting people in line! They are super funny and customer service oriented! AMBIANCE: 5 - The bakery is organized, bright, and really visual-there's a ton of things to see. The amazing display cases, bakery merchandise lines the back, the artsy design of the bakery, and there is an open window outside where you can see the bakers at work. This window is right across from the mirroring window at Buddy V's! SERVICE: 5 - Service was amazing, fast, and efficient! Buddy really teaches his workers to be quick, considerate, and plain delightful!!!! If you don't know, here's how it works: First you order, then they retrieve your order and you pay. It's a fast and slow process. So, when there is a long line, be PATIENT. The long line is mainly because of the customers; everyone is crowded and confused and trying to get done quickly, yet at the same time, wanting to see all the display cases and having to wiggle their way around people! FOOD: 5 - The food is bomb, and just like I remember it. Well, for the most part! I ordered lobster tails, red velvet cake and cupcake, napolean, tiramisu, and cream puffs. *deep breath* I might get fat because of this! But dammit, I'll die happy!!! The lobster tail is still their specialty, and STILL the best dang dessert I've ever had. Can I get a hallelujah for the price though!? Down by $9! Thank goodness for those original prices. Actually, prices for -all- items really range and are pretty reasonable. For Grand Opening week they'll be open til midnight! Sooooo am I comin' back? Of course!!! I'll be a regular before you know it!

I found out about their lobster tail through social media, and when I saw the new flavors they had available, I had to stop by on my last visit to Las Vegas. I have to say, it's definitely worth a try! I got the salted caramel lobster tail and I thought it was just delicious! I ended up getting to try the traditional French cream when it was a day old and it was good too, but not as good as the salted caramel and a little stale. I would come back - would love to try their Cookies & Cream lobster tail next time! Lines weren't crazy at all when I went on a weekday mid-afternoon. Also, prices were reasonable for those treats in my opinion, just under $6 for one which I thought was a fair price for a place on the Strip. Any cheaper and I'd be tempted to get more, which wouldn't be great for the waistline :p

Carlo's Bakery may have perhaps become a tourist attraction after Cake Boss aired but I still find that it's more than worth the stop. I have been to the original Carlo's Bakery in Hoboken, NJ and while the Las Vegas location can't compare to the shop in NJ, the treats are delish and that's what's important. I was close to giving up on stopping by Carlo's as it started to get late and I had heard the line gets crazy. I could not for the life of me find the bakery at The Venetian. When I quit looking, I found it and to my surprise, no line! I got a pecan sticky bun, a slice of carrot cake & cafÃ© latte. I enjoyed everything very much all while watching one of the bakers work through the glass window where you can see all the bakers in action. Service was fast and friendly. I thought $9 was a tad steep for a slice of cake but it was so good and, Vegas, so you know...worth it.

Got a Rick and Morty cake made for my daughter with Devils food chocolate cake and oreo cream filling with fondant. I am not a fondant lover but this was amazing! It was delicious and my daughter loved it. The staff are all very friendly. Money well spent. They also worked with me and answered any questions or concerns I had. I'll be ordering more future cakes.

I had this cake for my birthday in Vegas on 8/4/19 and it was awesome! The Canoli was very good also! I brought a slice home to enjoy after my vacation. I wanted to get the whole cake, but didn't have room in my suitcase! I have to go back to Vegas very soon to get the cake again!
People were nice for sure organized. One of the best parts of our Vegas trip. They have covid precaution and social distancing we will be back
Not bad, what's all the hype? Only 4 stools to sit. The lobster tail was interesting. Like a cream puff croissant. Cheesecake was good, a bit cakey.
Been here twice now and I would say their cannolis are a must try! The filling is really good and the shell is nice & crispy.

This is long over due but so glad we made a visit to the Cake Boss "Carlo's Bake Shop as of course, "Im the real Boss "B" teeeee........heeee ;) We were the first to stand in line but of course since we no longer indulge in liquid poison and that is quite the absolute thrill of being in Vegas and really appreciate all the good food and breathtaking views of this magical adult play land. We were greeted by enthusiastic staff as they all were very friendly prior to opening, we talked of lovely conversations with the staff at how personable "Buddy" is and that he stops in regularly it also gave us time to feast our eyes on what we wanted to take with us back home. The shop is full of "decadent" & "heavenly" bite size of "sweet happiness"! Rows of addictive treats in different shapes, colors & sizes and all taste as good as they look. I can vouch for that "Sugar"! It was worth the time and calories waiting in line and I certainly look forward to my dolci on any sweet occasion.

I only got the cannolis and lobster tails, which I personally really liked. Not sure why the reviews are so harsh. I never heard about this place before coming so maybe my expectations weren't super high like other people. The lobster tails were my favorite and I think it might be one of my favorite pastries ever

Amazing!!! I'm a big fan of the show. Had to stop here and I was not disappointed! I had the cappuccino and a chocolate cake slice and both were heaven! I was just excited to be able to try something from Carlo's bakery!! The staff were so helpful and really friendly. As chaotic as it was they took there time and treated you like you are the only customer they had. I can't wait to make this a tradition and go back!!

I hear that the cannoli is superb here. BUT....we came to try one and ended up trying something else. My daughter is a Cake Boss enthusiast and wanted to come here. She also loves cannoli. She'd been looking forward to stopping by this place all day and we finally get to it, and she decides that she wants the cheesecake with chocolate mousse topping, topped with a chocolate covered strawberry. A little more pricy than I was hoping to spend, and my daughter only shared a teeny tiny taste with me, but since it was her special Las Vegas shop stop, I didn't mind. She ate the whole thing in less than three minutes and practically licked the container after....so with that said, it must've been pretty damn good! I've read other reviews about the staff being unfriendly and there being a long line, but on our visit, the staff was nice and there was only one person in line ahead of us. The selection was good for a small bakery. I don't recall there being any seats to sit at, but if there were, there were only a few. Most of the floor space was for guests to form a line if necessary and to browse the bakery displays. I'd definitely come back and try a cannoli or lobster tail on my next visit. If my daughter were with me, she'd make sure of it!

I was so excited when I found out cake boss is in the same hotel that I was staying at, omg! However it was definitely a walk to find this place though. I'm sure there were quicker ways but oh well. The store is a lot smaller than I expected. Love how you can see behind the scene with the glass windows. We came at a good time because after we ordered, the line literally multiplied by 20. The ordering process was quick however I did not like the paying process. Other people in lines were complaining as well. So we stayed in line waiting to order then after we ordered we went in another line waiting to pay. WHAT. I felt like that literally just made the store more crowded and its just so unesscessary. We got the lobster tails, cream puff, chocolate mouse cream puff and a chocolate cannoli. I loved how crispy the lobster tails were however it was just TOO creamy in the inside for me. My boyfriend felt the same way. Everything was delicious but in our opinions, it was just way too sweet to our liking. I'll def come back when I'm in town but this time, just one lobster tail.
This place is busy. Got myself the chocolate covered strawberries cheesecake. It was really good. Place looks clean and you can see the area where they do their baking. Staff was friendly

Line was long as usual. Tried the lobster tail pastry and the inside cream was good but the shell was hard. When I bit into it, literally the shell layers were so thick that it got stuck under my gums. It hurt for days and I take really good of my teeth. Overall, great pastries and cakes. Just that experience made me stay away from getting lobster tails.

Too many sweets to choose from! I got a pleasant surprise today when the other half showed up with a bag from this bake shop! I've been sick & feeling crabby so this did the trick! To my surprise he got a lot of incredible goodies! Brownies that are so moist and come with a thick layer of fudge! A beautiful tiramisu that almost looks to good to break into. A vanilla cupcake because I'm obsessed with plain ones. A cream puff filled with decadent custard! Macaroons, a Nutella cookie, black & white cookies & chocolate covered strawberries! Talk about a way to a girls heart! I have no idea how we're going to eat all this stuff but we'll give it a good try! Everything I've ever tasted from this place has been great. Be prepared because it's very pricey but the quality is there.

A trip to Carlo's Bakery was a must when my niece -- a big fan of the Cake Boss show -- learned of this west coast outpost. On Christmas eve morning there was a line about 20 minutes long at 11am. The items on display all looked impressive, but it was the lobster tail that I had my sights on. Its crunchy, yet light and airy shell gave way to an overabundance of smooth, rich cream filling. It's a signature item for sure that is well worth the caloric intake. Mini canolis, pre-filled to make service more efficient, still maintained their crunchy exterior. Their apple turnover was excellent -- all the flavors of an apple pie wrapped in a buttery and flaky pastry. The mini red velvet cake didn't disappoint either with its moist and chocolatey cake and cream cheese filling. My kid tried an oreo cake tower that I barely got to sample. He's now a fan of the bakery as well. Prices, as expected are astronomical. My wife, kid and I walked away $40+ poorer but sated from our pre-Christmas bounty. There is very limited seating in the bakery -- maybe 6 barstools that overlook the kitchen area. But, there is seating out towards Las Vegas Blvd, right outside Bouchon Bakery.
Okay, my boyfriend is not a fan of sweets but he ate 4/5 cannolis and the only lobster tail I bought. I should've bought more. Will definitely be back on our next Vegas trip.

I've never heard of Buddy before until my cousins told me about him while we were on Vegas. So since we were already in Vegas I wanted to try his bakeshop since many fans hype about it. The line is usually long when you get there so definitely come earlier (before 12pm). As I looked at the variety of deserts the bakeshop offers, I was drawn towards the cannoli and the cream puff. The cream puff was good, but I wish it had less cream in it because it was too overwhelming, but the cannoli was amazing. But don't get the chocolate covered cannoli cause it wasn't impressive. I give this place a 4 star because when we came in, the cashier worker was extremely rude. But everything else was a great experience.

I watch Buddy Valastro on the tv he's fantastic!!! His entire family is great !! I went to Vegas just because Buddy Valastro has a restaurant and a bakery. The cannoli was delicious as was everything that we tried. I definitely will be back. Buddy the next time I hope to meet Ralph in Hoboken New Jersey and anyone else that I can. You're the best!!!

On our last trip to Vegas we had stumbled upon this bakery but were too full to try anything. For this next trip, I wanted to make sure I got to try one of the delicious looking pastries at this bakery. This is Buddy Valastro's (face of the Cake Boss TV show) bakery but I really didn't care about that much. It was the case after case of desserts that caught my interest. They are eye catching and there is a huge variety of what you can get. I also liked the unique take on old dessert favorites like the Boston creme pie, which they had in a little circular mold instead of as a pie slice. I got the Lobster Tail which is what they are known for. It's a croissant shaped like a lobster tail with powdered sugar on top and fluffy creme stuffed in the tail. I loved it and I felt like it was the extreme version of a creme puff. My husband got the Oreo cake tower. I'm not sure if it was written in the description but this turned out to be a cheesecake which my husband does NOT like. I didn't get to try it but based on the size of the dessert, a cheesecake would've been very rich. We had to wait in a line when we arrived but I know this isn't unusual for this place. The one thing I didn't like was how bored and disinterested the employees looked. They completely killed the fun vibe of this place and made you feel like you were in the Seinfield "Soup Nazi" episode when you place your order. You work with heavenly desserts all day; put on a smile!

Pretty busy and at the time it wasn't much to choose from as far small treats but what I selected I was in heaven! They mainly had full cakes and cookies on display, like I said it was busy so I couldn't be mad of the limited selections. The only thing I didn't like was the ordering process but with limited space they do what they can. It's also a bit expensive but for the right dessert it's worth it! 'Lobster Tail' croissant like pastry with whipped cream in the center. This wasn't the dessert I picked but my cousin said it was a 3 out of 5. $5.50 I got the 'white chocolate mousse cake' 5 out of 5!!!! It was silky smooth white chocolate mousse with a dark chocolate outside and white chocolate shavings on the outside. It wasn't heavy or to rich. I would stand in line for that and pay the expensive price! $9.95

The shoppes on the second floor of the Venetian and is always busy plus you probably won't see Carlos. You can watch through the bakery window window and watch the cakes being made. The prices are expensive but it's worth it for a special occasion. Cupcakes are really good.
The mouthwAtering dark chocolate mousse! The Flakey & crusty Lobster tail! & Finally the nutty and creamy filling of the Cannoli! Cake Boss is the bomb! Worth the wait in line!

All I can say about this place is... you must try a chocolate covered strawberry! They are huge and juicy and delicious! The baked goods look amazing and taste like a little slice of heaven. They have bakers next door baking to fill up the yummy treats for the store. You can't go wrong with the deliciousness from here!

Who hasn't seen Cake Boss?! I mean I HAD to come here. Cute, classy and clean little bake shop. I came here on a Tuesday morning so no crazy long lines. I must've lucked out. I got a small Cannoli, the famous Lobster Tail and a Pecan Danish. The Cannoli was pretty good. Light, crispy and not too sweet. The Pecan Danish was pretty good too. Buttery and rich with a lovely toasty crunch of pecans. The Lobster Tail was the best pasty I've ever had in my entire life. Layers upon layers of crispy, crunchy, flakey pastry encased around a rich and fluffy pastry cream. The pastry cream was freaking amazing and I could've eaten that alone with a spoon! It wasn't too sweet and had hints of amaretto and vanilla. If I could have a Lobster Tail once a week for my whole life I would die of happiness. One thing I liked a lot about this place, that the pastries are not overwhelmingly sweet, at least not the ones I got. I hate it when pastries and baked goods are too sweet. Service was fast but nothing extraordinary. I will be coming back here for my lobster tail every time I am in Vegas.

Their cannolis are awesome. The store is clean and it is in The Venetian. I also appreciate their ordering system. They take orders while people are in line so by the time you get to the counter it is ready. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would gladly go again.
Omg! The cannolis are delicious. I've had them elsewhere and nothing compares to the cannolis at Carlo's. I wish there was a bakery closer to me

The line can get long and it's pretty slow. They only have 2 cashiers, if they are both working, and people (myself included) like to ask a million questions about each item. Luckily, when I came here the first time there wasn't a line (Friday around 8:30pm) and it was pretty quick. We purchased a 6in round red velvet cake the day before for my bosses birthday. They will write anything you want on it for free. While there, I took advantage of having no line and also purchased a carrot cake cupcake (not my favorite) and the lobster tail. WOW, I figured the lobster tail would be pretty lightweight, but considering it's a custard/whipped cream mix I should have known. This thing was dense, flaky and delicious. Honestly, it almost had too much filling. I took most of it out and picked around it because I felt guilty for how fattening it probably was, but it's definitely worth trying and splitting with 1 or 5 people :) Since we paid for the cake the day before, we didn't have to wait in the horribly long line come Saturday evening before dinner, we got there just before our 7:30pm reservation at another place nearby. Thankfully we paid beforehand because the line was INSANELY long. Luckily, the cake ready to go and packaged nicely. All in all, it took just a few minutes to get the cake and head out the door. People looked pretty upset that we walked straight up but hey! we already paid for it. The cake was delicious, moist and flavorful. Everyone enjoyed it and the price was definitely fair for the size. I think we paid $36-$40.

I loved their lobster tail and cannoli!! Carlos' Bake Shop is a great bakery to visit if you 1) are a Cake Boss fan, 2) are at the Venetian Hotel, and 3) love yummy baked goods. The (estimated) 30 minutes in line passes quickly as you witness the magic that happens in the back. It was a treat to see their cupcakes being frosted and lobster tails being filled with cream. My favorite, however, was to see a baker successfully stack, dirty ice, and beautifully decorate four cakes in a matter of 10 minutes. My only caveat is that I didn't get to meet the great Buddy V.!

I got the lobster tail and creme puff, i must say the lobster tail was good but the creme puff not so much. The filling in the lobster tail was really sweet. Would love to try their infamous cake sometime though. I will definitely be back!!!
I haven't thought it's going to be big like that plus bakery , I loved more the food than the sweet the garlic bread I recommended it really good and tasty also staff so friendly

This place is delicious! The chocolate mousse is amazing! Nice, friendly staff and it moves quickly. I visited twice while I was in Vegas! Love that we can enjoy Carlos Bakery on the west coast! I also love that they support the epilepsy foundation as it personally impacts Buddy's family and my family!

I love food and the detest that I pay every time the are made fresh every day so the customer service is always good and love see in the windows also that we know what we are revive good quality food from back east coast

So good!! The pastries are gorgeous to look at and melt in your mouth. We had a few cream puffs and the red velvet cake. I have never had any red velvet cake like it. The cream puffs were also delicious. The pastry was crisp and the cream filling is like clouds in your mouth. Hope to come back the next time we're here.

Veeeery busy!!!! We stood in line for over an hour to try this place and it was well worth it. The prices of everything are very reasonable, especially the cannolis. They have a wonderful selection of cakes and mini cakes, cupcakes and everything else in between. REAL CUSTOMER SERVICE; Soooo my child was getting very frustrated and angry from waiting so long and by the time we got to the front she was screaming profusely!!!! She was acting crazy and being soooo loud. THEN one of the bakers working in the back actually came out and gave her a free cookie!!!! I wish I knew her name but she was African American with glasses and I really want to THANK HER and say how much I appreciated that gesture of kindness!!!!!! I hope she gets a raise because I know she deserves it just by being a sweet person!

Second time visiting, had to get my Lobster Tail fix! Those suckers are addicting. The brownie was just okay and the regular cannoli was good, didn't care for the chocolate cannoli. It's best to go on Yelp to check out the pics, that way when it's your turn to order you pretty much know what you want. It's hard to see when you're in line because the people ahead of you are blocking the display case. It is pricey but hey it's the Cake Boss, lol.......and you are in Vegas. Enjoy!

Cupcakes are to die for, the cake is delicious and the frosting WOW!!!! Hands down best frosting I have ever had. I tried the lobster tail, original filling. I feel like there was too much filling, but the pastry itself is so crispy fresh and really good. Went on a Sunday morning and unfortunately they didn't have cannoli's made yet, so picked up some cupcakes. Don't skip on the cupcakes!!

Came here on a saturday afternoon. Finding the place was quite hard. Doriee and I couldn't really find info on it. Walked around the casino floor. Couldn't find it. All she knew was it was across from Buddy's. Decided to go upstairs (near front of casino) to the shops level. Saw an arrow with name pointing outside.. Walked to the right, outside, along a pathway, up a few steps, and saw Buddy's sign. Went inside the doors, and there the bakery was, across from Buddy's, with the huge amounts of people. We decided to grab a number. E28. Ok. They are on 10. Not long wait. Later we found out, they were on D10 ! OH MY GOD ! THEY ARE OVER A HUNDRED NUMBERS BEHIND ! ! Was told by a guy who was there for the bakery as well. Decided to wait anyway, since we were there. After a while, the guy was nice enough to give me his extra ticket. D63. Cut out wait times by half ! Whoever that guy was, thank you ! Fire alarms went off for some odd reason. Venetian security and maintenance, and etc came to investigate the ovens and what not. We had gotten a strawberry cheesecake and a lobster tail to share. Lobster Tail - fluffy, crispy puffed pastry filled with a sweet pastry cream. Made as a variation of the "Sfogliatelle" pastry meaning "small, thin layers/leaves". Crispy exterior. Sweet, creamy cream interior. Melody and orchestra of different flavors and textures. Strawberry cheesecake - traditional cheesecake with a HUGE stemmed strawberry on top with a light strawberry syrup sauce. Cheesecake was creamy and smooth. Not the smoothest cheesecake ive had but still pretty good. Strawberry syrup was nice and light. Not too sweet nor overpowering. Complimented cheesecake well. Didn't cover cheesecake flavor. Aside from the huge amounts of people and wait time, their products are pretty good. Their small cakes are a really reasonable price. Would love to eat the lobster tail again :D

I love to try new bakeries so when I found out about this place I knew I needed to add it to the list. I wanted to try it because it was new to me, but apparently most people were there because of the TV show. We waited about 30 minutes in a line that wasn't really that long, but was crazy slow for some reason. The good thing about the line was that an employee greets you with a tray at the beginning and then walks the line with you as you pick items from the cases. This is good since you can't see anything in the cases until it's time to order. Hint, the items in the first case are the most expensive items. The line alone made me want to hate this place, but we really enjoyed our baked goods. My pecan snowball was the best pecan snowball I've ever had. It was full of flavor and moist, not a bit of dryness. The strawberry shortcake was yummy with juicy strawberries, moist shortcake, and lots of flavorful whipped cream topping. We also really enjoyed the M&M cookie and the mini cannoli. The cannoli had a nice crispy shell with a slightly sweet filling with a hint of cinnamon. The seven layer cookie wasn't my favorite. I couldn't taste any jam between the layers and it was pretty dry without the jam. My husband thought his frosted donut was good, but not the best donut ever. Overall, they have a few items that are great so I'll probably come back and brave the line again.

I've never had a slice of cake more moist and delicious in my life. Already craving another slice and extremely sad that it's not in arms reach. I tried the funfetti cake and the double chocolate cake and would highly recommend either - along with literally anything in the shop because it all looks (and smells) to die for

Service was great everyone was very nice and personable. We just about got one of everything and there wasn't anything we didn't enjoy. Would recommend anyone with a sweet tooth in Vegas to go here. I think my favorite was the cookies and cream lobster tail. It was light and crisp but not to hard and didn't get soggy from the cream inside. I'm a soft cookie fan and the cookies were on the harder side but they tasted fantastic.
There was no line when i visited(Monday). The pastries are delicious. The prices are a little high, so be prepared to spend. The place was clean, the staff was nice. If you're in Vegas, then why not.

Beautiful cakes and delicious baked goods. They used to make an apple strudel which we loved but no more!?! Pastries and cakes are good when fresh. Apparently lots of people like the cannolis but i haven't tried yet. We got a slice of carrot cake--a must try! Cake is light and frosting was perfectly sweet and just the right amount. Going to try the one in Santa Monica which we didn't know was one there!!

Rugelach: Double Chocolate Chip, Apricot, Raspberry w/ Raisins Lobster Tail ($5.95) Cream Puffs ($2.50) Hazelnut Cream Puffs ($2.50) Strawberry Tart ($2.50) Cannoli (sm; $2.50) Raspberry Linzer Tart ($3.50) Yeah, GOOD STUFF. I enjoyed everything in my box. The cream puffs are delicious and I loved the tarts. The cannoli was also good, though not my favorite pastry. The BEST pastry was absolutely the Lobster Tail. WOW. This was my first lobster tail experience and it blew me away. I loooove the layer after layer after layer of flaky pastry and the French cream was so scrumptious (they put a touch of Bailey's Irish Cream in it!). This is my kind of pastry! The line can get long, but when I visited, it moved REALLY quickly. Come early for fresh pastries and to, hopefully, beat some of the crowd.

Waiting in line sucks... yes we all know this! But this is one line I'd wait in again. I had a lobster tail and a mini canoli. Should of gotten two lobster tails and large canoli as they were very delicious. I feel as if the lobster tail edges out the canoli but both are worth trying. Everything looks good, but is kinda pricey. Nothing is better then some yummy pastries and walking throughout the Venetian.

Ok first off, this place SMELLS like heaven! (What I imagine heaven smells like, anyway) The line was quite long for pastries. I waited about 20 minutes before it was my turn but it was well worth the wait. There's so many desserts to choose from, but I chose a regular cannoli, chocolate cannoli, white chocolate mousse cake and a hazelnut cream puff. I really wanted a black and white cookie but unfortunately they were sold out for the day. Everything I chose was delicious! My favorite would have to be the white chocolate mousse. At $9.95 I was a bit skeptical on whether it would be worth the money but I'd happily pay this again. I may have eaten the whole thing by myself.............. Not sorry. The cannolis were awesome. They tasted homemade, as they should. I preferred the regular cannoli over the chocolate covered one. I recommend letting them sit out like 10 mins before eating them because when they're straight from the fridge it's a bit hard to bite into. It tasted better when thawed out :) Good thing I don't live near Carlo's because I'd be super fat if I did (but I'd be happyyyy)!

Delicious deserts. I got the lobster tail and it was fresh, flaky, and the cream was rich and airy. I just would definitely recommend it this place to anyone wanting a sweet treat. The variety of desert was vast and service was courteous and quick. Price was fitting for Vegas, but not outrageous. I will be back and try more. They were also accommodating to a couple who wanted something they were currently out of and were willing to take an order for the next day.
Came here for some dessert treats during our 10-Year Wedding Anniversary in Las Vegas. They didn't disappoint, we were able to make our order and were out the door in no time at all.

I went back in June on a Sunday afternoon to Carlo's bake shop and no lines at all. I waited with my brother and sister in line for a few minutes until someone helped us. Too much to choose from cannoli cupcakes, and cookies. Next, we lined up at the cashier to pay our items and the line wasn't long at all. They make the best Italian cookies and cannoli with fresh cream and good crunch. Lots of people linger to looky loo or just waiting for their orders. Its fun to watch the bakers frost the tray of cupcakes or making cookies. I will definitely go back again.

The desserts were incredible. My husband and I loved the lobster tail! I usually don't like this kind of pastry since there is so little filling at other places, but this was filled to the brim and delicious! We tried a bunch of different things since I watched the show and was determined to make it out here. The strawberry cheesecake was probably the best my cheesecake loving husband had ever had. I even loved it and I usually don't like cheesecake. The line was long even at 10pm, but worth the stop. I just wish they had some chairs and tables nearby to eat our treats. We did find benches back by the canal near the stores. It is also very expensive sometimes be careful how much you order. It would have helped the line move quicker if they had signs of what everything was instead of everyone having to ask when they ordered.

Delicious cannolis! The shells were crisp and fresh and the cream went all the way through. Worth the price. Got an Oreo tower and a white chocolate mousse that I will update about later. Edit: both other desserts were amazing

So far, this is one of my favorite Italian Bakeries in Las Vegas. We walked in about 10:30 am and it wasn't busy at all. We talked with Austin while placing our order and he gave us a few great suggestions. I liked the Nutella filled cookie, Pistachio Biscotti, butter cookies, Cannoli, and the Boston Cream. The Cannoli sweet, with chocolate chips, a great filling and a fresh crunch. I hate soggy ones, so this made my day. We waited to pay as he wrapped our purchases in boxes and even tied them shut with a string. It wasn't a speedy transaction and it can be a little pricey for some (I got a lot of stuff for $26.00), but it's Vegas. Live a little. For great Italian baked goods, service and attitude, this is the place!

BROWNIE. That's all I have to say. Best brownie I've ever had. Didn't get to eat it until the next day and it was still soft and so good. Also got a cannoli, the chocolate covered, and it was delicious! Can't go wrong with anything you get there!

Carlo's Bakery is located inside the Venetian right across from Buddy V's Ristorante. There was a bit of a line when we went but it went fairly fast. I ordered the lobster tail and it was crispy and delicious. My daughter ordered a cheesecake and was not disappointed. The only complaint I have is that there is no seating outside or anywhere nearby. We had to walk around and find a place to sit. They should at least put a few benches outside.

So many mixed reviews. Everything I ordered was actually good. Probably one of the best cannoli I've had. I didn't know what to expect from the lobster tail but it was decent I guess. The filling wasn't as sweet as the cannoli but it was still good. Chocolate cake with chocolate frosting was amazing too and this is coming from someone who hates chocolate cake. It was melt in your mouth perfection. Don't remember what else I ordered $50 later in dessert but got free apron.

One of the best cupcakes I've ever had. Moist and not too sweet vanilla cake topped with a delicious buttercream- none of that fake sugary sweet icing. Wish they would put prices up next to each item. My cupcake turned out to be close to $4, but that's okay because it was delicious! Hardly a line at 9:30 pm on a Friday night.
This place is amazing. I was lucky enough not to wait for to long to get my deserts! Many options and it was kept stocked. My next stop is the restaurant !

As an omnivore, I enjoy trying everything, including vegan fare. And I've got to say that the eponymous vegan doughnuts here are virtually indistinguishable from "normal" ones and are just as scrumptious as the most blingy "gourmet" varieties that I've had. And talking about gourmet donuts, there are a dozen varieties here, each of which are not just pretty to look at and therefore Instagrammable, but are also super scrumptious and high quality. No SoCal "style" over substance, that's for sure. Whether the blueberry cake, raspberry and sprinkles, strawberry shortcake, or old-fashioned, each donut I tried was light and flufly yet sufficiently doughy and dense so as not to leave you feeling guilty about empty carbs. At $2.00-3.50 each, prices were reasonable given the presentation and intrinsic quality. Be sure to get here first thing in the morning because they can sell out fast - and close early. Deservedly so. Thanks Yelpers for yet another solid, local, independent find!

We were walking to get some coffee and decided to stop in. They were going to close in less than 20 minutes. Lots of good options. Some of which rotate. We got a lemonade lavender, strawberry, and a blueberry one. All so delicious! Couldn't tell it was vegan and the texture and flavors are better than most donuts I've had. Staff was nice! 2 of them. They helped give suggestions and didn't rush us even though they were closing soon.

Visited The Vegan Doughnut Company today after much anticipation and hearing many rave reviews!! It 100% lived up to the hype! I tried the Fruity Cereal Milk and wow, it was delicious. The dough was so airy, fluffy, and light. It was sweet, but not overwhelmingly so. I also tried a few bites of their Easter-themed doughnuts, which were more of a cake doughnut consistency and also top-notch. The quality of these doughnuts is truly unmatched. I've heard a non-vegan say that these were the best doughnuts they've ever had. The location of the Vegan Doughnut Company is extremely convenient, on the main street of Lakewood. There is ample parking space in the lot for the shopping center behind the shop. Love to support this excellent local business.

Honestly amazing. We've been here more than 5 times in the last couple of months. This place has become our go to donut spot around Cleveland and will highly recommend. Initially, we were skeptical since it was "vegan" and with that, we were worried that the cream or the dough might not taste as good as a traditional donut. Obviously, we were wrong and the bakers at the company has proven that their donuts are even better than traditional flour/milk donuts. The flavors are strong, but not overbearing. The sweetness is just right and the dough is always fluffy. Price is around 2-3$ per donut, which is normal for more artisan donuts around here. Our favorites include the crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e, the donut with dragon fruit flavor and lemon lavender.

Hooooly hell these are some truly delicious doughnuts! Got up early and made the short drive to Lakewood to pick up a dozen vegan doughnuts! The staff was so friendly and recommended which I should try. Their menu changes each month so there's new flavors to try every month! Parking is available on the street and these can be a little pricey but you get some BIG doughnuts and they're probably the best vegan ones I've had!

Hands down the best donuts in Cleveland. Their flavors change every month and are always very creative and fun. The Choco Taco donut was my favorite. All the donuts had great texture and all the toppings weren't too sweet and went very well the donuts.

No complaints from me! All were good! The lemon lavender, and the Boston Cream were EXCELLENT! My family loved the other flavors too! Bring a good container to get 10% off. Thank you! We will be back!

Went here on a Saturday afternoon, they still had a great collection. We tried the key lime, strawberry shortcake, key lime, carrot cake, cookie dough and lemon lavender. They were all so fresh and you couldn't even tell they were vegan. My favorite was the key lime and carrot cake. Staff was all nice and helpful! Would definitely go again.
These donuts are great and taste as good as they look. They're not too sweet and not greasy at all. I brought these to a party and no one knew it was vegan until I told them.

I'm in love. They've put a lot of thought into these doughnuts and the store itself (love the store decor and vibes). The doughnuts are delightfully light yet you get all the flavor profiles. It's not just that sugar flavor either. I'm not vegan but I think vegan doughnut company might be my favorite doughnuts ever.

I really enjoyed my visit here this weekend with my family. The doughnuts are, by far, the best in Cleveland. The shop was clean and beautiful. The staff were friendly and super nice. There is absolutely no room for improvement here because it is perfect. I can't wait to visit every month to try the different flavors.

Long lines from open to sell out for all four days of the week they're open. 6 donuts was $15.75. Mostly yeast donuts cut in half with filling between the two halves. Unique flavors such as matcha cream and creme brÃ»lÃ©e. The lavender lemon was absolutely spot on with a deliciously aromatic sprinkling of lavender buds atop a genuine lemon glaze that was just enough sweet and sour. The egg nog donut also had a true to name flavored cream on top of the glaze. The yeast donut texture is the same as a very chewy dinner roll which is not my jam. Too dense and again so chewy it's like a more tough pull-apart. Pricey at $2-3 per donut but worth the novelty to try once.

They flavors are always amazing! They are all so sweet when we stop in. We've only been twice but will definitely be back for more! My son and I LOVE the lemon lavender and our all time favorite was the chocolate candied "bacon" from a few years ago! Can't wait to try the key lime pie this month

UPDATED REVIEW -- The 2 young women who own this vegan doughnut shop are the sweetest. They are truly passionate about their business. It is so awesome to see a black owned business in Lakewood. I am always greeted with a smile and I feel welcomed anytime I come here. Now that I've tried other doughnuts in the Cleveland area, I will say that these are tasty. They are soft but actually a bit too sweet. It is almost as if you can taste the sugar. I especially feel this when I taste the Lavender doughnut. These are vegan doughnuts so they are made without milk. I do appreciate that the price has gone down from $3 a doughnut to $2 a doughnut which is affordable. I will be back here but the hours here are still limited. They are opened Fridays - Sundays.
So so happy to have an all vegan donut shop in the CLE. Awesome donuts and very kind and friendly staff. I highly recommend it!!

I was happily surprised this place lived up to its hype!! Food 5/5 These donuts are FIRE. The dough is loose and fluffy, almost like brioche!! The flavors are unique and tasteful, but none were too sweet at all! They also are cleanly decorated, not overflowing with icing or messy at all. I'm shook that these are vegan I would never have guessed by their taste and texture. Highly recommend strawberry shortcake and cookie butter! Service 4/5 Line took about 40min after getting there at opening time (9am on a Sunday)! But the employees were super nice, and they have social distancing policy of only allowing one party into the store at a time and masks required! The place was pristine and very clean. Will definitely be back. Best donuts in cleveland yet!

AMAZING doughnuts for vegans and non-vegans alike!! I'm usually out of town on the weekends so my mom waited in line for about 30 minutes yesterday morning to get us some doughnuts. It was well worth it. We got the key lime pie, glazed twist, blueberry cake, strawberry shortcake and raspberry lemonade. The blueberry cake was my personal favorite but I'm also partial to cake doughnuts but it was delicious and not super oily or overly sugary. The perfect cake doughnut. My mom and aunt loved the key lime and strawberry shortcake, some of the best doughnuts they've ever had they said. Love that their menu changes a little every month so I already know I'll be back to try out whatever new flavors they whip up.

Probably the best donuts in Cleveland, and incredible that they're vegan too! They always have the classics and fun new flavors - I got the glazed, citrus and cardamom, lavender lemon, tiramisu. All were great and they're always changing up the menu! Be sure to get in on the earlier side, because they do sell out of flavor later in the afternoon. Definitely going back next time I'm craving a donut.

These are seriously, without a doubt, the MOST DELICIOUS donuts to ever enter my stupid donut-loving mouth. Holy crapola! For months before even moving to the Cleveland area, I've been follow Vegan Doughnut Company on Instagram and daydreaming of one day eating their beautiful square shaped goodies. Finally, they've reopened to public on Saturday and Sundays and oh my goodness gracious, it was worth the wait. I would honestly have NO idea that these donuts were vegan if it weren't so obvious in the name. Everything from the dough, to the toppings, to the fillings are plant-based and finger-licking good. Like, lick out the box good. I've tried 8 different donuts of theirs in the past few weeks and intend on continuing to persuade my husband to go early on the weekends to wait in line for his sweet tooth wifey (aka me). And wait, you will! They open at 9am on Saturday and SUndays and depending on what time you jump in line, there's a good chance that you'll wait in line upwards of an hour. BUT let me tell you, it's worth it! And they run out quick, so waiting in line is your only option currently. Support local y'all! YUM IN MY TUM!
Lots of special flavors the coconut bacon is my favorite. However I do find all the donuts are way too sweet.

My husband wanted to purchase donuts on my birthday, so we decided to check this place out. So glad we did!!! The doughnuts are amazing! The shop is small, clean, quaint and full of plants (which I love). As soon as we entered, we were immediately welcomed. The young lady behind the counter was warm and friendly, always smiling. There were a wonderful assortment of vegan doughnuts, which made it very hard to choose. We settled for 2 twisted glazed, 2 strawberry shortcakes (yum) and 2 lemon lavenders (interesting). We couldn't wait to get home to try them, so we began eating in the car - lol. The doughnuts were super moist and delicious! We were very surprised at the sweetness and the strawberry shortcake doughnuts taste as if there are real strawberries in the icing. The store is in Lakewood, OH and very easy to find. We parked on a side street and walked up. There are an array of other interesting stores in the area too. I highly recommend this establishment and will most definitely return!

If going vegan tastes like this, why aren't we all vegan! I keep hearing about TVDC, today I passed it and made a quick decision to pull over and grab some. I've found a new favorite spot. TVDC is absolutely stunning inside. It's a small in and out space, but walking in feels so magical! Staff was so nice and helpful when picking out which to get. Often times with vegan remakes of food, things often times just feel "off" but not with these donuts. You seriously would have NO idea that these were vegan, which is what makes them to die for. My two favorites I tried were the tiramisu and the strawberry shortcake. Seriously, this place rocks. Go show love to this Female Owned, Black Owned, Cleveland Local, small business ASAP.
Okay Yum! I love these donuts!!!! The key lime one is my favorite! Can't wait to go back!

The word "vegan" isn't normally my cup of tea, but these fresh and colorful donuts did not disappoint. I waited ten minutes in a very quick line and chose from maybe 8 colorful donut options. I really enjoyed the strawberry cream filled one and the strawberry shortcake was also a hit. Will be back.

This place is adorable and the staff was incredibly friendly. I was visiting from out of town and happened to stumble upon this place. I'm so glad I did!! I always seek out vegan donuts when I travel and this little shop blew me away. Some of the best donuts I've ever had. I tried the cookie dough, hibiscus sprinkle, cookies and cream, and lemon lavender. They were all incredible but the cookie dough stole the show. Will definitely be back when I'm in town again.

The freshest doughnut I have EVER had. Even if you're not vegan, these are a total hit and an awesome opportunity for those who are vegan. The store is welcoming and a fun atmosphere. We waited in line on Christmas Eve morning and did not mind at all as everyone was patient and the staff was doing a great job handling the crowd. Added bonus that is a small business and family run! Every flavor was great but I would highly recommend the maple cream filled and old fashioned.

I've been eyeing this place for a while. I finally made my way inside and the atmosphere was quaint and relaxed. The staff was also very friendly. I got the famous lemon lavender and a strawberry shortcake. I am not a fan of lemon desserts but both of these donuts were possibly the best donuts i've ever had. I am questioning if they are vegan because they are that good! Will definitely be coming back.

Still a good donut/doughnut! I stopped in recently at their new brick and mortar storefront in Lakewood. I went with the strawberry sprinkles, lemon lavender, and the maple with coconut bacon. They are $2.50 each and pretty good. (Well, minus the one with coconut that they tried to make taste like bacon since this is a vegan place. Just not for me.) If you're in the area stop and give them a try!

We were so happy to find this wonderful place! My daughter is newly vegan, and our family has a tradition of scouring the cities we visit for the best donuts! These were it! The whole family enjoyed them... husband and kids loved the Cookies and Cream, but I really enjoyed the unique flavor of the Lemon Lavender. Cute, clean shop was a plus, too! I wish they had a place like this at home.

I was amazed with the doughnuts from the vegan doughnut company. They tasted better than normal doughnuts and didn't leave me feeling sick after eating them. My favorites were the pumpkin spice and the strawberry short cake. They were also a hit with my friends!

Yum yum YUM!! As a donut fanatic I had heard a lot of hype around the vegan doughnut company well before I went in for my first visit. My friends and I planned to show up right at opening time (9 am) on a beautiful Sunday morning -- and when we got there the line was already AROUND THE BLOCK. We waited in line for ~40 minutes, but the moment we got inside, we knew the wait was worth it. All their donuts were beautifully decorated and consisted of more traditional flavors, but also, more unique ones. We ordered a box consisting of strawberry cream, cookies & cream, lemon lavender, maple cream, and more! They were all SO GOOOD-- the donuts were delicious, weren't too overly sweet, and I couldn't even tell that they were vegan. My favorite flavor was the lemon lavendar because it was a nice combination of tart + sweet. So before you go, make sure to double check their hours since they are pretty limited (and you should definitely try to show up early so the donut flavors you want don't run out). In addition, their menu is always changing, so you should look at their website or instagram page too for those! Fun fact: The two co-founders attended the same high school I went to in the Cleveland area, so that pretty awesome! Will definitely continue supporting them and am excited to see their business continue to grow

Soooo the Apple brÃ»lÃ©e doughnut?! - ridiculously tasty. Even though the doughnut wasn't cooked through all the way, it was STILL MAD TASTY. It was that good. The glazed twist tasted like biscuits from the can fried at home, that I then glazed. I wasn't blown away by that. I'll definitely be back to try the specialized doughnut. Also, they could use more clear signage inside of the store. Overall, this is a great place!

Probably my favorite donuts in cleveland and they're VEGAN. I've been here twice now and was able to try several of the different flavors - all of them looked amazing and tasted even better! Couldn't even tell they were vegan. The donuts were light and not greasy or overwhelmingly sweet. They have so many fun and unique flavors. The menu changes every month (check their insta for the latest!), so there's always something new to try. The lavender lemon, tiramisu, and blueberry cake donuts were my absolute favorites, but you really can't go wrong. The line can get long so try to go early, but the wait is WORTH it. They have also incorporated safe social distancing measures, allowing only one customer/party into the store at a time. Also, their hours are limited so be sure to check them before going!
Went to buy a friend a treat who happens to be vegan. I am not. Bought myself some also. So pleasantly surprised! They are delicious. She loved them too.
These are the donuts I got! They are so pretty and I had one so far (the cake one) and it was great! Cute place too

Vegans and Non-vegans alike will enjoy these delicious treats. I loved the lemon lavender and the cookies and cream flavors. The dough for the square doughnuts is very unique, it has a great texture and doesn't feel too heavy in your stomach. The sisters running the show are always smiling and super friendly. I've found a new guilty pleasure.

I'm not even vegan (but enjoy an occasional vegan meal), but these doughnuts are popping!! Man I will stand in line waiting outside again for these! I love the menu changes every month too. This place is awesome!!

Excellent donuts!!! They currently have a great fall selection-the Maple Cream is amazingggg. The old fashioned pumpkin is lovely too! The only downfall was that there were no drinks/coffee options. I was hoping to grab a cup of coffee at the same time. But not a huge deal, as the Starbucks is a block away. 9/10 will be back again!!!

These donuts are better than non-vegan donuts. You know when you finally see some goodness in the world and it inspires you to live your life a little more optimistically. That's what I felt when I bit into the strawberry shortcake donut. Their blueberry cake donut was also amazing. Would highly highly highly highly highly highly recommend. The owners are also very down to earth and lovely

Doughnuts are good. It's even better if they come vegan, which are hard to find but you can find these here. The Vegan Doughnut Company is a small store. A counter displays all the doughnuts. You can get a box or bring a container here with you. Handcrafted doughnuts like these are better than any you get commercially. It tastes so much fresher, because these are actually made here. They always have a large variety. All the flavors sound good. Some of the flavors include classics like chocolate and vanilla. A few more exotic flavors include banana nut, maple with coconut bacon pieces, and strawberry. The donuts are $2 each, which isn't bad for something like this. It tastes just like regular donuts. That means they're good, and while they may not be much healthier they're made of higher quality. It doesn't have any room to sit inside. Outside there's a picnic table along the wall so there's somewhere close to sit. They have somewhat limited hours plus they close when they run out, which

Vegan means it's healthy right? If you like doughnuts, you have to check this place out. Great variety of flavors and overly delicious. You can't go wrong with this place. There is a line but thats because it delicious and because they are doing their part to limit the number of people in their store. Don't forget a mask. #covid however it well worth the wait ladies and gentlemen

Inconspicuous from the main road, I'd say this shop is a gem for the community especially transitioning vegans or vegans with a sweet tooth! Entering the shop is like going into a calm oasis. I loved the minimal, earthy, yet chic vibe. While no one was visible upon entry, I was still greeted almost immediately by two smiling faces that came from the back. With a perfect amount of options, this place has something for everyone, cake and yeast- based doughnuts with great flavors (both common and unique). The cookie butter is a cream filled doughnut and I appreciate the crumble on top. I love the passion fruit doughnut, but think it could've done without the sprinkles. However, they didn't detract, just didn't add to it. I'd recommend adding a fresh fruit like slices strawberries or blueberries if want to add color. The blueberry doughnut was a cake doughnut and familiar to taste, so good. Lastly, I went out on a limb and tried the lemon lavender and I must say it was magical! Sometimes less is more, and I think this spot has unlocked something great. IMO def better that Jack Frost and a contender with Duck Donuts. Thoroughly pleased and quite impressed. Vegan done right!

This place does vegan SO well. The doughnuts were fluffy and delicious. You couldn't even tell the difference between these and a non-vegan. What's even better is they are local and women-owned. Great job ladies!!

Went for a surprise date in Cleveland the other weekend: I wanted to get something new to try and I heard rave reviews about this place. Thankfully it was quiet when we arrived so we didn't have to wait. Most of the donuts had already sold, so there wasn't many left. After carefully deciding of 6 different donuts we took them with us to eat over the course of the next few days. Let me tell you, folks: delicious. Not overwhelmingly sweet or oily, the flavor is honestly really good. I think lemon lavender was my favorite: sweet, with a tart aftertaste and even almost savory! I was a big fan of all of these. I'm not sure if the business is black-owned, but the staff was all Black and I am honestly HERE for more black-owned vegan businesses coming about! Give this place a try, PLEASE.

You guys, VEGAN DOUGHNUTS...like actual doughnuts. My family and I went on Sunday (my birthday), and we got a dozen of mixed flavors. My favorite was the maple coconut bacon flavor, and my boyfriend's favorite was the blueberry. The lemon lavender was unique and tasty as well. The shop is decorated SO cute - I love all the plants. We traveled from an hour away, and we were not disappointed. =] delish!

these are amazing doughnuts, as you can tell from the line out the door when you get there when it opens! they have a lot of options, and they're also super instagrammable! definitely a good stop in Lakewood!

Wife brought these home this morning. Didn't even realize they were vegan. We tried roughly 8 flavors and the lemon lavender were hot fire good, all the rest were pretty outstanding as well. Welcome to the neighborhood!

Such a great addition to Lakewood! These donuts always taste fresh and I love the fun flavors they come up with. I'm not a vegan but haven't really been able to tell the difference in most flavors. Everything is good, service is quick, and they really know what they're doing here!! A must go.

I love The Vegan Doughnut Company! If you didn't know these donuts were vegan, you might never know. I'm not a vegan, but I sought them out once at a festival pre-covid because I wanted to see what the hype was about. I completely understand now why the line was wrapped around the building and up the street. Again, these doughnuts don't have some strange vegan-y aftertaste. To me, they taste just like the real deal, full of gluten-y goodness. My favorite flavor is the Lemon Lavender. These sisters make some truly delightful doughnuts in excellent flavors. You're also supporting a local, non-chain, black-owned biz and some really awesome ladies. I have yet to visit their actual brick-and-mortar in Lakewood, but I certainly plan to once the pandemic improves. Don't wait. Get there early or you'll miss out. Follow them on social media and you'll always be in-the-know on the rotating flavors and status of the shop. Afterall, they sell out regularly! A true Cleveland gem!

I tried this place after reading great reviews on social media sites. I have to say that the reviews were spot on; this place is fantastic. The staff was quite helpful when I went to place my order. I bought a variety of their donuts, and they were all excellent. Definitely call before going because the shop tends to sell out. I cannot wait to go again.

Pretty amazing for a vegan donut and the prices are what are expected for quality of donut. I really enjoyed my donut and will return again. They have plenty of options to more traditional to contemporary. Their is a little park next door with benches if you would like to enjoy the donut right away. I brought mine home to enjoy. The staff was kind and sometimes I see a huge line but today around 10 am I was able to walk right in with plenty to select from.

This is literally my favorite place on planet Earth. I've been following these guys around ever since they were just a pop up shop and every donut has been amazing. The family who runs it is also super friendly. You'll love them too.
The customer service and the donuts were awesome! I traveled from Lake County with my family and it was well worth the trip. The doughnuts were well made and tasty.

Cute little doughnut place in Lakewood. Their prices are reasonable from $2-3. I got the maple cream-filled and glazed twist, and they both taste amazing! If you're lactose-intolerant or just want a quick snack I'd stop by.
Delicious doughnuts, great menu that changes all the time. Better than most donuts I've tried. Friendly staff too.

So doughnuts are one of my favorite foods, and though I'm not vegan, I prefer it if it's available. This place does not disappoint and I struggle not to come here every week! Always a friendly staff, super cute but simple interior (take out only). All the focus on the doughnuts! Strawberry shortcake is one of my favorites, as well as the lemon lavender. It's really hard to get only two.. I also had the Boston cream

Best donuts ever. I'm not even vegan but I can't even taste a regular donut now because it won't be as good. Wow they are so sweet yet not that sweet where it's gonna hurt your teeth. They have sooo many kinds of flavors and I love how they come out with new ones every month. Beware thought because they're not open everyday and when they are they sell out FAST. Like there will be a line out the door and for good reason. And you may not like the prices at first but these are fulling donuts. You're getting your money's worth!

Best donuts I've ever had and I'm not even vegan or remotely close to, HOWEVER, I'm interested in trying more vegan places if they're all as delish. If the line looks long, don't let that discourage you - it moves pretty fast and it's well worth the wait.

They taste even prettier than they look and that says a lot with these prime aesthetics. Started planning my next visit mid-way through the first bite. I would recommend to anyone as the best donuts in CLE. Honestly, this is a short review because the flavors speak for themselves. From the July 2020 menu: Strawberry shortcake, lemon lavender, cookies and cream, 2 x Boston creme, and blueberry cake. If you are decisive--unlike me in this shop--and only want to try one, the Boston creme or blueberry cake would be IT.

Best donuts in Cleveland!!!! Their flavors are always amazing and totally worth the drive if you don't live in the area. I live on the East side but have absolutely no issue making the drive because these donuts are incredible. And the sisters that own the place are the sweetest! They are frequently joined by their parents who help out at the shop who are equally nice :) I cannot emphasize enough how amazing this donut shop is. My only complaint is that I wish they were opened 7 days a week so that I could go every day!
